href="https://automattic.com/wordpress-plugins/">Automattic</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:41:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/automattic";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.6";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:96;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:800;i:4;i:42;i:3;i:10;i:2;i:8;i:1;i:31;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:891;s:15:"support_threads";i:15;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:9;s:10:"downloaded";i:102646662;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-02-19 3:25pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2005-10-20";s:8:"homepage";s:20:"https://akismet.com/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:1059:"<p>Akismet checks your comments and contact form submissions against our global database of spam to prevent your site from publishing malicious content. You can review the comment spam it catches on your blog&#8217;s &#8220;Comments&#8221; admin screen.</p>
<p>Major features in Akismet include:</p>
<ul>
<li>Automatically checks all comments and filters out the ones that look like spam.</li>
<li>Each comment has a status history, so you can easily see which comments were caught or cleared by Akismet and which were spammed or unspammed by a moderator.</li>
<li>URLs are shown in the comment body to reveal hidden or misleading links.</li>
<li>Moderators can see the number of approved comments for each user.</li>
<li>A discard feature that outright blocks the worst spam, saving you disk space and speeding up your site.</li>
</ul>
<p>PS: You&#8217;ll need an <a href="https://akismet.com/get/" rel="nofollow">Akismet.com API key</a> to use it.  Keys are free for personal blogs; paid subscriptions are available for businesses and commercial sites.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:186:"<p>Upload the Akismet plugin to your blog, Activate it, then enter your <a href="https://akismet.com/get/" rel="nofollow">Akismet.com API key</a>.</p>
<p>1, 2, 3: You&#8217;re done!</p>
";s:9:"changelog";s:19356:"<h4>4.0.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 19 February 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added a scheduled task to remove entries in wp_commentmeta that no longer have corresponding comments in wp_comments.</li>
<li>Added a new <code>akismet_batch_delete_count</code> action to the batch delete methods for people who&#8217;d like to keep track of the numbers of records being processed by those methods.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 18 December 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause Akismet to recheck a comment that has already been manually approved or marked as spam.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause Akismet to claim that some comments are still waiting to be checked when no comments are waiting to be checked.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 6 November 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that could prevent some users from connecting Akismet via their Jetpack connection.</li>
<li>Ensured that any pending Akismet-related events are unscheduled if the plugin is deactivated.</li>
<li>Allow some JavaScript to be run asynchronously to avoid affecting page render speeds.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 19 September 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added REST API endpoints for configuring Akismet and retrieving stats.</li>
<li>Increased the minimum supported WordPress version to 4.0.</li>
<li>Added compatibility with comments submitted via the REST API.</li>
<li>Improved the progress indicator on the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 3 August 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Disabled Akismet&#8217;s debug log output by default unless AKISMET_DEBUG is defined.</li>
<li>URL previews now begin preloading when the mouse moves near them in the comments section of wp-admin.</li>
<li>When a comment is caught by the Comment Blacklist, Akismet will always allow it to stay in the trash even if it is spam as well.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing an error from being shown when a site can&#8217;t reach Akismet&#8217;s servers.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 13 July 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Reduced amount of bandwidth used by the URL Preview feature.</li>
<li>Improved the admin UI when the API key is manually pre-defined for the site.</li>
<li>Removed a workaround for WordPress installations older than 3.3 that will improve Akismet&#8217;s compatibility with other plugins.</li>
<li>The number of spam blocked that is displayed on the WordPress dashboard will now be more accurate and updated more frequently.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in the Akismet widget that could cause PHP warnings.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 10 May 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug causing JavaScript errors in some browsers.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 2 May 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Improve performance by only requesting the akismet_comment_nonce option when absolutely necessary.</li>
<li>Fixed two bugs that could cause PHP warnings.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing the &#8220;Remove author URL&#8221; feature from working after a comment was edited using &#8220;Quick Edit.&#8221;</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing the URL preview feature from working after a comment was edited using &#8220;Quick Edit.&#8221;</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 23 February 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Updated the Akismet admin pages with a new clean design.</li>
<li>Fixed bugs preventing the <code>akismet_add_comment_nonce</code> and <code>akismet_update_alert</code> wrapper functions from working properly.</li>
<li>Fixed bug preventing the loading indicator from appearing when re-checking all comments for spam.</li>
<li>Added a progress indicator to the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button.</li>
<li>Added a success message after manually rechecking the Pending queue for spam.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 6 September 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added a WP-CLI module. You can now check comments and recheck the moderation queue from the command line.</li>
<li>Stopped using the deprecated jQuery function <code>.live()</code>.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in <code>remove_comment_author_url()</code> and <code>add_comment_author_url()</code> that could generate PHP notices.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause an infinite loop for sites with very very very large comment IDs.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause the Akismet widget title to be blank.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.11</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 12 May 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button to skip some comments.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could prevent some spam submissions from being sent to Akismet.</li>
<li>Updated all links to use https:// when possible.</li>
<li>Disabled Akismet debug logging unless WP_DEBUG and WP_DEBUG_LOG are both enabled.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.10</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 1 April 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause comments caught as spam to be placed in the Pending queue.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could have resulted in comments that were caught by the core WordPress comment blacklist not to have a corresponding History entry.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could have caused avoidable PHP warnings in the error log.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.9</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 28 March 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Add compatibility with Jetpack so that Jetpack can automatically configure Akismet settings when appropriate.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug preventing some comment data from being sent to Akismet.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.8</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 4 March 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug preventing Akismet from being used with some plugins that rewrite admin URLs.</li>
<li>Reduced the amount of bandwidth used on Akismet API calls</li>
<li>Reduced the amount of space Akismet uses in the database</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause comments caught as spam to be placed in the Pending queue.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.7</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 4 January 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added documentation for the &#8216;akismet_comment_nonce&#8217; filter.</li>
<li>The post-install activation button is now accessible to screen readers and keyboard-only users.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing the &#8220;Remove author URL&#8221; feature from working in WordPress 4.4</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.6</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 14 December 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Improve the notices shown after activating Akismet.</li>
<li>Update some strings to allow for the proper plural forms in all languages.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.5</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 13 October 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Closes a potential XSS vulnerability.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 24 September 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing some users from automatically connecting using Jetpack if they didn&#8217;t have a current Akismet subscription.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause comments caught as spam to be placed in the Pending queue.</li>
<li>Error messages and instructions have been simplified to be more understandable.</li>
<li>Link previews are enabled for all links inside comments, not just the author&#8217;s website link.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 6 July 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Notify users when their account status changes after previously being successfully set up. This should help any users who are seeing blank Akismet settings screens.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 7 June 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Reduced the amount of space Akismet uses in the commentmeta table.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug where some comments with quotes in the author name weren&#8217;t getting history entries</li>
<li>Pre-emptive security improvements to ensure that the Akismet plugin can&#8217;t be used by attackers to compromise a WordPress installation.</li>
<li>Better UI for the key entry field: allow whitespace to be included at the beginning or end of the key and strip it out automatically when the form is submitted.</li>
<li>When deactivating the plugin, notify the Akismet API so the site can be marked as inactive.</li>
<li>Clearer error messages.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 17th March, 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Improvements to the &#8220;Remove comment author URL&#8221; JavaScript</li>
<li>Include the pingback pre-check from the 2.6 branch.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 11th March, 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Use HTTPS by default for all requests to Akismet.</li>
<li>Fix for a situation where Akismet might strip HTML from a comment.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 11th December, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix to make .htaccess compatible with Apache 2.4.</li>
<li>Fix to allow removal of https author URLs.</li>
<li>Fix to avoid stripping part of the author URL when removing and re-adding.</li>
<li>Removed the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button from the &#8220;Trash&#8221; and &#8220;Approved&#8221; queues, where it would have no effect.</li>
<li>Allow automatic API key configuration when Jetpack is installed and connected to a WordPress.com account</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 3rd November, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix for sending the wrong data to delete_comment action that could have prevented old spam comments from being deleted.</li>
<li>Added a filter to disable logging of Akismet debugging information.</li>
<li>Added a filter for the maximum comment age when deleting old spam comments.</li>
<li>Added a filter for the number per batch when deleting old spam comments.</li>
<li>Removed the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button from the Spam folder.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 18th August, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Performance improvements.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could truncate the comment data being sent to Akismet for checking.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 9th July, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Removed dependency on PHP&#8217;s fsockopen function</li>
<li>Fix spam/ham reports to work when reported outside of the WP dashboard, e.g., from Notifications or the WP app</li>
<li>Remove jQuery dependency for comment form JavaScript</li>
<li>Remove unnecessary data from some Akismet comment meta</li>
<li>Suspended keys will now result in all comments being put in moderation, not spam.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 15th April, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Move Akismet to Settings menu</li>
<li>Drop Akismet Stats menu</li>
<li>Add stats snapshot to Akismet settings</li>
<li>Add Akismet subscription details and status to Akismet settings</li>
<li>Add contextual help for each page</li>
<li>Improve Akismet setup to use Jetpack to automate plugin setup</li>
<li>Fix &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; to use AJAX to avoid page timing out</li>
<li>Fix Akismet settings page to be responsive</li>
<li>Drop legacy code</li>
<li>Tidy up CSS and Javascript</li>
<li>Replace the old discard setting with a new &#8220;discard pervasive spam&#8221; feature.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 18th March, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Add ajax paging to the check for spam button to handle large volumes of comments</li>
<li>Optimize javascript and add localization support </li>
<li>Fix bug in link to spam comments from right now dashboard widget</li>
<li>Fix bug with deleting old comments to avoid timeouts dealing with large volumes of comments</li>
<li>Include X-Pingback-Forwarded-For header in outbound WordPress pingback verifications</li>
<li>Add pre-check for pingbacks, to stop spam before an outbound verification request is made</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.9</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 1st August, 2013</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Update &#8216;Already have a key&#8217; link to redirect page rather than depend on javascript</li>
<li>Fix some non-translatable strings to be translatable</li>
<li>Update Activation banner in plugins page to redirect user to Akismet config page</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.8</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 20th January, 2013</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Simplify the activation process for new users</li>
<li>Remove the reporter_ip parameter</li>
<li>Minor preventative security improvements</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.7</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 13th December, 2012</em></p>
<ul>
<li>FireFox Stats iframe preview bug</li>
<li>Fix mshots preview when using https</li>
<li>Add .htaccess to block direct access to files</li>
<li>Prevent some PHP notices</li>
<li>Fix Check For Spam return location when referrer is empty</li>
<li>Fix Settings links for network admins</li>
<li>Fix prepare() warnings in WP 3.5</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.6</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 26th April, 2012</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Prevent retry scheduling problems on sites where wp_cron is misbehaving</li>
<li>Preload mshot previews</li>
<li>Modernize the widget code</li>
<li>Fix a bug where comments were not held for moderation during an error condition</li>
<li>Improve the UX and display when comments are temporarily held due to an error</li>
<li>Make the Check For Spam button force a retry when comments are held due to an error</li>
<li>Handle errors caused by an invalid key</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t retry comments that are too old</li>
<li>Improve error messages when verifying an API key</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.5</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 11th January, 2012</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Add nonce check for comment author URL remove action</li>
<li>Fix the settings link</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 5th January, 2012</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Limit Akismet CSS and Javascript loading in wp-admin to just the pages that need it</li>
<li>Added author URL quick removal functionality</li>
<li>Added mShot preview on Author URL hover</li>
<li>Added empty index.php to prevent directory listing</li>
<li>Move wp-admin menu items under Jetpack, if it is installed</li>
<li>Purge old Akismet comment meta data, default of 15 days</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 8th Febuary, 2011</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Specify the license is GPL v2 or later</li>
<li>Fix a bug that could result in orphaned commentmeta entries</li>
<li>Include hotfix for WordPress 3.0.5 filter issue</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 14th January, 2011</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Properly format the comment count for author counts</li>
<li>Look for super admins on multisite installs when looking up user roles</li>
<li>Increase the HTTP request timeout</li>
<li>Removed padding for author approved count</li>
<li>Fix typo in function name</li>
<li>Set Akismet stats iframe height to fixed 2500px.  Better to have one tall scroll bar than two side by side.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 17th December, 2010</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix a bug that caused the &#8220;Auto delete&#8221; option to fail to discard comments correctly</li>
<li>Remove the comment nonce form field from the &#8216;Akismet Configuration&#8217; page in favor of using a filter, akismet_comment_nonce</li>
<li>Fixed padding bug in &#8220;author&#8221; column of posts screen</li>
<li>Added margin-top to &#8220;cleared by &#8230;&#8221; badges on dashboard</li>
<li>Fix possible error when calling akismet_cron_recheck()</li>
<li>Fix more PHP warnings</li>
<li>Clean up XHTML warnings for comment nonce</li>
<li>Fix for possible condition where scheduled comment re-checks could get stuck</li>
<li>Clean up the comment meta details after deleting a comment</li>
<li>Only show the status badge if the comment status has been changed by someone/something other than Akismet</li>
<li>Show a &#8216;History&#8217; link in the row-actions</li>
<li>Translation fixes</li>
<li>Reduced font-size on author name</li>
<li>Moved &#8220;flagged by&#8230;&#8221; notification to top right corner of comment container and removed heavy styling</li>
<li>Hid &#8220;flagged by&#8230;&#8221; notification while on dashboard</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 7th December, 2010</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Track comment actions under &#8216;Akismet Status&#8217; on the edit comment screen</li>
<li>Fix a few remaining deprecated function calls ( props Mike Glendinning ) </li>
<li>Use HTTPS for the stats IFRAME when wp-admin is using HTTPS</li>
<li>Use the WordPress HTTP class if available</li>
<li>Move the admin UI code to a separate file, only loaded when needed</li>
<li>Add cron retry feature, to replace the old connectivity check</li>
<li>Display Akismet status badge beside each comment</li>
<li>Record history for each comment, and display it on the edit page</li>
<li>Record the complete comment as originally submitted in comment_meta, to use when reporting spam and ham</li>
<li>Highlight links in comment content</li>
<li>New option, &#8220;Show the number of comments you&#8217;ve approved beside each comment author.&#8221;</li>
<li>New option, &#8220;Use a nonce on the comment form.&#8221;</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4.0</h4>

<h4>2.3.0</h4>

<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Plugin herunterladen, entpacken, in den Ordner <code>wp-content/plugins/</code> laden und aktivieren. Oder direkt √ºber den Adminbereich und &#8216;Plugins&#8217; &#8211; &#8216;Installieren&#8217; das Plugin suchen und installieren.</li>
<li>
<p>Das Plugin sollte nun automatisch unter dem Kommentarfeld den Hinweistext anzeigen. Falls nicht, muss im Theme (z.B. comments.php) manuell folgender Code innerhalb des Kommentar-Formulares, innerhalb <code>&lt;form&gt;...&lt;/form&gt;</code> &#8211; da wo der Hinweis erscheinen soll, eingef√ºgt werden:</p>
<pre><code>&lt;?php do_action( 'akismet_privacy_policies' ); ?&gt;
</code></pre>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Der Aufruf muss an der Stelle des Templates statt finden, wo die Ausgabe erscheinen soll.</p>
</p>
<h4>Wo finde ich weitere Informationen zum Thema Datenschutz und Akismet?</h4>
<p>
<p>Wir haben bei WordPress Deutschland einen <a href="http://http://faq.wpde.org/hinweise-zum-datenschutz-beim-einsatz-von-akismet-in-deutschland/" title="FAQ-Artikel zu Akismet" rel="nofollow">FAQ-Artikel</a>.</p>
<p>Rechtsanwalt Thomas Schwenke kl√§rt in einem Artikel auf: <a href="http://spreerecht.de/datenschutz/2011-04/usability-vs-datenschutz-datenschutzrechtliche-einwilligung-ohne-opt-in" rel="nofollow">Usability VS Datenschutz ‚Äì Datenschutzrechtliche Einwilligung ohne Opt-In?</a></p>
</p>

WordPress";}}s:4:"tags";a:3:{s:7:"akismet";s:7:"akismet";s:7:"privacy";s:7:"privacy";s:4:"spam";s:4:"spam";}s:8:"versions";a:5:{s:5:"1.0.0";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/akismet-privacy-policies.1.0.0.zip";s:5:"1.1.0";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/akismet-privacy-policies.1.1.0.zip";s:5:"1.1.1";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/akismet-privacy-policies.1.1.1.zip";s:5:"1.1.2";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/akismet-privacy-policies.1.1.2.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/akismet-privacy-policies.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:1:{s:7:"default";s:68:"https://s.w.org/plugins/geopattern-icon/akismet-privacy-policies.svg";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}}s:14:"codistoconnect";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:73:"WooCommerce Amazon &amp; eBay Integration &#8211; Codisto LINQ by Codisto";s:4:"slug";s:14:"codistoconnect";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.3.6";s:6:"author";s:42:"<a href="https://codisto.com/">Codisto</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/codisto";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.6";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:78;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:8;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:3;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:11;s:15:"support_threads";i:2;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:2;s:10:"downloaded";i:10683;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-12-01 3:55am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2016-03-29";s:8:"homepage";s:44:"http://wordpress.org/plugins/codistoconnect/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:1812:"<p>Sell on Amazon &amp; eBay directly from WooCommerce.</p>
<p>Real time sync of catalog, inventory and orders.</p>
<p>The only full catalog sync native WooCommerce extension for integrating Amazon &amp; eBay.</p>
<p>Amazon &amp; eBay integration is all Codisto does.  By solely focusing on Amazon &amp; eBay integration, Codisto ensures it is the leading provider of SaaS marketplace integration extensions.</p>
<h4>Key Features</h4>
<ul>
<li>Real time, two-way synchronization of product catalog &amp; inventory between WooCommerce &#8211; Amazon &amp; eBay</li>
<li>Orders from Amazon &amp; eBay sent to WooCommerce for efficient fulfilment</li>
<li>Automatic ASIN matching from UPC data</li>
<li>Simply ASIN lookup for non UPC data</li>
<li>Create unique Amazon listings directly from within WooCommerce</li>
<li>Products auto-categorized into most appropriate eBay category</li>
<li>Professional, full editable, mobile optimized template apply to every eBay listing</li>
<li>List on any Amazon and/or eBay marketplace worldwide</li>
<li>Supports multi-account/multi Amazon/eBay marketplace</li>
<li>XpressGrid multi edit for simple management</li>
<li>Order control for sending to WooCommerce</li>
<li>Automatic feedback&amp; shipping tracking on eBay</li>
<li>Domestic and international shipping options</li>
<li>Platform calculated shipping rate support</li>
<li>Supports multi-variant products</li>
<li>CDN for image hosting</li>
<li>Retain sales history of existing eBay listings by mapping to products in WooCommerce</li>
<li>Lightweight plugin design ‚Äì minimal files in WordPress</li>
</ul>
<h4>More Information</h4>
<p>Visit https://codisto.com/connect/ to read more about Codisto LINQ including documentation, installation instructions and pricing.</p>
<p>Pricing starts at $49 USD per month.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:373:"<ol>
<li>Install Codisto LINQ by Codisto either via the WordPress.org plugin repository, or by uploading the files to your server</li>
<li>Choose either ‚ÄúConnect your Amazon/eBay account‚Äù or ‚ÄúEnter your email address‚Äù and follow the setup instructions.</li>
<li>Choose which items you wish to list from the Codisto &gt; Listings screen and click publish</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:3178:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Install Codisto LINQ by Codisto either via the WordPress.org plugin repository, or by uploading the files to your server</li>
<li>Choose either ‚ÄúConnect your Amazon/eBay account‚Äù or ‚ÄúEnter your email address‚Äù and follow the setup instructions.</li>
<li>Choose which items you wish to list from the Codisto &gt; Listings screen and click publish</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>Does Codisto LINQ work with all Amazon &amp; eBay sites?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, it does.</p>
</p>
<h4>What are the requirements to run Codisto LINQ?</h4>
<p>
<p>Codisto LINQ requires a recent version of WordPress (4.2+) with WooCommerce (2.2+) installed. Your server should run on Linux and have PHP 5.3.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does Codisto LINQ just list my products on Amazon/eBay or provide full catalog synchronization?</h4>
<p>
<p>Codisto LINQ is more than just a listing tool. It keeps your whole catalog ‚Äì products, prices, images, descriptions, inventory levels and more in sync with Amazon/eBay in real time. Orders from Amazon/eBay are automatically sent to WooCommerce and inventory reduced in real time so you never oversell on either channel.  Further, you can of course choose which products from your catalog to list.</p>
</p>
<h4>How easy is Codisto LINQ to setup and use?</h4>
<p>
<p>Codisto LINQ was designed for merchants to increase their sales by adding the Amazon &amp; eBay channels for virtually no effort and keep their current WooCommerce fulfilment processes.<br />
This has been achieved by applying the maximum automation to setting up and managing Amazon/eBay. There are many areas of automation from categorizing products on eBay, applying a professional template, upscaling images, UPC/EAN error prevention, automatic tax rate detection for orders and many more.<br />
If you‚Äôre happy with our standard template, eBay best practice selling values e.g. 30 days returns and free shipping, once Codisto LINQ has installed, you can list your entire catalog in just 4 clicks.<br />
Amazon ASIN matches is fully automated if you have UPC data and there is a quick and easy search tool if you don‚Äôt have UPC data. There is no better performing solution that makes it as easy to list on Amazon/eBay anywhere, let alone offer full, real time integration.</p>
</p>
<h4>I already have listed my products on Amazon/eBay. Can Codisto LINQ import them to WooCommerce?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, Codisto LINQ is designed to let WooCommerce be the ‚Äúsource of true‚Äù ‚Äì you contine to manage your products in WordPress ‚Äì and use Codisto LINQ to manage which products and how they are listed on Amazon/eBay.<br />
But it is possible to map existing Amazon/eBay listings to products in WooCommerce once they are in WooCommerce with the ‚Äòmap products‚Äô function.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does Codisto LINQ support auction style listings?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, Codisto LINQ is designed for merchants with catalogs who want to create fixed price, good til cancelled listings.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are there any more FAQ?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, there are! Please check out our growing knowledgebase at <a href="http://help.codisto.com/" rel="nofollow">http://help.codisto.com/</a></p>
</p>

ct.1.3.5.zip";s:5:"1.3.6";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/codistoconnect.1.3.6.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/codistoconnect.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:67:"https://ps.w.org/codistoconnect/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1699472";s:2:"2x";s:67:"https://ps.w.org/codistoconnect/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1699472";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}}s:31:"dhl-woocommerce-shipping-method";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:31:"DHL WooCommerce Shipping Method";s:4:"slug";s:31:"dhl-woocommerce-shipping-method";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.0.4";s:6:"author";s:47:"<a href="http://www.xadapter.com/">XAdapter</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/wooforce";s:8:"requires";s:5:"3.0.1";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.6";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:100;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:8;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:0;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:8;s:15:"support_threads";i:8;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:6;s:10:"downloaded";i:33349;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2018-04-26 10:48am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-07-27";s:8:"homepage";s:82:"https://www.xadapter.com/product/woocommerce-dhl-shipping-plugin-with-print-label/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:4393:"<p>DHL WooCommerce Shipping plugin helps WooCommerce based stores to streamline DHL Express shipping integration. This plugin helps you to get shipping rates from DHL APIs based on product weight, post code and other relevant details. Based on the postal codes and other parameters, all available shipping services along with the rates are listed for the customers to choose from.</p>
<h4>Integrates WooCommerce to DHL Express</h4>
<p>Once DHL WooCommerce Shipping plugin is installed and configured with necessary information (please visit installation section for more info), your WordPress/WooCommerce Shop will be ready to ship using DHL Express. This plugin will add DHL shipping method as one of the shipping methods in WooCommerce.</p>
<h4>Calculate shipping rates dynamically</h4>
<p>While checking out, a customer is presented with the available shipping services and the rates based on his/her postal code, product weight and dimensions. Customer can choose the best method that matches his/her requirements and proceed to payment.</p>
<h4>Premium version video demo</h4>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/M2b_fUICqNw?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span>
<blockquote>
<h3>Premium version Features</h3>
<p><a href="https://www.xadapter.com/product/woocommerce-dhl-shipping-plugin-with-print-label/" rel="nofollow">Premium version</a> of DHL Plugin features print label using DHL Express, DHL Paket &amp; DHL eCommerce.</p>
<h4>DHL Express Premium Features:</h4>
<ul>
<li>Print shipping label with Postage.</li>
<li>Return Label.</li>
<li>Commercial Invoice.</li>
<li>Archive Air Waybill.</li>
<li>Create &amp; Delete shipments in Bulk.</li>
<li>Use the paperless trade feature and get a commercial invoice from DHL.</li>
<li>Auto Shipment Tracking: Tracking info will be available to the customer while generating the label.</li>
<li>Box packing with DHL boxes and Custom boxes.</li>
<li>Enable/disable, edit the names of services and add handling costs to shipping services.</li>
</ul>
<h4>DHL Paket Premium Features:</h4>
<ul>
<li>Print shipping label with Postage.</li>
<li>Create Manifest.</li>
<li>Return Label.</li>
<li>Cash on Delivery.</li>
<li>Shipment Tracking.</li>
<li>Bulk Creation/Deletion of shipments.</li>
<li>DHL Europaket Compatibility.</li>
<li>Packstation Compatibility.</li>
<li>Box Packing using predefined box sizes available for DHL Paket.</li>
</ul>
<h4>DHL eCommerce Premium Features:</h4>
<ul>
<li>Print shipping label with Postage.</li>
<li>Box Packing.</li>
<li>Diverse Range of Services.</li>
<li>Shipment Tracking.</li>
</ul>
<p> * Timely compatibility updates and bug fixes.<br />
 * Premium support!</p>
<p><a href="https://www.xadapter.com/product/woocommerce-dhl-shipping-plugin-with-print-label/" rel="nofollow">Upgrade to Pro!</a>
</p></blockquote>
<h4>About DHL Express</h4>
<p>DHL Express is a division of the German logistics company Deutsche Post DHL providing international courier, parcel and express mail services. Deutsche Post DHL is the world&#8217;s largest logistics company operating around the world, particularly in sea and air mail.</p>
<p>The Deutsche Post AG, operating under the trade name Deutsche Post DHL Group, is a German postal service and international courier service company, the world&#8217;s largest. The postal division delivers 59 million letters each day in Germany, making it Europe&#8217;s largest such company. The Express division (DHL) provides services in 220 countries.</p>
<h4>About DHL Paket</h4>
<p>DHL Paket is the easy, affordable, fast and reliable shipping service to over 220 countries around the world.</p>
<h4>About DHL eCommerce</h4>
<p>DHL eCommerce provides standard domestic and international parcel pick-up, delivery and return solutions for business customers as well as e-commerce logistics and facilitation services.</p>
<h4>About XAdapter.com</h4>
<p><a href="https://www.xadapter.com/" rel="nofollow">XAdapter.com</a> creates quality WordPress/WooCommerce plugins that are easy to use and customize. We are proud to have thousands of customers actively using our plugins across the globe.</p>

<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the ‚Äò/wp-content/plugins/‚Äô directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the ‚ÄòPlugins‚Äô menu in WordPress.</li>
<li>Thats it ‚Äì you can now configure the plugin.</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>After the setup, my site is still saying ‚ÄúThere doesn‚Äòt seem to be any available shipping methods‚Äù.</h4>
<p>
<p>You can enable developer mode in settings and debug messages will start showing up in cart/checkout page, from which you will get a clue what is the issue about. Hope DHL shipping method is enabled. Product dimensions and weight is configured correctly.</p>
</p>

can customize the form and the mail contents flexibly with simple markup. The form supports Ajax-powered submitting, CAPTCHA, Akismet spam filtering and so on.</p>
<h4>Docs &amp; Support</h4>
<p>You can find <a href="https://contactform7.com/docs/" rel="nofollow">docs</a>, <a href="https://contactform7.com/faq/" rel="nofollow">FAQ</a> and more detailed information about Contact Form 7 on <a href="https://contactform7.com/" rel="nofollow">contactform7.com</a>. If you were unable to find the answer to your question on the FAQ or in any of the documentation, you should check the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/contact-form-7/" rel="nofollow">support forum</a> on WordPress.org. If you can&#8217;t locate any topics that pertain to your particular issue, post a new topic for it.</p>
<h4>Contact Form 7 Needs Your Support</h4>
<p>It is hard to continue development and support for this free plugin without contributions from users like you. If you enjoy using Contact Form 7 and find it useful, please consider <a href="https://contactform7.com/donate/" rel="nofollow"><strong>making a donation</strong></a>. Your donation will help encourage and support the plugin&#8217;s continued development and better user support.</p>
<h4>Recommended Plugins</h4>
<p>The following plugins are recommended for Contact Form 7 users:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/flamingo/">Flamingo</a> by Takayuki Miyoshi &#8211; With Flamingo, you can save submitted messages via contact forms in the database.</li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/bogo/">Bogo</a> by Takayuki Miyoshi &#8211; Bogo is a straight-forward multilingual plugin that doesn&#8217;t cause headaches.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Translations</h4>
<p>You can <a href="https://contactform7.com/translating-contact-form-7/" rel="nofollow">translate Contact Form 7</a> on <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/contact-form-7" rel="nofollow"><strong>translate.wordpress.org</strong></a>.</p>

<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Upload the entire <code>contact-form-7</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
</ol>
<p>You will find &#8216;Contact&#8217; menu in your WordPress admin panel.</p>
<p>For basic usage, you can also have a look at the <a href="https://contactform7.com/" rel="nofollow">plugin web site</a>.</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:2270:"<p>For more information, see <a href="https://contactform7.com/category/releases/" rel="nofollow">Releases</a>.</p>
<h4>5.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed incorrect uses of _n().</li>
<li>Config validation: Fixed incorrect count of alerts in the Additional Settings tab panel.</li>
<li>Config validation: Fixed improper treatment for the [_site_admin_email] special mail-tag in the From mail header field.</li>
<li>Acceptance checkbox: The class and id attributes specified were applied to the wrong HTML element.</li>
<li>Config validation: When there is an additional mail header for mailboxes like Cc or Reply-To, but it has a possible empty value, ‚ÄúInvalid mailbox syntax is used‚Äù error will be returned.</li>
<li>Explicitly specify the fourth parameter of add_action() to avoid passing unintended parameter values.</li>
<li>Check if the target directory is empty before removing the directory.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Additional settings: on_sent_ok and on_submit have been removed.</li>
<li>New additional setting: skip_mail</li>
<li>Flamingo: Inbound channel title changes in conjunction with a change in the title of the corresponding contact form.</li>
<li>DOM events: Make an entire API response object accessible through the event.detail.apiResponse property.</li>
<li>HTML mail: Adds language-related attributes to the HTML header.</li>
<li>File upload: Sets the accept attribute to an uploading field.</li>
<li>Introduces the WPCF7_MailTag class.</li>
<li>Allows aborting a mail-sending attempt using the wpcf7_before_send_mail action hook. Also, you can set a custom status and a message through the action hook.</li>
<li>Acceptance checkbox: Allows the specifying of a statement of conditions in the form-tag‚Äôs content part.</li>
<li>Acceptance checkbox: Supports the optional option.</li>
<li>New special mail tags: [_site_title], [_site_description], [_site_url], [_site_admin_email], [_invalid_fields], [_user_login], [_user_email], [_user_url], [_user_first_name], [_user_last_name], [_user_nickname], and [_user_display_name]</li>
<li>New filter hooks: wpcf7_upload_file_name, wpcf7_autop_or_not, wpcf7_posted_data_{$type}, and wpcf7_mail_tag_replaced_{$type}</li>
<li>New form-tag features: zero-controls-container and not-for-mail</li>
</ul>

Analytics Plugin for WordPress</h4>
<p>We believe that you shouldn&#8217;t have to hire a developer to add Google Analytics to your website. That&#8217;s why we built <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteversion" title="MonsterInsights" rel="friend nofollow">MonsterInsights</a>, a complete Google Analytics for WordPress plugin that&#8217;s EASY and POWERFUL.</p>
<p>MonsterInsights allow you to connect your WordPress website with Google Analytics, so you can see how visitors find and use your website, so you can keep them coming back. Simply put, we show you the stats that matter.</p>
<p>With almost 15 million downloads, MonsterInsights is the most popular Google Analytics plugin for WordPress.</p>
<p>At MonsterInsights, user experience is our #1 priority. That&#8217;s why we make it extremely easy for you to connect and view your Google Analytics reports from inside your WordPress dashboard. Our tracking settings and workflows make MonsterInsights the most beginner friendly google analytics plugin in the market.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>MonsterInsights Pro</strong><br />
  This plugin is the lite version of the MonsterInsights Pro plugin that comes with all the analytics features you will ever need including ads tracking, ecommerce tracking, custom dimensions tracking, popular post tracing, events tracking, and tons more. <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteversion" title="MonsterInsights" rel="friend nofollow">Click here to purchase the best Google Analytics plugin for WordPress now!</a></p>
</blockquote>
<p>We took the pain out of connecting with Google Analytics and made it easy. Here&#8217;s why over 1 million smart business owners, designers, and developers love MonsterInsights, and you will too!</p>

<h4>Quick &amp; Easy Google Analytics Setup</h4>
<p>Easily setup Google Analytics on your site without touching any code. If you can point-and-click, then you can use MonsterInsights.</p>
<p>Google Analytics for WordPress plugin by MonsterInsights allows you to track your blog visitors easily and always stays up to date with the newest features in Google Analytics.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>It just works. Really easy way to insert Google Analytics tracking code and keep it there when switching themes. No need to copy/paste code anywhere. This is the best way to handle Google Analytics in WordPress.<br />
  Steven Gliebe</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Google Analytics Dashboard + Real Time Stats</h4>
<p>MonsterInsights makes analytics easy. You can see your site‚Äôs performance at a glance with our Google Analytics Dashboard right inside your WordPress admin area.</p>
<p>With Google Analytics, there&#8217;s no need to wait till the next day to find out about traffic spikes or potential problems. You can get real time stats, so you can unlock the maximum potential revenue for each customer.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>Works everytime! This plugin has worked with every version of WordPress I‚Äôve ever used. Very reliable.<br />
  Vineeta</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Universal Tracking + Page Level Analytics</h4>
<p>MonsterInsights uses universal tracking, so you can track your users across devices and platforms. With demographics and interest reports, you also get a better understanding of your audience.</p>
<p>The page level analytics show you exactly which pages and sections on your website are the most popular.</p>
<p>You can also see how the users are finding your website, so you can better focus your marketing efforts.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>Analytics for PROs! This plugin brings it all, great features and helpful info to easily see what you are doing.<br />
  Frank van der Sluijs</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>eCommerce and Ads Tracking</h4>
<p>MonsterInsights Ecommerce addon helps you add Google Analytics Ecommerce tracking to your WordPress WooCommerce and Easy Digital Downloads store.</p>
<p>You can add eCommerce tracking with literally 1 click, and start tracking popular products, average order value, ecommerce conversion rate, and more.</p>
<p>With our Ads tracking addon, publishers can easily track the performance of their Google Adsense inside their Google Analytics dashboard.</p>
<h4>Custom Dimensions, Events Tracking, and More</h4>
<p>MonsterInsights allow you to take full advantage of all the powerful Google Analytics features such as custom dimensions, file download tracking, outbound link tracking, events tracking, performance tracking, and more.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>I like how simple it is for client users and how I can turn on the advanced features for myself to get all the details right.<br />
  Skip Shean</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Full MonsterInsights Feature List</h4>
<ul>
<li>Quick and Easy Setup &#8211; Easily setup Google Analytics for WordPress with just a few clicks (no coding needed)</li>
<li>Real Time Stats &#8211; See real time stats inside your Google Analytics dashboard.</li>
<li>Universal Tracking &#8211; Get better insights with Google Analytics&#8217; universal tracking.</li>
<li>Google Analytics Dashboard &#8211; See the stats that matter from right inside your WordPress dashboard.</li>
<li>Ecommerce Tracking &#8211; Add Google Analytics tracking for WooCommerce and Easy Digital Downloads store.</li>
<li>Ads Tracking &#8211; Track your Google Adsense ads with Google Analytics.</li>
<li>File Download Tracking &#8211; Enable file download stats with just a click.</li>
<li>Link Tracking &#8211; Track your outbound link clicks with Google Analytics.</li>
<li>Events Tracking &#8211; Track custom button and banner clicks with Google Analytics.</li>
<li>Custom Dimensions Tracking &#8211; Enable Google analytics custom dimensions tracking for WordPress.</li>
<li>Author Tracking &#8211; See who&#8217;s the most popular author with Author tracking.</li>
<li>Popular Post Tracking &#8211; See which blog post and section is the most popular.</li>
<li>Custom Post Type Tracking &#8211; Track the performance of your custom post types.</li>
<li>Referral Tracking &#8211; See how visitors are finding your website to better focus your marketing efforts.</li>
<li>Performance Tracking &#8211; Control the performance rate and sample rate for your Google Analytics report.</li>
<li>Enhanced Link Attribution &#8211; Get better analytics with enhanced link attribution.</li>
<li>Google Analytics Tools &#8211; Helpful tools for Google analytics.</li>
<li>Want us to add something else? Suggest a feature and we&#8217;ll get it added!</li>
</ul>
<blockquote>
<p>Simple, yet powerful. Amazing piece of plugin, does exactly what expected and even more.<br />
  Matt Jaworski</p>

<h4>Note for Beginners</h4>
<p>Like all WordPress plugins, Google Analytics by MonsterInsights is only available for self-hosted WordPress sites. This means you will need to <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-tutorials/how-to-properly-move-your-blog-from-wordpress-com-to-wordpress-org/" title="How to properly move from WordPress.com to WordPress.org" rel="friend nofollow">switch from WordPress.com to WordPress.org</a> if you want to use this plugin on your WordPress site.</p>
<p>For more details, see this infographic on <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/self-hosted-wordpress-org-vs-free-wordpress-com-infograph/" title="Self Hosted WordPress.org vs Free WordPress.com" rel="friend nofollow">self hosted WordPress.org vs free WordPress.com</a></p>

";s:12:"installation";s:715:"<ol>
<li>Install Google Analytics for WordPress by MonsterInsights either via the WordPress.org plugin repository or by uploading the files to your server. (See instructions on <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/step-by-step-guide-to-install-a-wordpress-plugin-for-beginners/" rel="friend nofollow">how to install a WordPress plugin</a>)</li>
<li>Activate Google Analytics for WordPress by MonsterInsights.</li>
<li>Navigate to the Insights tab in your WordPress admin menu and configure the plugin.</li>
<li>Want more features? <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteversion" rel="nofollow">Purchase MonsterInsights Pro</a>!</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:932:"<p>For all frequently asked questions, and their answers, check the <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/docs/" rel="nofollow">MonsterInsights Knowledge base</a>.</p>

<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Install Google Analytics for WordPress by MonsterInsights either via the WordPress.org plugin repository or by uploading the files to your server. (See instructions on <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/step-by-step-guide-to-install-a-wordpress-plugin-for-beginners/" rel="friend nofollow">how to install a WordPress plugin</a>)</li>
<li>Activate Google Analytics for WordPress by MonsterInsights.</li>
<li>Navigate to the Insights tab in your WordPress admin menu and configure the plugin.</li>
<li>Want more features? <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteversion" rel="nofollow">Purchase MonsterInsights Pro</a>!</li>
</ol>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:32335:"<h4>7.0.6: May 14, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Better handling of link tracking for links embedded as anchor tags inside of an SVG image.</li>
<li>Tweak: Link tracking has been updated to enforce more strict type checks on variables.</li>
<li>Tweak: Plugin conflict notice has been updated to use the actual name of the plugin.</li>
<li>Tweak: Compatibility fixes for users of the Ken, Vitrine, Artisian Nayma,Grand News, Tie and Church Suite Themes along with the WooCommerce bolder product alerts, Selz eCommerce and Artisian Pages plugin.</li>
<li>Tweak: Fixed &#8220;you you&#8221; typo on the Reports page notice.</li>
<li>Tweak: On the overview report the indicator icon colors for bounce rate have been flipped to more accurately describe the impact (ie green = bounce rate going down = good).</li>
<li>Fixed: Undefined $tracking variable error.</li>
<li>Fixed: Better type checking before converting number strings to human readable dates on reprots.</li>
<li>Fixed: If GA didn&#8217;t load and link tracking was enabled, an undefined Javascript error could occur if the fallback object didn&#8217;t get set (edgecase).</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.5: April 9, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Introduced a system (behind-the-scenes) that automatically attempts to correct for improperly set timezones in the WordPress settings panel, server timezone settings and/or GA profile timezones. This should eliminate issues with timezones on Lite user accounts, as well as allow for more accurate date reporting.</li>
<li>New: Introduced a system (behind-the-scenes) to allow for deauthentication of profiles set on websites whose profiles were migrated (for example from a staging site to a production site)</li>
<li>Tweak: Made clientID retrieval more efficient.</li>
<li>Fixed: Several translation/textdomain and typo fixes.</li>
<li>Fixed: Undefined $num in the overview report.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.4: March 7, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: We&#8217;ve added links to the pages listed in the top pages part of the Overview report to make it easier to see which page each title belongs to.</li>
<li>New: We&#8217;ve added the UA code to the account selector to make it easier to determine which property to use.</li>
<li>New: Better compatibility with IE11.</li>
<li>New: The links to view more reporting data now default to the currently selected daterange when you go to analytics.google.com</li>
<li>Fixed: We&#8217;ve corrected some missing closing li tags on the overview report.</li>
<li>Fixed: We fixed an issue where get_current_screen might be undefined on some pages.</li>
<li>Fixed: We fixed an issue where some improperly configured servers might resolve symlinks that are not supposed to be resolved, leading to issues with loading asset files MonsterInsights uses.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.3: February 28, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: We added support for tracking download files that have a cache busting variable on the URL.</li>
<li>New: We added support for the new UserID mode used in our AMP addon.</li>
<li>Tweak: We fixed a bug with the notices class, and drastically cut back on the number of them.</li>
<li>Fixed: We fixed a bug with our Facebook Instant Articles addon that prevented some users from being tracked for downloads.</li>
<li>Fixed: We fixed a bug in the usage tracking for some types of installs.</li>
<li>Fixed: We&#8217;ve allowed the disabling of tracking for admininistrator role users on single sites.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.2: February 27, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Fixed a bug with the analytics.js output where a UA code wasn&#8217;t entered, the $reason variable could be undefined.</li>
<li>Fixed: Fixed an issue where a notice might not be dismissable and we&#8217;ve also removed several of them.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.1: February 26, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Support for the updated version of MonsterInsights AMP plugin which switches from using a custom REST endpoint to using the now built in Google AMP ClientID synching feature. If you&#8217;re using the AMP addon, you&#8217;ll want to also update that addon as well.</li>
<li>New: The __gaTracker and disable tracking functions will always be defined, even when we&#8217;re not tracking users (for example if viewing a preview, or if a logged-in administrator) to allow sites to not have to worry about breakage when variable exist checking isn&#8217;t done. </li>
<li>New: We now output a notice in the console and output the GA code (though do not run it) when we&#8217;re not tracking someone. This makes it easier to verify the Google code is indeed outputting, and also makes it more clear as to why a particular user isn&#8217;t being tracked. Note, when testing Google Analytics code, always do it logged out, ideally in the private browsing/incognito mode of your web browser. We&#8217;re going to keep working on improving the frontend system to simplify it and add new features for both Lite and Pro users now that we&#8217;ve jettisoned ga.js support in MonsterInsights 7.0. You&#8217;ll see updates through the year that add new tracking features, particularly ones that we&#8217;re tweaking in order to expand and refine our built-in reporting.</li>
<li>New: We added a &#8220;have a MonsterInsights license&#8221; link on the settings panel, to make it clearer the procedure for the quick and easy upgrade from MonsterInsights Lite to MonsterInsights Pro.</li>
<li>Tweak: We removed the phrase referencing the dashboard (removed in MonsterInsights 7.0) from the permissions settings.</li>
<li>Fixed: Due to us forgetting to include our jQuery shim for disable() in the Lite, some users were unable to use the 10/25/50 expand feature on the reports page.</li>
<li>Fixed: An accidental use of the PHP function date instead of the one called time meant that some users were unable to see updated reporting data each day in the Lite version.</li>
<li>Fixed: In sitei() in the api-auth class, we used mb_strimwidth to trim the final string to 30 characters. While this is a great PHP function, not all servers have the mbstring (Multibyte String) PHP extension installed, from which all mb_* functions are provided, despite it being a &#8220;required&#8221; PHP extension to use WordPress core. This caused some servers to be unable to authenticate and thus get our amazing new reports (sad face). This usage has been replaced with a standard substr use, thus allowing for compatibility with all servers.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.0: February 20, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Completely revamped reports with a new UI.</li>
<li>New: Ability to oAuth at the network level, and have that oAuth apply as the default to all subsites (can still override at a subsite level).</li>
<li>New: Ability to enter a license key at the network level, and have that oAuth apply as the default to all subsites (can still override at a subsite level).</li>
<li>New: Completely new oAuth flow, that handles more errors and allows for future growth. Importantly, your existing sites will continue to track (the UA code is manually moved in the upgrade process), but you will need to re-authenticate (a quicker, and even easier process in 7.0) to enable our all new reporting area. New permissions requested to allow for significantly expanded reporting (and some upcoming reports).</li>
<li>New: Ability to see the site traffic graphs in both pageviews and sessions.</li>
<li>New: You can now choose between Last 30 days, Last 7 days, or any date range of your choosing if you&#8217;re a paid MonsterInsights user!</li>
<li>New: Compare site traffic to the previous period.</li>
<li>New: Completely revamped overview report. You&#8217;ll find lots of new data has been added. Also, all of that data changes as you use change the date ranges (a Pro exclusive feature).</li>
<li>New: A brand new eCommerce report for Pro users</li>
<li>New: A brand new Search Console/Queries report for paid MonsterInsights users. This allows you to see which terms you are ranking for on Google and how Google searches are driving your site traffic, along with clickthrough rates.</li>
<li>New: A brand new Publishers report for Plus level users allowing you to see breakdown of important site metrics.</li>
<li>New: A lot of behind the scenes work enabling more reports to be added in the future. Stay on the lookout as we start significantly expanding the breadth and depth of reporting this year.</li>
<li>New: A revised general settings panel which is significantly faster to load.</li>
<li>New: Significant performance improvements. We completely top-to-bottom audited MonsterInsights. It&#8217;s now 286% faster in the admin and 161% faster in the frontend.</li>
<li>New: Completely new internal notification handling has been implemented. This should make it clearer if you need to address anything, and if so make it less tedious to figure out exactly what.</li>
<li>Tweak: We&#8217;ve changed the verbage for what users see if they are logged in as a site administrator on the frontend to make it more clear MonsterInsights doesn&#8217;t track site administrators to prevent them from skewing their own Google Analytics data (particularly demographics data) and to encourage them to use the Incognito Mode/Private browsing mode of their web browser (or log out) if they want to view the Google Analytics code.</li>
<li>Tweak: The URL used for the measurement protocol calls has been updated per Google guidance.</li>
<li>Tweak: We&#8217;ve discovered some strings that weren&#8217;t translatable, and fixed that.</li>
<li>Tweak: Based on your feedback, we&#8217;ve clarified the titles and descriptions used in some of the settings to make it more clear as to what they do.</li>
<li>Tweak: When first adding a license key, in rare cases sometimes the addons permissions didn&#8217;t sync. While extremely rare, and while MonsterInsights would automatically fix itself within 6 hours, we&#8217;ve added a system that eliminates this from happening, and made sure that there&#8217;s also a way to fix this manually if this need arises.</li>
<li>Tweak: The countries map has been changed to a countries list (sorted). This means we can remove jVectorMap which had some issues in mapping, and also make it easier for you to see your top countries data.</li>
<li>Removed: Support for the long deprecated ga.js tracking has been removed. We&#8217;ve had dismissable (and then later non-dismissable) persistent admin notices for over a year now, and it&#8217;s time to remove support for these finally. Analytics.js tracking is far more accurate than ga.js tracking. Users of ga.js were not able to take advantage of new MonsterInsights features and Google Analytics features that relied on analytics.js, including our out-of-the-box Javascript based events tracking system, and many other features (like enhanced eCommerce tracking in our eCommerce addon). Google themselves deprecated ga.js over 5 years ago. On update, we&#8217;ll automatically move those using ga.js to analytics.js. This switch requires no changes on behalf of the site owner.</li>
<li>Removed: Support for the long deprecated PHP events tracking has been removed. We&#8217;ve had dismissable (and then later non-dismissable) persistent admin notices for over a year now offering a 1 click update. The PHP events tracking, a stayover from the Yoast years, caused a lot of issues and couldn&#8217;t track everything on a page. It could only track things in specific WordPress areas like the_content and widgets, but couldn&#8217;t track anything outside of that, or things that were added to the DOM after WordPress rendered the page. Our JS events tracking system can track all-the-things on all parts of a page, and is far more accurate and easier for us to maintain. Maintaining a gigantic PHP regex-based system took a lot of our development time up, and based on our opt-in tracking data, almost no one uses it anymore (which is good, because JS tracking is so much better). Users still using it will be automatically switched to JS events tracking on update (which requires no changes to switch to using it).</li>
<li>Removed: Many deprecated filters from the Yoast era have been removed. After maintaining backwards compatibility for over a year now, and also issuing a notice every time those deprecated filters were used, it&#8217;s time to pull the plug on these to allow our tracking system to be able to be simplified in the future. We have a complete document in our documentation for the 6.0 release that details exactly how to update for each of these filters.</li>
</ul>

<li>Tweak: Introduce scrollbars on GA auth screen for users with many Google accounts</li>
<li>Tweak: Added notice to users still on deprecated GA.js tracking and PHP-based events tracking.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with notices having multiple icons has been resolved.</li>
<li>Fixed: Facebook Instant Articles can now properly handle the Automattic Facebook plugin transformation changes (requires FB IA addon version 1.0.1 or newer)</li>

<li>Fixed: Correct level for Forms and Google Optimize addons.</li>

</ul>

<li>Tweak: Deleting lite plugin will no longer delete license key of installed pro version.</li>
<li>Fixed: Import/export settings page has been fixed so that on sites with a ton of plugins installed that make lots of admin bar items, the admin bar will have relative positioning now to allow it to be scrollable.</li>
<li>Fixed: Users with more than 1 property for the same domain name can now use any of the views for those properties.</li>
<li>Fixed: For Pro users, sometimes all available addons for your license level didn&#8217;t show, requiring you to download them from our site. This has been corrected.</li>

</ul>

</ul>
<h4>6.1.1 &#8211; 6.1.3 (depending on which version of MI you have), March 22, 2017</h4>
<ul>

</ul>
<h4>6.1.0, March 22, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Campaign URL building tool with shortlink capability.</li>
<li>New: Settings import/export tool.</li>
<li>New: Experimental (beta) hash tracking for single-page style themes. Note, as the description for the setting says, this feature is a beta feature, and can be tweaked or removed in upcoming versions.</li>
<li>New: Manual default subsite UA&#8217;s can now be set from the network settings panel for MonsterInsights.</li>
<li>New: Optout of GA tracking is now enabled per Google standard. See https://github.com/awesomemotive/google-analytics-for-wordpress/issues/488 for more information.</li>
<li>Tweak: Notices about JS conflicts now include the JS error when possible.</li>
<li>Tweak: Some tweaking to when the &#8220;Connection error with Google&#8221; error is displayed during oAuth.</li>
<li>Tweak: Notice now shown when too early to display statistics from Google.</li>
<li>Tweak: Inbound as outbound links may now have a period in them.</li>
<li>Tweak: Removed duplicate option checking on frontend.</li>
<li>Tweak: oAuth dialog now only programically closes when the select profile view is shown or when a new one is opened.</li>
<li>Tweak: Mailto links are now handled as an externally opening link, allowing to bypass issues with the Safari browser not following standards.</li>
<li>Tweak: WP-Admin Login page tracking has been removed.</li>
<li>Tweak: More countries now shown in the country map in the overview report.</li>
<li>Tweak: License key field is no longer shown on lite installs.</li>
<li>Tweak: Frontend JS file has been refactored to make it more unit testable.</li>
<li>Fixed: Download events now correctly include data in all cases not just some.</li>
<li>Fixed: A syntax error involving the manual UA code input has been resolved that could have affected some users under a rare circumstance.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.16, March 7, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Issues related to link tracking.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.15, March 7, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Issue with translation string numbering in the disabled user group frontend template.</li>
<li>Fixed: Resolved issue that caused issue with lightbox-style redirects.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where admin pages had JS issues from mis-ordered JS files.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.14, March 1, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Allow for invalid license to be removed if debug turned on.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issues with internal links being tracked as internal-as-outbound</li>
<li>Fixed: Issues with tracking of downloads</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where optin tracking would opt-out on settings panel save</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.13, February 28, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Better detection of issues with authentication due to an outdate WP version.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where JS tracking inadvertantly turned on debug mode due to a bad string to boolean conversion.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.12, February 27, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: The JS events tracking has been moved to a new JS file instead of inline. This will offer the same performance as inlining under HTTP/2, but with the benefit of better cache bursting.</li>
<li>New: Expanded admin adblock detection.</li>
<li>Tweak: Select2 is now bundled as Select300 in MonsterInsights. We&#8217;re pulling down the latest copy of Selct2 and then on-the-fly renaming it. This should end any conflicts between our select2 boxes and other plugins/themes.</li>
<li>Tweak: We&#8217;ve implemented better error detection on the authentication flow. Some users may have previously seen &#8220;No profile errors&#8221;, due to issues with their server setup will now see more accurate errors.</li>
<li>Tweak: For servers that use PHP Object caching, the cache will now be flushed during the uninstall routines. This should solve a very rare uninstall error.</li>
<li>Fixed: A &#8220;Invalid UA code&#8221; error was displayed whenever someone used oAuth2 and then saved the settings panel, despite having a valid UA code.</li>
<li>Fixed: An issue with the lazyloading of the Google Client for frontend use has been fixed.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.11, February 24, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Notice: Version numbers 6.0.5 &#8211; 6.0.10 were not used, as we&#8217;re synching the version numbers of the Lite and Pro versions of our plugin. You didn&#8217;t miss any updates.</li>
<li>Notice: As of this release, we no longer backport changes to the old <code>yst_ga</code> option. If you need to access MonsterInsights&#8217;s settings programically, please use our helper functions. Do not directly access a option.</li>
<li>New: Redesigned authentication dropdown that shows the site urls to make it easier to find a profile when the users have many accounts.</li>
<li>New: Tracking is now enabled for the WordPress admin login page (wp-login.php).</li>
<li>Tweak: The Google class in the admin now only checks for blocking when the reauth is attempted. Expect to save a ton of external calls in the admin, and maybe a performance boost.</li>
<li>Tweak: The GA client object is now lazyloaded on the frontend, so it&#8217;s loaded only when something (like another plugin) attempts to use it. In plain English, this will make a alot of sites load times significantly improve.</li>
<li>Tweak: The analytics.js output has been tweaked to be slightly more asthetically pleasing (its aligned correctly). We realize no one probably cares but we look at this code for every user we support, so it help us. </li>
<li>Tweak: The config expired notice has been updated to reflect that it can also be shown if the server is blocking MonsterInsights&#8217;s ability to connect to Google Analytics.</li>
<li>Tweak: The cron jobs for opt-in tracking and statistics have been combined into a single cron.</li>
<li>Tweak: Various performance improvements in the frontend output class.</li>
<li>Tweak: A notice is now shown when MonsterInsights rejects a manual UA code from being saved for being an invalid format.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where the plugin TweetShare would prevent users from being able to see their properties in the authentication dropdown.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where the manual UA code might not be ported as we were backporting changes to the monsterinsights_settings option to the yst_ga option for backwards compatibility. This lead to a situation where the new settings would override the old ones before the routine to fix the manual UA code issue had run.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where a fatal error from a reference to a class called &#8220;Yoast_Frontend_GA&#8221; which our plugin doesn&#8217;t have or use, would be shown caused by the previous Yoast usage of object caching via an autoloader. This is solved by doing a 1 time object cache flush on upgrade.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where if you had more than 1000 profiles on your Google account, not all would be shown.</li>
<li>Fixed: App analytics properties are now excluded from the dropdown of properties you can authenticate to.</li>
<li>Fixed: The readme suggested a filter to use for filtering the UA to use, but the filter name was typo&#8217;d. This has been fixed.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where the tracking cron would add a new unique cron each day.</li>
<li>Fixed: We implemented a routine to cleanup those extra crons as well as the old yoast one we no longer use.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where the .org theme Schema would prevent users from being able to see their properties in the authentication dropdown.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where JS based events tracking might not correctly track a mailto: link.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.4, February 20, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: monsterinsights_delete_options now checks to ensure an array is passed in</li>
<li>Tweak: The reporting class now has many more object property checks.</li>
<li>Fixed: In install if WP version not supported or if MI Pro was active, the plugin attempted to call a property of the plugin object which didn&#8217;t exist.</li>
<li>Fixed: In the deactivate/uninstall routines, MI attempted to use a method of a class object which might not exist, as it might not be the active instance. Better instance handling has been added as well as many more exists checks have been added througought the plugin.</li>
<li>Fixed: Conflicting loads when both MI Pro and Lite are installed. Note, you should only have Pro installed if you want to use it. That being said, we&#8217;ve done extensive testing to ensure we&#8217;ve handled all of the edge cases surrounding this. This could also lead to issues where it would be impossible to remove Lite and/or Pro from a site if both were installed.</li>
<li>Fixed: Conflicts with the Pinnacle theme, which loads it&#8217;s CSS file (with overrides to literally all select2 inputs not just the ones it adds) across the entire admin. This lead to an issue where in the Google Auth, a user might not have been able to see (or could appear with wacky styling) the dropdown of profiles to select. If you cannot see this dropdown after authenticating, let us know as its most likely a simple plugin or theme conflict on CSS styling.</li>
<li>Fixed: The notices to deactivate/uninstall MI Lite/Pro when the other one were installed had an errant extra quotation mark, and they&#8217;re now more specific about the action to take.</li>
<li>Fixed: For some users, the setting for user role exclusion was not working. This has been corrected.</li>
<li>Fixed: A redirect issue that was looping for some users. The code that does this, while working for most, doesn&#8217;t for some. We&#8217;ve removed it until a full investigation can be completed.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.3, February 20, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Path for fontawesome font files was incorrect</li>
<li>Fixed: Notice in the install routine for the $version variable not being set.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.2, February 19, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Upgrade routine could drop manual UA codes in certain cases. If you upgraded to 6.0.0 or 6.0.1 and it lost the manual UA code, installing this update will automatically restore the UA code entered as long as you haven&#8217;t used the oAuth or re-entered the manual UA code.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.1, February 19, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Typo that caused an issue with PHP 7 installs.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.0, February 18, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Completely overhauled design, from top to bottom. The plugin has been completely rewritten.</li>
<li>New: <strong>no more advertisements</strong> in the settings pages. We hated them too.</li>
<li>New: Javascript based event tracking</li>
<li>New: ga.js is now officially deprecated. New users cannot use it anymore, and existing users can only switch to analytics.js (but not back). Please note, all new features will be developed exclusively for analytics.js. Google has deprecated it, and now we&#8217;re deprecating our support for it.</li>
<li>New: License key system now uses the MonsterInsights License management system</li>
<li>New: Ability to pick which roles can access the dashboard/reports &amp; settings/addons/tools page using our UI. There&#8217;s also a new custom capability for this (a meta capability)</li>
<li>New: Support for Google Analytics Master accounts. When you oAuth into MonsterInsights now, the UA view is now locked to what you picked using the brand new oAuth procedure.</li>
<li>New: Revamped dashboard</li>
<li>New: Completely new settings system, with a completely new settings page, and a completely new settings API. Also some new hooks and tabs in preparation for the many addons we&#8217;ll be releasing over the next few months.</li>
<li>New: No more conflicts between the base plugins</li>
<li>New: Completely overhauled translation experience. The lite version translations are now fully managed through translations.wordpress.org.</li>
<li>New: Opt-in to anonymous data so we can better improve MonsterInsights</li>
<li>New: Significantly better addons page</li>
<li>New: Single license key to manage all MonsterInsights extensions.</li>
<li>New: Automatic detection of blocked asset files (from things like un-whitelisted uBlock Origin) with step by step directions on how to easily correct.</li>
<li>Tweak: Completely overhauled the ga.js and analytics.js outputs to fix outstanding bugs.</li>
<li>Tweak: Better debugging + disabled + preview tracking modes, that more clearly indicate what&#8217;s going on </li>
<li>Tweak: Completely overhauled PHP regex tracking to solve nearly a dozen outstanding bugs including issues where non-link elements starting with the letter &#8220;a&#8221; such as  tags would get parsed as links causing issues. Also solves issues related to single versus double quote usage for existing onclick handles, non-semicolon terminating onclick handles and various other parsing issues.</li>
<li>Tweak: Many previously untranslatable strings are now translatable.</li>
<li>Tweak: Minified in-plugin images.</li>
<li>Tweak: Minified admin css and js</li>
<li>Tweak: Uses latest version of Google PHP API now.</li>
<li>Tweak: The system for creating reports and getting Google Analytics reports have changed. If you&#8217;ve hardcoded into Yoast functions previously not designed for frontend output this could cause problems. We&#8217;ll introduce an API intended for this type of use after we update to use the v4 reporting API.</li>
<li>Fixed: Fixed an issue with HostEurope and other hosts modifying the default PHP arg seperator.</li>
<li>Fixed: Prevents an issue where users with a plugin like Airplane Mode active will get a better error message than &#8220;code invalid&#8221; on the GA token auth screen (and also fixes how that detection is done in other parts of the plugin). </li>
<li>Removed: unused track_full_url setting</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.5.3, October 3rd, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Announces MI 6.0 beta.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with PHP compatibility scanner&#8217;s bug</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.5.2, July 7, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Updates license manager to have more reliable update information including better compatibility with Yoast SEO products.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with upcoming Shiny Updates v2 in WP core</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.5.0, May 1, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Added new System Info tab for faster support.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with changelog missing some deployed versions.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.9, April 15, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Font based dashboard icon</li>
<li>Tweak: The &#8220;MonsterInsights&#8221; menu item name has been renamed to just &#8220;Insights&#8221;</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with eCommerce addon (also requires user to update eCommerce addon)</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with 2 dashboard links</li>
<li>Fixed: A bug in pre-existing code caused the menu of the plugin to skyrocket unintentionally. This has been corrected.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.8, April 14, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Google Analytics by Yoast is now MonsterInsights.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility issue with WordPress 4.5</li>
</ul>

href="https://www.imagely.com">Imagely</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/imagely";s:8:"requires";s:5:"4.0.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.6";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:82;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:1749;i:4;i:201;i:3;i:65;i:2;i:57;i:1;i:449;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:2521;s:15:"support_threads";i:106;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:53;s:10:"downloaded";i:21523820;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-05-17 7:04pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2007-04-23";s:8:"homepage";s:65:"https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/nextgen-gallery/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:6941:"<h4>WordPress Gallery Plugin</h4>
<p>NextGEN Gallery has been the industry&#8217;s standard <strong>WordPress gallery plugin</strong> since 2007 and continues to receive over 1.5 million new downloads per year. It&#8217;s easy for simple photo galleries, but powerful enough for the most demanding photographers, visual artists, and imaging professionals.</p>
<p>On the back end, NextGEN offers a complete WordPress gallery management system with the ability to batch upload photos, import meta data, add/delete/rearrange/sort photos, edit thumbnails, group galleries into albums, and more.</p>
<p>On the front end, the free version of NextGEN provides two main gallery styles (slideshows and thumbnail galleries) and two album styles (compact and extended), all of which come with a wide array of options for controlling size, style, timing, transitions, controls, lightbox effects, and more. Learn more about <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN WordPress Gallery Plugin features.</a></p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/mNEnY23i9DE?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span></p>

<p><strong>INTRODUCING NEXTGEN GALLERY PRO.</strong> NextGEN Plus and NextGEN Pro are premium WordPress gallery plugin extensions for NextGEN Gallery that add new photo gallery displays, lightboxes, ecommerce, proofing, and pro support. Learn more about <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Plus and NextGEN Pro photo plugin features.</a></p>

<p>NextGEN Gallery is maintained by Imagely. We&#8217;re the WordPress photography experts. In addition to NextGEN Gallery, NextGEN Plus, and NextGEN Pro, we also make WordPress themes for photographers, provide turnkey websites for photographers, and run the WordPress Photography Podcast.</p>
