<h3>Shortcode</h3>
<p>NextGEN Gallery offers an easy-to-use Insert Gallery Window, which means you never need to work with shortcodes again when inserting and manageing galleries &#8211; if you would prefer not too.</p>
<p>If you do want to work with shortcodes, there is a powerful shortcode system as you&#8217;d expect of a popular WordPress gallery plugin. <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery-shortcodes/" rel="nofollow">Learn About NextGEN Gallery Shortcodes</a>.</p>
<p>For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:1432:"<p>INSTALLATION: The easiest way to start uploading your photos is to login to you WordPress dashboard, go to Plugins &gt; Add New, search for NextGEN Gallery, and click to install the plugin. You can also download the plugin zip file from this page and upload it from the Plugins &gt; Add New &gt; Upload page.</p>
<p>HOW TO USE: Just go to a page or post and click the NextGEN Gallery icon or the Add Gallery button. From our Insert Gallery Window, you can create, manage, customize, and display your WordPress photo galleries. You can also manage your photo galleries and gallery settings from the central options area under the &#8220;Gallery&#8221; tab on your dashboard menu.</p>
<p>DOCUMENTATION: See <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a>.</p>
<p>That&#8217;s it &#8230; have fun! For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/qwNr5ZNGavo?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span></p>
";s:3:"faq";s:5169:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>INSTALLATION: The easiest way to start uploading your photos is to login to you WordPress dashboard, go to Plugins &gt; Add New, search for NextGEN Gallery, and click to install the plugin. You can also download the plugin zip file from this page and upload it from the Plugins &gt; Add New &gt; Upload page.</p>
<p>HOW TO USE: Just go to a page or post and click the NextGEN Gallery icon or the Add Gallery button. From our Insert Gallery Window, you can create, manage, customize, and display your WordPress photo galleries. You can also manage your photo galleries and gallery settings from the central options area under the &#8220;Gallery&#8221; tab on your dashboard menu.</p>
<p>DOCUMENTATION: See <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a>.</p>
<p>That&#8217;s it &#8230; have fun! For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/qwNr5ZNGavo?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span></p>
</p>
<h4>Why are my photo galleries not opening up in a lightbox after I move my site?</h4>
<p>
<p>This is often due to the URL paths to the CSS and JavaScript files used by the Lightbox Effects not being changed to relevant addresses based on the new site. This article will help sort out this issue if that is the case: <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/galleries-opening-lightbox/" rel="nofollow">Why are my galleries not opening up in a lightbox?</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Do you have documentation or tutorials?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. See <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Will this gallery plugin work with my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yup, NextGEN is a popular and well-established WordPress gallery plugin, and has been for a long time. It will work well with most other themes and plugins in the WordPress ecosystem.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are the photo galleries flash based?</h4>
<p>
<p>Nope, we use no flash elements.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are the galleries mobile friendly?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, we&#8217;ve put a lot of work into this and, NextGEN Galleries are compatible with Android, iOS. All photo galleries are also responsive, so galleries look good on diverse screen sizes. NextGEN Pro also includes a full screen, responsive Pro Lightbox with mobile gesture support. It&#8217;s great for viewing photos on mobile devices.</p>
</p>
<h4>What is the difference between a gallery and an album?</h4>
<p>
<p>In simple terms, Albums are collections of galleries. So Galleries contain your photos and Albums contain your Galleries. Albums act as links and placeholders to quickly and easily navigate your galleries. Galleries will actually display your images.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I upload multiple images at once?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can batch upload entire photo galleries at one time.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I password protect galleries?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WordPress allows you to password protect pages by default &#8211; which includes all photo galleries and content for the entire page. Password protection of pages can be turned on and off at any time, with just a few clicks.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I add a watermark to the my photos?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can add text or image watermarks to your gallery images.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I crop photo thumbnails?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, each thumbnail image can be individually adjusted to suit your needs.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is there pagination for photo galleries?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can use pagination when displaying thumbnail galleries. And you can adjust the amount of photos to be shown on a page at any time.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I customize the lightbox?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, the lightbox can be configured with multiple options directly from the Dashboard, and there are multiple CSS styles which can be applied and modified as well. If you want even more options, consider upgrading to NextGEN Pro and useing the NextGEN Pro lightbox.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I add HTML to photo captions?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, caption areas are fully HMTL capable.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I add an external links to galleries?</h4>
<p>
<p>Since the captions are fully HTML capable, you can add external links and any other type of mark up you wish.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is NextGEN Gallery available in foreign languages?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, our WordPress gallery plugin has been translated into dozens of languages &#8211; <a href="https://www.imagely.com/languages/" rel="nofollow">click here to find out more.</a></p>
</p>
<h4>More Information</h4>
<p>
<p>For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
</p>

<h4>V2.0.71 &#8211; 02.19.2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Module files are compiled into a single package file to reduce disk I/O</li>
<li>NEW:     All CSS stylesheets and Javascript source files are minified to reduce latency</li>
<li>NEW:     All lightboxes are configured using an in-memory management class.</li>
<li>NEW:     Uses Pope 2.0, benefiting from the new caching capabilities</li>
<li>NEW:     NextGEN Gallery&#8217;s functionality is disabled if NextGEN Pro is incompatible</li>
<li>NEW:     Added ngg_effect_code filter</li>
<li>Changed: Updated WordPress gallery plugin&#8217;s FontAwesome to 4.3.0</li>
<li>Changed: Updated WordPress gallery plugin&#8217;s  select2 to 3.5.2</li>
<li>Changed: Removed PicLens / CoolIris integration from WordPress gallery plugin</li>
<li>Changed: Removed JSON API. Please use XML-RPC API instead</li>
<li>Changed: For performance reasons, we cache FS &amp; url lookups/calculations</li>
<li>Changed: Greatly reduced the # of sql queries, and eliminated anything redundant</li>
<li>Changed: For performance reasons, we cache datamapper and SQL queries</li>
<li>Changed: Don&#8217;t enqueue scripts or styles unless we require them</li>
<li>Changed: Reduce the number of resources we enqueue for every HTTP request</li>
<li>Changed: Ngg_Store now uses cookies instead of localStorage</li>
<li>Changed: Insert Gallery Window is routed using wp-admin/admin_init</li>
<li>Changed: Removed unused code from ngglegacy module. Created wrappers for commonly-used functions</li>
<li>Changed: LZW module removed</li>
<li>Changed: Legacy template drop-down selection now using select2</li>
<li>Secured: Restrict folder browsing to NGG_IMPORT_ROOT constant</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility issue with PHP&#8217;s transparent ZLIB compression</li>
<li>Fixed:   Imagebrowser as lightbox effect not working when non-default permalink slug used</li>
<li>Fixed:   Angled quotations marks used in shortcode parameters</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility between ImageBrowser display type and TwentyFifteen theme</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow pagination to retain query string url parameters when linking to other pages</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed pagination issues with slideshow galleries displayed as thumbnails</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fix C_GalleryStorage_Driver_Base-&gt;import_gallery_from_fs() not checking imgBackup</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed problem with default settings being applied multiple times</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fallback to &#8220;full&#8221; image sizes if &#8220;backup&#8221; images aren&#8217;t available</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use M_DataMapper&#8217;s serialization methods throughout the codebase</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflict with WordPress SEO and get_the_excerpt() call</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t run Resource Manager on wp-login.php or wp-sign.php</li>
<li>Fixed:   TinyMCE Image Editor conflict with Insert Gallery Window placeholder images</li>

<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added the ability to apply lightbox effects to non-NGG images</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_HIDE_STRICT_ERRORS constant. Define and set to TRUE to hide strict errors</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NEXTGEN_GALLERY_IMPORT_ROOT constant. Define and set to TRUE to browse from a custom directory</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_DEBUG constant. Define and set to TRUE to display helpful messages for debugging</li>
<li>NEW:     Each custom table record will have an associated custom post record for expansion</li>
<li>NEW:     Display helpful error messages when there&#8217;s a problem uploading images and photos</li>
<li>NEW:     Add data-(src|thumbnail|image-id|title|description) attribute to gallery image anchors</li>
<li>NEW:     Variant support for displayed gallery sources. Random images is limited to 5 variations</li>
<li>Fixed:   Excessive creation of transients for random galleries</li>
<li>Fixed:   Issues prohibiting the ability to upload images and photos</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with NextGEN Gallery Export Plugin for Adobe Lightroom (thanks Vladimir!)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Sorting in the Insert Gallery interface</li>
<li>Fixed:   HTML allowed in gallery/album descriptions</li>
<li>Fixed:   Requests for galleries within albums that have numeric names are broken</li>
<li>Fixed:   Call to a non-member function get() on WP_Query</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to sort by Image ID in the Insert Gallery interface</li>
<li>Fixed:   Isolate the Insert Gallery Window from implicit third-party script inclusion</li>
<li>Fixed:   Check for the existance of thumbnails when generating urls, and if missing, generate new ones</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with NextGEN Facebook OpenGraph+ plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Various XML-RPC issues in WordPress gallery plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Widgets stylesheet not included</li>
<li>Fixed:   Issue with color not being pre-selected when previewing Watermark</li>
<li>Fixed:   E_NOTICE emitted when cleaning up cached image files</li>
<li>Fixed:   E_NOTICE emitted when viewing display type settings</li>
<li>Fixed:   Typo adjusting pcre.backtrack_limit for shortcodes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Content within the tabs of the Insert Gallery interface cut-off</li>
<li>Fixed:   Routing problem which would cause conflicts with different display types on the same page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Broken Dynamic CSS links on GoDaddy</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to use HTML in gallery/album descriptions</li>
<li>Fixed:   Sub-album requests conflicting with paginated galleries on the same page</li>
<li>Merged:  Pull request from andreasE (https://bitbucket.org/photocrati/nextgen-gallery/pull-request/6/)</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed:   Incompatibilities with BuddyPress</li>

<li>Fixed:   Always use domain as specified by WordPress Site URL</li>

<li>Fixed:   Numerous WordPress gallery plugin pagination issues</li>
<li>Fixed:   Adjusted our forms to comply with WordPress Firewalls</li>
<li>Fixed:   Correct use of select2 DOM selector for maximum compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed:   Path and URL calculations for Windows and UNIX environments</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that pluggable.php is loaded at the start of every request</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fancybox: adjust CSS for further box-sizing protection from themes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use PHP 5.2.1 compatible named pattern matching syntax</li>
<li>Fixed:   Remove usage of <strong>DIR</strong> constant not supported by PHP 5.2.x</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed dependency on mb_string PHP module</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow &#8220;No Lightbox&#8221; as an option for Lightbox Effects</li>
<li>Fixed:   Warning: &#8220;Invalid CRT parameters detected&#8221; for Windows environments</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0 &#8211; 07.30.2013</h4>

<li>NEW:     Added new interface for adding galleries from pages and posts.</li>
<li>NEW:     Galleries are now mobile friendly and responsive, which is most noticeable with a responsive theme.</li>
<li>NEW:     Streamlined functionality for displaying galleries based on tags.</li>
<li>NEW:     Architecture based on Pope Framework (http://bitbucket.org/photocrati/pope-framework)</li>
<li>NEW:     New shortcode, ‚Äúngg_images‚Äù, and corresponding Insert Gallery interface</li>
<li>NEW:     Galleries have now global and instance settings</li>
<li>NEW:     Support for FastCGI environments</li>
<li>Changed: Replaces shortcodes with placeholder images, however still supports legacy shortcodes.</li>
<li>Changed: Introduced new Growl-like notifications for WordPress gallery plugin</li>
<li>Changed: The container and its images are centered for photo slideshow galleries</li>
<li>Changed: NextGEN styles now override vs replace default styles</li>
<li>Changed: NextGEN legacy templates have been deprecated (but still function)</li>
<li>FIXED:   The ability to use NextGEN image as a Featured Image.</li>

.1.10.zip";s:6:"2.1.15";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.15.zip";s:6:"2.1.18";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.18.zip";s:6:"2.1.19";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.19.zip";s:5:"2.1.2";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.2.zip";s:6:"2.1.20";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.20.zip";s:6:"2.1.23";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.23.zip";s:6:"2.1.26";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.26.zip";s:6:"2.1.31";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.31.zip";s:6:"2.1.43";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.43.zip";s:6:"2.1.44";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.44.zip";s:6:"2.1.45";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.45.zip";s:6:"2.1.46";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.46.zip";s:6:"2.1.49";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.49.zip";s:6:"2.1.50";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.50.zip";s:6:"2.1.54";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.54.zip";s:6:"2.1.56";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.56.zip";s:6:"2.1.57";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.57.zip";s:6:"2.1.59";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.59.zip";s:6:"2.1.60";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.60.zip";s:6:"2.1.61";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.61.zip";s:6:"2.1.62";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.62.zip";s:6:"2.1.68";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.68.zip";s:6:"2.1.69";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.69.zip";s:5:"2.1.7";s tps://ps.w.org/nextgen-gallery/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1875408";s:2:"2x";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/nextgen-gallery/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1875408";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}}s:7:"shariff";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:15:"Shariff Wrapper";s:4:"slug";s:7:"shariff";s:7:"version";s:5:"4.5.0";s:6:"author";s:76:"<a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/shariff/">Jan-Peter Lambeck & 3UU</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:34:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/3uu";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.9";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.6";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.6";s:6:"rating";i:98;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:73;i:4;i:1;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:2;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:76;s:15:"support_threads";i:44;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:33;s:10:"downloaded";i:145285;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2018-05-11 10:04pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2014-12-01";s:8:"homepage";s:41:"https://wordpress.org/plugins-wp/shariff/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:1387:"<p>The &#8220;original&#8221; share buttons automatically transmit data of your visitors to the social network sites as soon as they visit your website. They do not need to click on a share button for this and therefore have no choice, if they want their data to be send. The German computer magazine c&#8217;t has developed &#8220;Shariff&#8221; <code>( É…õ…π…™f)</code> that follows the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR &#8211; Regulation (EU) 2016/679). This plugin adapts the Shariff concept and provides an easy to use solution for WordPress. We currently support 32 services: AddThis, Bitcoin, Diaspora, Facebook, Flattr, Flipboard, GooglePlus, LinkedIn, mailto, Mastodon, Odnoklassniki, Patreon, PayPal, PayPal.me, Pinterest, Pocket, Printer, Qzone, Reddit, RSS, SMS, Stumbleupon, Telegram, TencentWeibo, Threema, Tumblr, Twitter, VK, Wallabag, Weibo, WhatsApp, Xing.</p>
<p>For more information about the Shariff project check out the original <a href="https://github.com/heiseonline/shariff" rel="nofollow">GitHub project</a> and read about the project itself <a href="http://ct.de/shariff" rel="nofollow">c‚Äôt information page</a> (in German).</p>
<p>You can automatically add share buttons to posts, pages, the main blog page, product sites and many more as well as use it as a widget or add the shortcode <code>[shariff]</code> manually to your pages or themes.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:333:"<ol>
<li>Upload everything to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin using the plugins menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Use <code>[shariff]</code> anywhere on your site and/or use the Shariff settings menu.</li>
</ol>
<p>To enable it for all posts please check the options in the plugin settings.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:12641:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Upload everything to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin using the plugins menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Use <code>[shariff]</code> anywhere on your site and/or use the Shariff settings menu.</li>
</ol>
<p>To enable it for all posts please check the options in the plugin settings.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I use the Shariff buttons in my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. Simply use the shortcode function <code>do_shortcode('[shariff]')</code>.<br />
You can use all options of the shorttag as described on the help tab in the plugin settings.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I use the total amount of shares in my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. You can use <code>do_shortcode('[shariff services="totalnumber"]')</code> to simply output the total amount of shares for a post in the loop. It will return the number itself wrapped in a <code>&lt;span class="shariff-totalnumber"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;</code> in order for the shariff.js to update the count. Also only cached data is used, in order to not slow down your site.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Is there an action hook to use the share counts every time they get updated?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. You can use<br />
    function your_awesome_function( $share_counts ) {<br />
       // $share_counts is an array including all enabled services, the timestamp of the update and the url of the post.<br />
       // do stuff<br />
    }<br />
    add_action( &#8216;shariff_share_counts&#8217;, &#8216;your_awesome_function&#8217; );<br />
WARNING: This hook will get called A LOT. So be sure you know what you are doing.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I configure the widget?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: It uses the same options that have been configured on the plugin options page. However, you can put in a shorttag that overwrites the default options. It has the same format as you use in posts. Take a look at the help section of the plugin options page for more information.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I change the options on a single post?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. You can change all options using the shorttag in the Shariff meta box on the right side of the post edit screen.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Why are shares not listed?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Shariff tries to protect the privacy of your visitors. In order to do this, the statistics have to be requested by your server, so social networks only see a request of your server and not from your visitor. However, we do not know, if you want this. Therefore it is not enabled by default.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I show the share counts?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Enable it on the plugin options page in general or add <code>backend="on"</code> to the shariff shorttag in your post.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I still do not see share counts</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Please have a look at the status tab on the plugin options page. It states whether share counts are enabled and if there is a problem with a service. Please also keep in mind that the plugin has a minimum refresh time of 60 seconds and that each service has their own cache as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Why can&#8217;t I change the TTL to a smaller / bigger value?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: The time to live (TTL) value determines, if a share count of a post or page gets refreshed when someone visits this specific page / post of your blog. Too small values create too much useless traffic, too high values negate the goal of motivating visitors to also share a post. The value can be adjusted between 60 and 7200 seconds. Keep in mind, the actual lifespan depends on the age of the post as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I get the Facebook API error message &#8220;request limit reached&#8221;!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Facebook has a rate limit of 600 requests per 600 seconds per IP address. Especially in shared hosting environments many domains share the same IP address and therefore the same limit. To avoid this you can try to raise the TTL value or provide a Facebook App ID and Secret. Google &#8220;facebook app id secret&#8221; will provide many guides on how to get these.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I change the position of all buttons?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Have a look at the alignment options in the admin menu or checkout the<br />
style option.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I change the design?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Have a look at the parameters &#8220;theme&#8221;, &#8220;orientation&#8221; and &#8220;buttonsize&#8221;. They work mostly like the original code parameters that are explained at http://heiseonline.github.io/shariff/ Or you can have a look at the test page at http://shariff.3uu.net/shariff-sample-page-with-all-options to get an<br />
overview. But please be warned: This is a test page! It is possible that you find features that are only provided in the development version. Use it only to get an impression of the design options.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I change the design of a single button?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: If you are a CSS guru please feel free to modify the css file. But of course this is a bad idea, because all changes will be destroyed with the next update! Instead take a look at the style and class attribute of the shorttag. If you put in any value it will create a DIV container with the ID &#8220;ShariffSC&#8221; around the buttons. If you are really a CSS guru you will know what does the magic from here on out. üòâ</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I want the buttons to stay fixed while scrolling!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: No problem. Just use the style attribute to add some CSS to the shorttag. For example in a widget (adjust the width as needed):<br />
    [shariff style=&#8221;position:fixed;width:250px&#8221;]<br />
Of course you can use all other options in that shorttag as well. It also works with the CSS style option on the plugins design options page, if you really want this applied to all buttons on your page.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I want a horizontal line above my Shariff buttons!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: You can use the headline option on the design tab. For example, enter the following code to create a horizontal line and a headline:</p>
<p>Please share this post:</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I want a different or no headline in a single widget, post or page!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Use the headline attribute to add or remove it. For example, you can use the following shorttag to remove a headline set on the plugins options page in a single widget:<br />
    [shariff headline=&#8221;&#8221;]<br />
Of course you can use all other options in that shorttag as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I add [shariff] on all posts?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes, check out the plugin options.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: But I want to hide it on a single post!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Do you really know what you want? üòâ However, it is possible. Write anywhere in your post &#8220;hideshariff&#8221;. It will be removed and Shariff will not be added. You can also use &#8220;/hideshariff&#8221; to write &#8220;hideshariff&#8221; in your post. You might also want to take a look at the Shariff meta box on the right side of your post edit screen.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What are the differences between the two Shariff plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: One is developed by us, one by someone else. üòâ The main difference is that this plugin has a few more options and a great support. üôÇ Neither of the plugins are &#8220;official&#8221; or directly developed by Heise.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Does it work with a CDN?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Pinterest does not show an image!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: You can add media=&#8221;http://wwww.example.com/yourImage.png&#8221;<br />
within the [shariff] shorttag or add it in on the plugin options page &#8211; of course with the link to your image.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I set a fixed URL to share?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: You can use the &#8220;url&#8221; parameter within the shortcode<br />
    [shariff url=&#8221;http://www.example.com/&#8221;]<br />
This is also available within widgets. However, it is not a good idea to manipulate the URI, because it could mislead your visitors. So you should only use it, if this is really needed and you do really know what you are doing. Therefore it is not available on the plugin options page in general.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What is the difference between the services `mailform` and `mailto¬¥?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: mailform will provide an e-mail form on top of the post or page and mailto will draw a link with the mailto-protocol to open the default e-mail application of the client.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What happened to `mail`?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: mail was replaced with mailform to provide an easier way of distinguishing between the two types of mail buttons.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I disable the mail form completely?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes, take a look at the Mail Form tab on the plugin options page.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What happened to the Twitter share counts and what is OpenShareCount?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Please read: https://www.jplambeck.de/twitter-saveoursharecounts/</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: The buttons are not correctly being shown on my custom theme!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Please make sure that wp_footer(); has been added to your theme. For more information please visit: https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/wp_footer</p>
</p>
<h4>EXPERIMENTAL FEATURES</h4>
<p>
<p>Features marked as &#8220;experimental&#8221; in the admin menu are experimental! This means: We think it is a good extension to our plugin that we would like to include in a future version, but we are not sure yet about the best solution that works for all or most people. So please feel free to use and test it and report back to us about it. Experimental features might be removed in an update, if it does not work out. So please pay close attention to our changelog!</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What is the external API feature?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: First of all: Usually you do not need it! The plugin requests all share counts itself. However, there are some reasons to put the backend on another server:<br />
&#8211; avoid requests from you WP server to all the social networks<br />
&#8211; use a more powerful server for the statistic<br />
&#8211; use the original backend implementation of Heise or your own solution<br />
&#8211; make your own backend available for more than one WP installation<br />
But please have in mind that there are also some good reasons not to use external servers:<br />
&#8211; you need an additional installation of WP and the plugin or have to create your own implementation of a Shariff backend<br />
&#8211; some plugin settings (backend checks, statistic, etc.) will only work on the external server<br />
&#8211; you have to use SHARIFF_FRONTENDS as an array with all your frontend domains to enable the backend or find your own solution<br />
&#8211; we CANNOT provide support for your own implementation</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I configure the external API?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: In the statistic settings fill in the URL to the API of the external server. For the WordPress installation on the external server you have to create a &#8220;constant&#8221; called SHARIFF_FRONTENDS to permit other domains to use it. Please have in mind that you have to fill in all subdomains you want to use! The domains must be defined like this:<br />
    define( &#8216;SHARIFF_FRONTENDS&#8217;, &#8216;example.com|www.example.com|blog.example.com|another-domain.com&#8217; );</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What does &#8220;Request external API directly.&#8221; means?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: By default, the browser request the share counts from the server your site is running on. If you have entered an external API your server will then request the counts from this external API instead of fetching them itself. Therefore, the external server will only see the IP from your server and not the one from your visitors. If you check this option, the browser of your visitors will instead directly request the share counts from the external API and therefore reveal their IP address to them. This might be faster, but it is less secure. Please also make sure to set the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header right. If your site is available using https, your external API will need to be reached by https as well. Otherwise the request will get blocked for security reasons. All options and features (e.g. the ranking tab) regarding the statistic will only work on the external server.</p>
</p>
<h4>KNOWN BUGS</h4>
<p>
<p>These are bugs or unexpected glitches that we know of, but that do not have an impact on the majority of users, are not security relevant and will perhaps be fixed in the future &#8211; if we have time to spend or you provide us with a lot of &#8220;K&#xF6;lsch&#8221; üòâ</p>
<ul>
<li>If the first post on the start page is password protected and Shariff is disabled on protected posts, a widget at the end of the loop will not be rendered.</li>
</ul>
</p>

feed or data feed to Sync your products with your merchant center like Google Shopping,Facebook Product Ads,Bing Ads, eBay, Amazon etc. The main target of this plugin is to generate product feed, automatically update product information into feed file according to given schedule and sync your product to different shopping engines via HTTP or FTP so that real buyer can get your product into shopping engines like Google Shopping, pricegrabber, pricerunner, nextag,ebay and many more.</p>
<p> Compatible with WooCommerce 3.0+</p>
<blockquote>
<h4>Free version support unlimited feed with up to 2000 products including variations.</h4>
<p></p>
<h4><a href="http://webappick.com/plugin/woocommerce-product-feed-pro/" rel="nofollow">Premium Version</a> have some additional awesome features which are not included into free version</h4>
<p></p>
<h4>Premium version also support WooCommerce <a href="https://woocommerce.com/products/composite-products/" rel="nofollow">Composite</a> and <a href="https://woocommerce.com/products/product-bundles/" rel="nofollow">Bundle</a> Products</h4>
<p>
</p></blockquote>
<p><strong>WHAT IS PRODUCT FEED?</strong></p>
<p>A product feed is a .TXT, CSV, EXCEL or XML file which contain a list of products and their attributes (id, title, description, price, image, link and other attributes) in an organized way so that each product can be displayed into search engines, compared uniquely and can be advertised.</p>
<p><strong>WHY DO I NEED PRODUCT FEED?</strong></p>
<p>You need product feed if you are a merchant with an ecommerce store and want to get you product into search engine or price comparison website or into affiliate network.  Product feed supply your product information to those online marketing channel so that buyer can easily find your products.</p>
<p><strong>WHAT IS COMPARISON SHOPPING ENGINE?</strong></p>
<p>A shopping engine or comparison shopping engine is a type of website where shopper can search products based on price, feature and other criteria and compare. Most popular Comparison Shopping Engines are Google Shopping, Pricegrabber, Pricewatch, Shopzilla, Nextag, eBay Commerce Network.</p>
<blockquote>
<h4><a href="http://webappick.helpscoutdocs.com/" rel="nofollow">Read Documentation and FAQ</a></h4>
<p></p>
<h4>For Support Email to support@webappick.com or Click on Live Chat into our Website</h4>
<p>
</p></blockquote>
<p><strong>WHY SHOULD I CHOSE THIS PLUGIN?</strong></p>
<p>In one word WooCommerce Product Feed is a revolution. Yah, it‚Äôs a revolution of woocommerce tech because there are no any modules or extensions that generate automatic or manual feeds those can be synchronized flexibility to shopping places that can be maintained by the people having not much technical knowledge of wordpress coding. Among the thousands reasons of choosing this wordpress plugin we are mentioning a few of them below.</p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/xw3R4v1LMe4?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span>
<p><strong>Google Merchant Feed Upload</strong><br />
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/PTUYgF7DwEo?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span></p>
<p><strong>AVAILABLE FEATURES:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>It is highly customizable, having access to 100+ merchant sites &amp; also very responsive of user commands.</li>
<li>10+ pre configured template for Google Shopping,Google Adword,Facebook,Nextag.com,pricegrabber.com,Shopping.com,<br />
become.com,conexity.com,shopmania.com,shopzilla.com,bing.com</li>
<li>You can post your product feeds either manually from your site to shopping engines<br />
or you can also set FTP to post your feeds automatically to your desired engines.</li>
<li>Feeds are also accessible via HTTP or HTTPS. So that merchant can easily and automatically fetch product feed using given Feed URL.</li>
<li>There are 3 supported file formats for feeds. They are: XML, TXT, CSV. </li>
<li>Attribute Prefix and Suffix. You can easily add Marketing or Promo Text with Product Title, Description And its also possible to add Price symbol,currency code with price.</li>
<li>Output formatting using Strip Tags,UTF-8 encode,Remove Space,CDATA,Htmentities,Price and Number format</li>
<li>Output Limitation. You can Limit output length according to your merchant feed specification.</li>
<li>Scheduled Feed Update</li>
<li>Auto Feed upload via FTP</li>
<li>Supported Merchants
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.google.com/retail/merchant-center/" rel="nofollow">Google Shopping </a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.google.com/adwords/" rel="nofollow">Google Adwords </a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.facebook.com/business/a/online-sales/dynamic-product-ads" rel="nofollow"> Facebook Catalog </a></li>
<li><a href="https://advertising.amazon.com/" rel="nofollow">Amazon Seller Ad </a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ebaycommercenetwork.com/" rel="nofollow">eBay Commerce Network </a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.nextag.com/" rel="nofollow">Nextag.com </a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.pricegrabber.com/" rel="nofollow">Pricegrabber.com </a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.kelkoo.com/" rel="nofollow">Kelkoo.com </a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.houzz.com/" rel="nofollow">Houzz.com </a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.dealtime.com" rel="nofollow">Dealtime.com </a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.affiliatewindow.com/uk/" rel="nofollow">Affiliatewindow.com </a></li>

<blockquote>
<h4>If you like Free Version, you&#8217;ll love the Pro Version</h4>
<p>
</p></blockquote>
<p><strong><a href="http://webappick.com/plugin/woocommerce-product-feed-pro/" rel="nofollow">WooCommerce Product Feed Pro</a> gives you everything you&#8217;ll find in free and some awesome functionalities:</strong></p>
<p><strong>SMART FILTER &amp; CONDITIONS</strong></p>
<p>Smart Filters help you to exclude the non-profitable or out of season products you don‚Äôt want to share. Also Its high filtering options help users to filter products according to product titles, price, availability of stocks, user rating and other extensive product specifications.</p>
<p><strong>CATEGORY MAPPING (To Reach Your Buyer)</strong></p>
<p>Categories are the most important key to get products into search result. It is best practice to assign most matching shopping engine category to your store category for each product. During the creating of your feeds you can also create a category for that particular product. And after creating the category you‚Äôll get an option to map it to your market place category so that you can make two categories aligned to each other. This process is totally dynamic by our plugin &amp; you can map all of your categories to make it more relevant &amp; reachable to buyers.</p>
<p><strong>DYNAMIC ATTRIBUTE</strong></p>
<p>The Dynamic Attribute combine the powerful features of the WooCommerce Product Feed Pro with the ability to set your own conditions for any types of attribute.There are different types of Woocommerce users have different types &amp; classes of products and services. So, they may need varieties of custom values to demonstrate their products. And we are giving the options to make dynamic attributes as your need. Also it is possible to generate the data feed file according to the search engines requirements without changing the attributes in your store.</p>
<p><strong>CUSTOM TAXONOMY</strong></p>
<p>User can easily use any custom taxonomy or others woocommerce plugin or extensions taxonomy value into feed. For Example product Brand, Model No size etc. So you can easily use those value into your feed.</p>
<p><strong>FEED MAKING WITH BATCHES</strong></p>
<p>Due to PHP execution time and memory limit its not possible to process Thousands of products at a time. We have developed our plugin with the functionality to make feed with batches. User can easily set Limit and Offset to make feed. This functionality is compatible with any type of server your wordpress is installed and any amount of products you have into your site.</p>
<p><strong>WP OPTIONS</strong></p>
<p>It is possible to use any wp_options values into feed. Most of the plugins used to save data as option. So using premium version of our plugin user can use any other plugin data to make feed.</p>
<p><strong>MULTI LANGUAGE FEED</strong></p>
<p>WooCommerce Product Feed Pro is compatible with WPML WooCommerce plugin. And by supporting WPML this makes it possible for the e-commerce owners to create product feed in different languages. This enables the e-commerce owners the chance to globalize their business in minutes because you always have better chance of selling something if you are selling it in the native language.</p>
<p><strong>SUPPORT TEAM</strong></p>
<p>We‚Äôve a dedicated team of coders and wordpress experts to make your journey to us friendlier &amp; error free. So, if you want to use our plugin or if you are facing any problem with our plugin feel free to say us by emailing here: support@webappick.com.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:749:"<p>Before installing the plugin please make sure that</p>
<ol>
<li>Your php version is 5.4 or greater</li>
<li>WordPress version is 3.6 or greater</li>
<li>WooCommerce version is 2.4 or greater</li>
</ol>
<p>You can also check your system status and versions from WooCommerce &gt; System Status</p>
<p>This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.</p>
<p>e.g.</p>
<ol>
<li>Upload <code>webappick-product-feed-for-woocommerce</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Select &#8216;Woo Feed&#8217; from admin menu, Click &#8216;Make Feed&#8217;</li>
<li>Select the template and make feed</li>
<li>Done!</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:1235:"<blockquote>
<h4>Read <a href="http://webappick.helpscoutdocs.com/article/17-woocommerce-product-feed" rel="nofollow">Documentation and FAQ</a></h4>
<p></p>
<h4>For Support Email to support@webappick.com</h4>
<p>
</p></blockquote>

<h4>which shopping engines are supported?</h4>
<p>
<p>This plugin support all the sopping engines.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does the plugin support product variation?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes</p>
</p>
<h4>Is there any limitation to feed size?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, You can make unlimited number of feed</p>
</p>
<h4>What is the difference between Free and Pro Version?</h4>
<p>
<p>Free version include all the major functions but Pro version have some awesome functionality.</p>
<p>Using pro version:</p>
<ul>
<li>You can filter product using price, quantity, product name</li>
<li>You can use custom taxonomies or other plugins taxonomy value into feed</li>
<li>Using Category Mapping You can map your store category with your mechant category which is    very useful for visitor to find out your product into merchant site.</li>
<li>You can make different price for different merchant using Dynamic Attribute. Also it is possible to set different value for different product using Dynamic Attribute Conditions.</li>
</ul>
</p>

Germanized";s:4:"slug";s:22:"woocommerce-germanized";s:7:"version";s:6:"1.9.10";s:6:"author";s:44:"<a href="https://vendidero.de">Vendidero</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/vendidero";s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.8";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.6";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:96;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:172;i:4;i:10;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:3;i:1;i:6;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:191;s:15:"support_threads";i:25;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:25;s:10:"downloaded";i:359221;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2018-05-17 10:43am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2014-10-31";s:8:"homepage";s:47:"https://www.vendidero.de/woocommerce-germanized";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:6890:"<p><strong>WooCommerce Germanized</strong> extends WooCommerce to technically match german legal conditions. The objective of this plugin is to perfectly adapt WooCommerce to meet the special requirements of german market. WC Germanized is being continually developed by an experienced german team &#8211; on updates of WooCommerce we will respond quickly by offering compatibility.</p>
<p>Users of <a href="https://vendidero.de/woocommerce-germanized" title="WooCommerce optimized for German Market" rel="nofollow">WooCommerce Germanized Pro</a> benefit from additional features such as PDF Invoices, Model Text Generators for terms and revocation, Premium Support and more!</p>
<p>To fit german requirements even better you may have a look at our <a href="https://vendidero.de/vendipro" title="WooCommerce Theme for German Market" rel="nofollow">WooCommerce Theme</a> specifically developed for the german market: VendiPro.<br />
While developing VendiPro we have specifically considered german design principles. WooCommerce Germanized + VendiPro are a perfect combination for your german WooCommerce Shop.</p>
<h4>Legal Certainty for German Market</h4>
<p>WooCommerce Germanized supports typical german shop functionality: Delivery Times, Base Prices, Shipping Costs and Tax Notices, legally relevant Pages (e.g. Terms, Revocation Page etc.) &#8211; even in Emails, Small Business Regulation, Fees for Payment Methods and much more.<br />
Furthermore we have customized the checkout to make your WooCommerce Shop meet the german law requirments.</p>
<ul>
<li>Delivery Times</li>
<li>Small Business Regulation</li>
<li>Notices regarding Shipping Costs and Taxes</li>
<li>Base Prices</li>
<li>Short Cart Product Descriptions </li>
<li>Notices regarding Terms and Revocation</li>
<li>Compatibility with Button Solution</li>
<li>Double Opt In for Customers</li>
<li>Tax Calculation for Shipping Costs and Fees</li>
<li>Terms, Revocation etc. in certain Email Templates</li>
<li>Trusted Shops Integration</li>
<li>eKomi Integration</li>
<li>Payment Gateway: SEPA direct debit</li>
<li>Payment Gateway: Pay by Invoice</li>
<li>Payment Gateway Fees</li>
<li>Online Revocation Form</li>
<li>Sale Price Labels</li>
<li>Delivery to DHL Parcel Shops or Pick-Up Stations</li>
<li>Differential Taxation</li>
<li>WPML and PolyLang Support</li>
<li>REST API Support</li>
<li>Product CSV Import/Export Support</li>
</ul>
<h4>Certified by Trusted Shops</h4>
<p>WooCommerce Germanized has been approved by Trusted Shops and therefor offers best technical conditions to operate a legally certain Online Shop in Germany.<br />
Trusted Shops certifies Shops after selected and weighted criteria and has carefully examined this WooCommerce Plugin.<br />
Of course Trusted Shops customers may embed their quality seals or further Trusted Shops Products as genuine Seller and Product Reviews by adapting just a few options within WooCommerce Germanized.</p>
<h4>Properly Implemented</h4>
<p>While developing WooCommerce Germanized we have specifically considered clean integration within WooCommerce and WordPress by adapting core functionality.<br />
Most of the changes are made by using Hooks &amp; Filters so that Germanized is compatible to almost every Theme.</p>
<h4>SEPA Direct Debit &amp; Pay By Invoice for WooCommerce</h4>
<p>With WooCommerce Germanized 1.4 you may offer Pay by Direct Debit and Pay By Invoice to your customers.<br />
Using SEPA Direct Debit checkout fields for IBAN, BIC and Account Holder will be automatically added and verified during checkout.<br />
Furthermore the customer may preview his SEPA Mandate before submitting the order. Starting with 1.6 shop managers may easily export<br />
SEPA Mandates in XML format to import mandates to their house bank our banking software.<br />
Pay By Invoice may be optionally restricted to regular customers only.</p>
<h4>Pro: WooCommerce PDF Invoices &amp; Packing Slips</h4>
<p>As a Pro User of WC Germanized you may automatically or manually create PDF Invoices and Packing Slips for your orders. Doing so you may customize the PDF layout to meet your Corporate Design.<br />
You may upload your head of a letter which will be used as background for your PDF&#8217;s. With only a few clicks you may export (CSV, zip) invoices for your tax consultant or accountant.<br />
Learn more about <a href="https://vendidero.de/woocommerce-germanized#accounting" title="WooCommerce PDF Invoices" rel="nofollow">PDF Invoices for WooCommerce</a></p>
<p>New: Attach legally relevant Pages (e.g. Terms &amp; Conditions) as PDF documents to specific WooCommerce Emails.</p>
<h4>Tax Calculation for Shipping Costs and Fees</h4>
<p>WooCommerce Germanized supports complicated calculation of shipping/fee taxes for &#8220;mixed&#8221; shopping carts (that is: cart contains multiple tax rates e.g. 7% and 19%).<br />
In that case tax has to be calculated proportional (based on tax rate share in comparison to total amount).</p>
<h4>Pro: Theme Support</h4>
<p>Professional Users benefit from specific Support of popular Themes. For those Themes we make sure that WooCommerce Germanized Options are visible and visually appealing.<br />
At the moment professional version supports the following Themes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Enfold</li>
<li>Flatsome</li>
<li>Storefront</li>
<li>Virtue</li>
</ul>
<h4>Pro: Premium Support</h4>
<p>Customers of Woo Germanized Pro enjoy our qualified Germanized Support via Tickets. Of course we also seek to offer a good Plugin Support via WordPress Support Forums.</p>
<h4>Double Opt In for WooCommerce</h4>
<p>A new judgement of a German Court makes Shop Managers nervous about whether Double Opt In is required for Online Shops. Therefor WC Germanized offers Double Opt In Support for WooCommerce.<br />
After creating an account the customer receives an activation link via Email. Inactive customers may be automatically deleted after a certain amount of time.<br />
Starting with version 1.6 one may deactivate the checkout for inactive customers. To make this possible, registration has to be separated from the checkout &#8211; of course customers may still checkout as guests (if enabled).</p>
<h4>Pro: Conclusion of Contract</h4>
<p>By default WooCommerce does not offer a distinction between receiving and confirming the order. WooCommerce Germanized Pro offers a feature to manually examine orders before confirming them to the customer.<br />
Shop managers may check order details and then manually confirm the order through a Button in the WooCommerce Backend.</p>
<h4>Delivery to DHL Parcel Shops</h4>
<p>You may optionally choose to offer delivery to DHL parcel shops or pick-up stations. Customers may find a parcel shop nearby by embedding an overlay of the DHL search API.<br />
On choosing a parcel shop within the overlay the corresponding data is automatically added to the WooCommerce checkout fields.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:2280:"<h4>Minimal Requirments</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 3.8 or newer</li>
<li>WooCommerce 2.4 (newest version recommended)</li>
<li>PHP Version 5.3 or newer</li>
</ul>
<h4>Automatic Installation</h4>
<p>We recommend installing WooCommerce Germanized through the WordPress Backend. Please install WooCommerce before installing WC Germanized.<br />
After the installation you may easily adapt the settings to your own needs.</p>
<h4>Shortcodes</h4>
<pre><code>[revocation_form]
</code></pre>
<p>Inserts online revocation form. Customer and shop manager receive a confirmation by Email.</p>
<pre><code>[payment_methods_info]
</code></pre>
<p>Very useful for Payment Gateway Information Page &#8211; Inserts an overview of all enabled payment gateways plus their descriptions.</p>
<pre><code>[gzd_complaints]
</code></pre>
<p>Inserts a text that informs the customer about the EU Online Dispute Platform &#8211; this Shortcode should be inserted within your imprint. Find more information <a href="http://shop.trustedshops.com/de/rechtstipps/jetzt-handeln-link-auf-eu-online-schlichtungs-plattform-ab-9.1.2016" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</p>
<pre><code>[trusted_shops_badge]
</code></pre>
<p>If you are a Trusted Shops Customer, you may insert this Shortcode to insert the Trusted Shops Badge at your favourite place.<br />
With the parameter width=55 (55 means 55px width/height) you may optionally set badge&#8217;s width.</p>
<pre><code>[trusted_shops_rich_snippets]
</code></pre>
<p>If you are using Trusted Shop&#8217;s review functionality, you may insert a Google Rich Snippet about your current shop rating.</p>
<pre><code>[trusted_shops_reviews]
</code></pre>
<p>Inserts your current Trusted Shops rating as an image (provided by Trusted Shops).</p>
<pre><code>[ekomi_badge]
</code></pre>
<p>Inserts your eKomi badge as image.<br />
With the parameter width=55 (55 means 55px width/height) you may optionally set badge&#8217;s width.</p>
<h4>Updating</h4>
<p>Before updating WooCommerce you should definitely check whether WooCommerce Germanized does already support the newest version.<br />
You may of course Update WooCommerce Germanized automatically through the WordPess Backend. Please make sure to always backup (at least your database) before updating any theme or plugin.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:3923:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<h4>Minimal Requirments</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 3.8 or newer</li>
<li>WooCommerce 2.4 (newest version recommended)</li>
<li>PHP Version 5.3 or newer</li>
</ul>
<h4>Automatic Installation</h4>
<p>We recommend installing WooCommerce Germanized through the WordPress Backend. Please install WooCommerce before installing WC Germanized.<br />
After the installation you may easily adapt the settings to your own needs.</p>
<h4>Shortcodes</h4>
<pre><code>[revocation_form]
</code></pre>
<p>Inserts online revocation form. Customer and shop manager receive a confirmation by Email.</p>
<pre><code>[payment_methods_info]
</code></pre>
<p>Very useful for Payment Gateway Information Page &#8211; Inserts an overview of all enabled payment gateways plus their descriptions.</p>
<pre><code>[gzd_complaints]
</code></pre>
<p>Inserts a text that informs the customer about the EU Online Dispute Platform &#8211; this Shortcode should be inserted within your imprint. Find more information <a href="http://shop.trustedshops.com/de/rechtstipps/jetzt-handeln-link-auf-eu-online-schlichtungs-plattform-ab-9.1.2016" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</p>
<pre><code>[trusted_shops_badge]
</code></pre>
<p>If you are a Trusted Shops Customer, you may insert this Shortcode to insert the Trusted Shops Badge at your favourite place.<br />
With the parameter width=55 (55 means 55px width/height) you may optionally set badge&#8217;s width.</p>
<pre><code>[trusted_shops_rich_snippets]
</code></pre>
<p>If you are using Trusted Shop&#8217;s review functionality, you may insert a Google Rich Snippet about your current shop rating.</p>
<pre><code>[trusted_shops_reviews]
</code></pre>
<p>Inserts your current Trusted Shops rating as an image (provided by Trusted Shops).</p>
<pre><code>[ekomi_badge]
</code></pre>
<p>Inserts your eKomi badge as image.<br />
With the parameter width=55 (55 means 55px width/height) you may optionally set badge&#8217;s width.</p>
<h4>Updating</h4>
<p>Before updating WooCommerce you should definitely check whether WooCommerce Germanized does already support the newest version.<br />
You may of course Update WooCommerce Germanized automatically through the WordPess Backend. Please make sure to always backup (at least your database) before updating any theme or plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where do I receive support for WooCommerce Germanized?</h4>
<p>
<p>You may ask your questions regarding Germanized within our free <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/woocommerce-germanized" rel="nofollow">WordPress Support Forum</a>.<br />
Professional Support via Ticket is being offered to <a href="https://vendidero.de/woocommerce-germanized" title="Support for WooCommerce Germanized" rel="nofollow">Professional Users</a> only.</p>
</p>
<h4>Not every option fits my Theme</h4>
<p>
<p>Unfortunately not every Theme does implement WooCommerce in the way it&#8217;s meant to be or differs from the original structure which leads to layout and/or compatibility<br />
issues. Out of that reason we have developed <a href="https://vendidero.de/vendipro" rel="nofollow">VendiPro</a> which perfectly fits all Germanized Options and is optimized for German Market.</p>
</p>
<h4>Email Attachments not showing in Order Confirmation Email</h4>
<p>
<p>In most times you have a wrong configuration within your Germanized Email settings. The order confirmation email sent to the customer after an order has been made is called &#8220;Processing Order&#8221;. The email called &#8220;New Order&#8221; is the email<br />
sent to the Administrator which serves as a notification only &#8211; so make sure you have &#8220;Processing Order&#8221; selected within the Germanized settings.</p>
</p>
<h4>Want to file a Bug or improve Germanized?</h4>
<p>
<p>Bug reports may be filed via our <a href="https://github.com/vendidero/woocommerce-germanized" rel="nofollow">GitHub repository</a>.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:25745:"<h4>1.9.10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature: Support upcoming Woo Privacy options (GDPR compatibility)</li>
<li>Improvement: Direct Debit: Only export orders with valid statuses</li>
<li>Improvement: Direct Debit: Added order status export filter &#8220;woocommerce_gzd_direct_debit_export_order_statuses&#8221;</li>
<li>Improvement: Added &#8220;woocommerce_gzd_order_confirmation&#8221; hook to woocommerce_email_actions flow to support async sending</li>
<li>Improvement: Removed duplicate nonce from checkout</li>
<li>Improvement: Order payment button leading to form submit via JS instead of PHP for better compatibility</li>
<li>Improvement: Transformed &#8220;product-units-wrapper&#8221; from span to p tag</li>
<li>Improvement: Enqueue style via normal enqueue logic instead of using the Woo filter</li>
<li>Improvement: Added new option to disable pay now button for certain payment gateways</li>
<li>Improvement: Trusted Shops review CSV exporter added order date and days to send</li>
<li>Improvement: Wrap input checkboxes within label (like WC does it)</li>
<li>Fix: Email notice only appended if differential tax option was set</li>
<li>Fix: Prevent using deprecated variation saving hook for Woo version &gt; 3</li>
<li>Fix: Product API terms were removed on update if no term has been transmitted</li>
</ul>

<h4>(English)</h4>
<h4>EMPOWER YOUR BUSINESS &amp; BOOST YOUR SALES WITH THE NOVALNET WOOCOMMERCE EXTENSION</h4>
<p>The Woocommerce payment extension from NOVALNET simplifies your daily work by automating the entire payment process. This extension is designed to help you increase your sales by offering various international and local payment methods on a one-page checkout.</p>
<p>The following services are integrated and ready for your use: Debt collection, Risk management, Member management, Subscription management, Fraud management, Affiliate program, Real-time monitoring, detail statistics &amp; report etc. Thus you receive an all-in-one solution: the extension which is perfectly adjusted to Woocommerce and the top-quality range of services of the payment provider Novalnet.</p>
<p>Through the individuality and flexibility you can choose which payment methods and services you need.<br />
Our team of highly qualified professionals is fully dedicated to serve and assist you in the entire payment process setup and maintenance.</p>
<p>Get now a seamless integration with the various types of payments and payment-related services integrated in the one unique platform.</p>
<h4>ADVANTAGES AT A GLANCE</h4>
<ul>
<li>One platform for all payment types and related services</li>
<li>No redirection &#8211; user stays entirely on your website for payment</li>
<li>Fast checkout that allows users to save their payment details</li>
<li>Easy way of managing on-hold transactions and refunds</li>
<li>Dynamic subscription and member management for recurring payments</li>
<li>Comprehensive affiliate management</li>
<li>Effortless  configuration of risk management with fraud prevention and payment method control</li>
<li>Status management for chargeback as well as return debit</li>
<li>Clear real-time overview of payment status</li>
<li>Automated e-mail notification function concerning payment status reports</li>
<li>Smart auto-fill of payment details</li>
<li>Free text configuration for the bookings (for use on bank and credit card statements)</li>
<li>Easy configuration for all payment methods</li>
</ul>
<h4>KEY FEATURES</h4>
<ul>
<li>Seamless and fast integration of the payment extension</li>
<li>Complete automation of payment processes</li>
<li>One page checkout no redirection to third party websites</li>
<li>No PCI DSS certification required</li>
</ul>
<h4>MORE PAYMENT METHODS FOR HIGHER CONVERSION</h4>
<ul>
<li>Creditcard: Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Debit card: Maestro</li>
<li>Online Transfer : Instant Bank Transfer, eps, iDEAL, giropay and Przelewy24</li>
<li>PayPal</li>
<li>Prepayment, Invoice Payment, SEPA Direct Debit and Barzahlen</li>
</ul>
<h4>COMPREHENSIVE RISK MANAGEMENT WITH FRAUD PREVENTION</h4>
<p>More than 30 fraud prevention modules integrated:  Professional fraud prevention solutions and optimal risk minimization in real-time.</p>
<h4>OUR EXCELLENT SERVICE FOR YOUR GROWTH</h4>
<ul>
<li>One platform for all relevant payment methods (Credit&amp;Debit cards, Direct Debit, Prepayment, Payment by Invoice, Barzahlen, online Bank Transfer, PayPal, iDEAL etc.)</li>
<li>Risk management with over 40  effective fraud prevention measures</li>
<li>Free technical support upon integration</li>
<li>Fully automated debt collection via email, mail, phone</li>
<li>Multilevel claims management with integrated handover to collection and various export functions for the Accounting</li>
<li>Automated customized invoice generation</li>
<li>Free real-time monitoring to prevent payment failures</li>
<li>Extensive member administration and subscription management</li>
<li>Secure portal for end user inquiries on the transaction</li>
<li>Smart affiliate system with automated split conversion of transaction on revenue sharing</li>
<li>Simple solutions for secure SEPA processing</li>
<li>Flexible payout methods</li>
</ul>
<h4>About Novalnet</h4>
<p><a href="https://www.novalnet.de/" title="Novalnet" rel="nofollow">Novalnet</a> is a financial services institute licensed and supervised by the Federal Financial Supervisory Authority (BaFin), specialized in payment solutions world-wide and meeting the highest standards. Years of experience in the e-commerce sector and a continuous development of its range of services and the corresponding service portfolio enable <a href="https://www.novalnet.de/" title="Novalnet" rel="nofollow">Novalnet</a> to provide maximal reliability and client focus to all customers ‚Äì in every area of payment processing. This way, <a href="https://www.novalnet.de/" title="Novalnet" rel="nofollow">Novalnet</a> supports their customers from the setup process and offers a variety of implemented payment types and intelligent fraud prevention modules as well as a legitimate and reliable receivables and claims management.</p>
<h4>Plugin Functionality</h4>
<ul>
<li>Easy to install and configure</li>
<li>Plug and Play (Independent modules, you don&#8217;t need any extra plugins or scripts to process the Transaction)</li>
<li>Accepts all major credit cards</li>
<li>Capture, Void and Refund options are available</li>
<li>Secure way to process transaction (PCI-certified payment modules)</li>
<li>Automatic Payment Confirmation to update order transaction</li>
<li>Easily compatible with WordPress/Woocommerce plugins</li>
<li>Works with WordPress Multi-Site</li>
<li>Supports Sequential Order Numbers Pro plugin (Custom Order Numbers for WooCommerce)</li>
<li>Supports Debug Log feature</li>
<li>Options to configure customer instructions at order success page and notification emails</li>
</ul>
<h4>Reference</h4>
<p>Please check out our <strong>ssl certified</strong> <a href="https://woocommerce-demo.novalnet.de/" title="Demo Store" rel="nofollow">Demo Store</a></p>
<h3>Translations</h3>
<ul>
