</ul>
<h3>Arbitrary section</h3>
<h4>Connect to WooCommerce :-</h4>
<ol>
<li>
<p>Switch back to the WordPress admin area.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Click on &#8220;WooCommerce&#8221; in the menu on the left and click directly on the sublevel tab &#8220;Settings&#8221; tab there.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Inside the &#8220;Novalnet Global Configuration&#8221; tab you will have the Novalnet merchant global configuration. It will follow the below mentioned structure</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Product activation key</strong> Kindly enter the exact key from Novalnet admin area</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Tariff ID</strong> Kindly select the tariff from the list</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Subscription Tariff ID</strong> Kindly select the subscription tariff from the list</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Display payment method logo</strong> Option to display the payment logo for all payments. Logo will be displayed at the checkout</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Referrer ID</strong> Merchant can set up their Referrer ID</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>On-hold order status management</strong> On-hold transaction order status settings</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Subscription management</strong> Dynamic subscription settings</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Merchant script management</strong> Merchant script (Vendor script) settings</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Please click on the &#8220;Checkout&#8221; tab there in order to configure your Novalnet payment interface properly. Inside the &#8220;Checkout&#8221; tab you will have the individual payment (Direct Debit SEPA) condfiguration. The payment configuration is structured as follows</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Enable payment method</strong> Option to enable respective payment. Payment will be displayed at the checkout</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Enable test mode</strong> Option for the respective payment mode to be in live or test mode</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Payment title in English</strong> Kindly mention the name for the respective payment type in English</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Description in English</strong> The freely configurable description entered here is displayed when your customers select the respective payment type in English</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Payment title in German</strong> Kindly mention the name for the respective payment type in German</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Description in German</strong> The freely configurable description entered here is displayed when your customers select the respective payment type in German</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Shopping type</strong> One click shopping or Zero amount booking for Direct Debit SEPA, Credit Card and PayPal</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Payment guarantee configuration</strong> Payment guarantee settings</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Now, just the following steps have to be executed for going live:</p>
<h4>Go-Live:</h4>
<ol>
<li>
<p>Inside the shop (done by you as merchant)</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Inside the payment type (done by you as merchant)</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Inside the CRM by Novalnet (done by Novalnet as soon as all relevant contract documents are present)</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>As soon as all steps are completed, you can start with sales straight away!</p>
<p>On Any Technical Problems, please contact <strong>sales@novalnet.de / 0049-89-923 068 320</strong></p>
<h4>Important Notice for Online Transfer (Sofort√ºberweisung):</h4>
<p>If you use real transaction data (bank code, bank account number, ect.) real transactions will be performed, even though the test mode is on/activated!</p>
<h3>Distribution</h3>
<p>This plugin enables integration of Novalnet payments with a popular e-commerce solution for WooCommerce. The plugin is 100% free and released under the GNU General Public License. If you have found this script useful a small recommendation as well as a comment on merchant form would be greatly appreciated.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:2509:"<h4>Compatibility</h4>
<p>Novalnet payment plugin compatible for WooCommerce 2.2.x-3.3.5 and compatible for subscription 1.5.x-2.2.19.</p>
<h4>Automatic Installation:</h4>
<ul>
<li>Go to Plugins &gt; ‚ÄúAdd New‚Äù.</li>
<li>Download the WooCommerce payment plugin &#8211; Novalnet from WordPress repository and Click &#8220;Install Now&#8221; to install the plugin. A popup window will ask you to confirm your wish to install the plugin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Note:</h4>
<p>If this is the first time you&#8217;ve installed a WordPress plugin, you may need to enter the FTP login credential information. If you&#8217;ve installed the plugin before, it will still have the login information. This information is available through your web server host.</p>
<ul>
<li>Click ‚ÄúProceed‚Äù to continue the installation. The resulting installation screen will list the installation as successful or note any problems during the install.</li>
<li>If successful, click &#8220;Activate Plugin&#8221; to activate it, or ‚ÄúReturn to Plugin Installer‚Äù for further actions.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Manual Installation:</h4>
<ul>
<li>Download WooCommerce payment plugin &#8211; Novalnet to your desktop. (If downloaded as a zip archive, extract the plugin folder to your desktop.)</li>
<li>Copy the plugin folder and paste into root/wp-content/plugins/ directory.</li>
<li>Go to Plugins (Novalnet payment plugin &#8211; WooCommerce) screen and find the ‚ÄúNovalnet payment plugin &#8211; WooCommerce‚Äù in the list.</li>
<li>Click ‚ÄúActivate Plugin‚Äù to activate it.</li>
<li>Check the details in the readme file for customization and further instructions.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Now you can get your Product activation key from the Novalnet Administration Portal:</h4>
<p>For this, kindly login into the Novalnet Administration Portal:</p>
<ol>
<li>Go to http://www.novalnet.com and click on &#8220;Login&#8221; (top right). You will be redirected to Novalnet Administration Portal login form.</li>
<li>Inside the Novalnet Administration Portal, choose the tab &#8220;Projects&#8221; and click on the respective project in the list.</li>
<li>Click on the tab &#8220;Shop Parameters&#8221;.</li>
<li>You can find Product activation key and enter the key in Novalnet global configuration. It will be automatically load your merchant details (Merchant ID, Authentication code, Project ID, Tariff ID and Payment access key) from Novalnet server.</li>
</ol>
<h4>Now you have all required details to finish setting up your WooCommerce webshop!</h4>
";s:3:"faq";s:5205:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<h4>Compatibility</h4>
<p>Novalnet payment plugin compatible for WooCommerce 2.2.x-3.3.5 and compatible for subscription 1.5.x-2.2.19.</p>
<h4>Automatic Installation:</h4>
<ul>
<li>Go to Plugins &gt; ‚ÄúAdd New‚Äù.</li>
<li>Download the WooCommerce payment plugin &#8211; Novalnet from WordPress repository and Click &#8220;Install Now&#8221; to install the plugin. A popup window will ask you to confirm your wish to install the plugin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Note:</h4>
<p>If this is the first time you&#8217;ve installed a WordPress plugin, you may need to enter the FTP login credential information. If you&#8217;ve installed the plugin before, it will still have the login information. This information is available through your web server host.</p>
<ul>
<li>Click ‚ÄúProceed‚Äù to continue the installation. The resulting installation screen will list the installation as successful or note any problems during the install.</li>
<li>If successful, click &#8220;Activate Plugin&#8221; to activate it, or ‚ÄúReturn to Plugin Installer‚Äù for further actions.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Manual Installation:</h4>
<ul>
<li>Download WooCommerce payment plugin &#8211; Novalnet to your desktop. (If downloaded as a zip archive, extract the plugin folder to your desktop.)</li>
<li>Copy the plugin folder and paste into root/wp-content/plugins/ directory.</li>
<li>Go to Plugins (Novalnet payment plugin &#8211; WooCommerce) screen and find the ‚ÄúNovalnet payment plugin &#8211; WooCommerce‚Äù in the list.</li>
<li>Click ‚ÄúActivate Plugin‚Äù to activate it.</li>
<li>Check the details in the readme file for customization and further instructions.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Now you can get your Product activation key from the Novalnet Administration Portal:</h4>
<p>For this, kindly login into the Novalnet Administration Portal:</p>
<ol>
<li>Go to http://www.novalnet.com and click on &#8220;Login&#8221; (top right). You will be redirected to Novalnet Administration Portal login form.</li>
<li>Inside the Novalnet Administration Portal, choose the tab &#8220;Projects&#8221; and click on the respective project in the list.</li>
<li>Click on the tab &#8220;Shop Parameters&#8221;.</li>
<li>You can find Product activation key and enter the key in Novalnet global configuration. It will be automatically load your merchant details (Merchant ID, Authentication code, Project ID, Tariff ID and Payment access key) from Novalnet server.</li>
</ol>
<h4>Now you have all required details to finish setting up your WooCommerce webshop!</h4>
</p>
<h4>Do I require an Novalnet merchant account before I can use the WooCommerce Novalnet payment plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, in order to use this plugin and access all popular online payment methods within your WooCommerce webshop you must require valid and approved Novalnet account. please contact our sales team <strong>sales@novalnet.de / 0049-89-923 068 320</strong></p>
</p>
<h4>Where merchant can find product activation key?</h4>
<p>
<p>To get the Product Activation Key, please go to <a href="https://admin.novalnet.de/" title="Novalnet admin portal" rel="nofollow">Novalnet admin portal</a> &#8211; PROJECTS: Project Information &#8211; Shop Parameters: API Signature (Product activation key).</p>
</p>
<h4>How to configure server IP, vendor script URL &amp; Paypal API?</h4>
<p>
<p><strong>IP Address Configuration</strong></p>
<p>For all API access (Auto configuration with Product Activation Key, loading Credit Card iframe, Transaction API access, Transaction status enquiry, and update), it is required to configure a server IP address in Novalnet administration portal.</p>
<p>To configure an IP address, please go to <a href="https://admin.novalnet.de/" title="Novalnet admin portal" rel="nofollow">Novalnet admin portal</a> &#8211; PROJECTS: Project Information &#8211; Project Overview: Payment Request IP&#8217;s &#8211; Update Payment Request IP.</p>
<p><strong>Vendor Script URL Configuration</strong></p>
<p>Vendor script URL is required to keep the merchant‚Äôs database/system up-to-date and synchronized with Novalnet transaction status. It is mandatory to configure the Vendor Script URL in Novalnet administration portal.</p>
<p>Novalnet system (via asynchronous) will transmit the information on each transaction and its status to the merchant‚Äôs system.</p>
<p>To configure Vendor Script URL, please go to <a href="https://admin.novalnet.de/" title="Novalnet admin portal" rel="nofollow">Novalnet admin portal</a> &#8211; PROJECTS: Project Information &#8211; Project Overview &#8211; Vendor script URL.</p>
<p><strong>Paypal API Configuration</strong></p>
<p>To configure Paypal API details, please go to <a href="https://admin.novalnet.de/" title="Novalnet admin portal" rel="nofollow">Novalnet admin portal</a> &#8211; PROJECTS: Project Information &#8211; Payment Methods: Paypal &#8211; Configure.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does this plugin work with other Webshop Plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>This online payment plugin only works with the WooCommerce webshop. Are you looking for other online payment modules for webshop software? Please Find the complete overview of our webshop modules on our website. https://www.novalnet.de</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:5563:"<h4>11.2.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>[New] Custom checkout overlay for Barzahlen</li>
<li>[New] Force 3D secure process has been implemented as per predefined filters and settings in the Novalnet admin portal</li>
<li>[Enhanced] Due date update notification in the shop, on activation of transaction for Invoice, Invoice with payment guarantee and Prepayment</li>
<li>[Enhanced] On-hold transaction configuration has been implemented for Credit Card, Direct Debit SEPA, Direct Debit SEPA with payment guarantee, Invoice, Invoice with payment guarantee and PayPal</li>
<li>[Enhanced] Optimized IP condition check for remote address</li>
</ul>
<h4>11.2.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>[Enhanced] Optimized vendor script validation for handling communication failure transaction</li>
</ul>
<h4>11.2.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>[Fixed] Fetching the order amount from the cart instead of session, to make it compatible for the WooCommerce version (above 3.2.0)</li>
<li>[Enhanced] Dynamic IP control applied through domain instead of static IP in vendor script. Actual IP of Novalnet will be extracted in real time from the domain</li>
</ul>
<h4>11.2.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>[New] Implemented Barzahlen payment method </li>
<li>[Enhanced] Optimized vendor script validation </li>
<li>[Removed] Enable debug mode configuration in Merchant script management</li>
</ul>
<h4>11.2.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>[Fixed] Optimized Credit Card and Direct Debit SEPA script</li>
<li>[Enhanced] Adjusted opacity for form payments</li>
<li>[Enhanced] Merchant Administration Portal link has been updated in shop admin</li>
<li>[Enhanced] Date of birth field format has been updated </li>
<li>[Removed] Refund with account details from shop admin</li>
</ul>
<h4>11.2.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>[Fix] Custom order note not displaying</li>
<li>[Fix] Next charging date shouldn&#8217;t display for last recurring</li>
<li>[Fix] IP address issue for windows running IIS v6</li>
<li>[Enhanced] Optimized subscription configuration settings</li>
<li>[Compatible] Tested with WordPress version upto 4.8.1, WooCommerce version upto 3.1.2 and Subscription version upto 2.2.11</li>
</ul>
<h4>11.2.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>[Compatible] Tested with WooCommerce version upto 3.0.7 and Subscription version upto 2.2.6.</li>
</ul>
<h4>11.1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>[New] Implemented Novalnet updates page.</li>
<li>[Enhanced] Updated payment logo for Credit Card and Invoice payment.</li>
<li>[Enhanced] Added new parameter in all API calls.</li>
<li>[Fix] Restriction of email notification to the end customer on callback execution.</li>
<li>[Fix] Issue with single iteration Subscription product (Eg: price per month for 1 month).</li>
<li>[Compatible] Tested with WordPress version 4.7.3 and Subscription version 2.1.4.</li>
</ul>
<h4>11.1.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Novalnet Merchant API configuration has been globally implemented.</li>
<li>On-hold transaction configuration (For Credit Card, Direct Debit SEPA, Invoice and PayPal).</li>
<li>Merchant script notification mail configuration.</li>
<li>Merchant can set up their Referrer ID.</li>
<li>Auto-fill for payment data (Direct Debit SEPA).</li>
<li>Fraud prevention through PIN by Callback/SMS. (For Direct Debit SEPA and Invoice).</li>
<li>Subscription management.</li>
<li>Order and transaction management.</li>
<li>VOID &amp; CAPTURE option for on-hold transaction payments (Direct Debit SEPA, Credit Card, Invoice, Prepayment and PayPal).</li>
<li>Refund option for Credit Card, Direct Debit SEPA, Invoice, Prepayment, Instant Bank Transfer, iDEAL, PayPal, eps, giropay  and Przelewy24.</li>
<li>Transaction amount update option (For Direct Debit SEPA, Invoice and Prepayment).</li>
<li>Due date change option for Prepayment and Invoice payment.</li>
<li>Affiliate management system.</li>
<li>Auto configuration of vendor credentials.</li>
<li>Zero amount booking for Direct Debit SEPA, Credit Card and PayPal.</li>
<li>One click shopping for Direct Debit SEPA, Credit Card and PayPal.</li>
<li>Credit Card iframe updated.</li>
<li>Customized CSS settings for Credit Card iframe form.</li>
<li>Implemented Direct Debit SEPA with payment guarantee, Invoice with payment guarantee, giropay and Przelewy24 payments.</li>
<li>Edit option in Direct Debit SEPA, Credit Card and PayPal for registered customers.</li>
<li>Direct Debit SEPA overlay removed.</li>
<li>Notify URL configuration in shop backend.</li>
<li>Logo control has been implemented in global configuration.</li>
<li>Responsive templates has been implemented.</li>
<li>New booking with payment reference.</li>
</ul>
<h4>10.3.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Compatibility has been checked for latest Woocommerce version 2.3.8 &#8211; 2.6.x and subscription version 2.0.x.</li>
<li>Novalnet payment module has been optimized as per new testcase.</li>
</ul>
<h4>10.3.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Credit Card Iframe implemented.</li>
<li>Implemented giropay payment.</li>
<li>Compatibility has been checked for latest Woocommerce version 2.3.8 &#8211; 2.5.x and subscription version 2.0.x.</li>
<li>Novalnet payment modules has been optimized as per new testcase</li>
<li>Direct Debit SEPA overlay and Credit Card Type removed.</li>
<li>External plugin compatibility has been checked.</li>
<li>Compatibility has been checked for latest Woocommerce version 2.3.8 &#8211; 2.4.x and subscription version 2.0.x.</li>
</ul>
<h4>10.1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Compatibility has been checked for WooCommerce version upto 2.4.6.</li>
</ul>
<h4>10.1.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>External plugin compatibility has been checked.</li>
<li>Payment reference has been implemented.</li>
</ul>
<h4>10.0.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>First Release</li>

36784";s:2:"2x";s:81:"https://ps.w.org/woocommerce-novalnet-gateway/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1636784";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}}s:13:"wordpress-seo";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:9:"Yoast Yoast</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:42:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/joostdevalk";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.8";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.6";s:12:"requires_php";s:5:"5.2.4";s:6:"rating";i:98;s:7:"ratings";a:6:{i:5;i:19765;i:4;i:503;i:3;i:122;i:2;i:92;i:1;i:458;i:0;i:1;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:20941;s:15:"support_threads";i:504;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:445;s:10:"downloaded";i:103884557;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2018-05-16 11:42am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2010-10-11";s:8:"homepage";s:18:"https://yoa.st/1uj";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:5765:"<h3>Yoast SEO: the #1 WordPress SEO plugin</h3>
<p>Need some help with your search engine optimization? Need an SEO plugin that helps you reach for the stars? Yoast SEO is the original WordPress SEO plugin since 2008. It is the favorite tool of millions of users, ranging from the bakery around the corner to some of the most popular sites on the planet. With Yoast SEO, you get a solid toolset that helps you aim for that number one spot in the search results. Yoast: SEO for everyone.</p>
<p>Yoast SEO does everything in its power to please both visitors and search engine spiders. How? Below you‚Äôll find a small sampling of the powers of Yoast SEO:</p>
<h4>Taking care of your WordPress SEO</h4>
<ul>
<li>The most advanced XML Sitemaps functionality at the push of a button.</li>
<li>Full control over site breadcrumbs: add a piece of code and you‚Äôre good to go.</li>
<li>Set canonical URLs to avoid duplicate content. Never have to worry about Google penalties again.</li>
<li>Title and meta description templating for better branding and consistent snippets in the search results.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Expand Yoast SEO with the News SEO, Video SEO, Local SEO and WooCommerce SEO extensions.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Need help? Yoast SEO Premium users get 1 year free access to our awesome support team.</li>
</ul>
<blockquote>
<p>Note: some features are Premium. Which means you need Yoast SEO Premium to unlock those features. You can <a href="https://yoa.st/1v8" rel="nofollow">get Yoast SEO Premium here</a>!</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Write killer content with Yoast SEO</h4>
<ul>
<li>Content &amp; SEO analysis: Invaluable tools to write SEO-friendly texts.</li>
<li>The snippet preview shows you how your post or page will look in the search results &#8211; even on mobile. Yoast SEO Premium even has social media previews!</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> The Insights tool shows you what your text focuses on so you can keep your article in line with your keywords.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Multiple focus keywords: Optimize your article for synonyms and related keywords.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Automatic internal linking suggestions: write your article and get automatic suggested posts to link to.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Keep your site in perfect shape</h4>
<ul>
<li>Yoast SEO tunes the engine of your site so you can work on creating great content.</li>
<li>Our cornerstone content and internal linking features help you optimize your site structure in a breeze.</li>
<li>Integrates with Google Search Console: See how your site performs in the search engines and fix crawl errors.</li>
<li>Manage SEO roles: Give your colleagues access to specific sections of the Yoast SEO plugin.</li>
<li>Bulk editor: Make large-scale edits to your site.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Social previews to manage the way your page is shared on social networks like Facebook and Twitter.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Redirect manager: It keeps your site healthy by easily redirecting errors from Google Search Console, deleted pages and changed URLs.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Premium support</h3>
<p>The Yoast team does not always provide active support for the Yoast SEO plugin on the WordPress.org forums, as we prioritize our email support. One-on-one email support is available to people who <a href="https://yoa.st/1v8" rel="nofollow">bought Yoast SEO Premium</a> only.</p>
<p>Note that the <a href="https://yoa.st/1v8" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Premium</a> also has several extra features too, including the option to have multiple focus keywords, internal linking suggestions, cornerstone content checks and a redirect manager, so it is well worth your investment!</p>
<p>You should also check out the <a href="https://yoa.st/1uu" rel="nofollow">Yoast Local SEO</a>, <a href="https://yoa.st/1uv" rel="nofollow">Yoast News SEO</a> and <a href="https://yoa.st/1uw" rel="nofollow">Yoast Video SEO</a> extensions to Yoast SEO. They work with the free version of Yoast SEO already, and these premium extensions of course come with support too.</p>
<h3>Bug reports</h3>
<p>Bug reports for Yoast SEO are <a href="https://github.com/Yoast/wordpress-seo" rel="nofollow">welcomed on GitHub</a>. Please note GitHub is not a support forum, and issues that aren‚Äôt properly qualified as bugs will be closed.</p>
<h3>Further Reading</h3>
<p>For more info on search engine optimization, check out the following:</p>
<ul>
<li>The <a href="https://yoa.st/1v8" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Plugin</a> official homepage.</li>
<li>The <a href="https://yoa.st/1va" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Knowledgebase</a>.</li>
<li><a href="https://yoa.st/1v6" rel="nofollow">WordPress SEO &#8211; The definitive Guide by Yoast</a>.</li>
<li>Other <a href="https://yoa.st/1v9" rel="nofollow">WordPress Plugins</a> by the same team.</li>
<li>Follow Yoast on <a href="https://facebook.com/yoast" rel="nofollow">Facebook</a> &amp; <a href="https://twitter.com/yoast" rel="nofollow">Twitter</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>From within WordPress</h3>
<ol>
<li>Visit &#8216;Plugins &gt; Add New&#8217;</li>
<li>Search for &#8216;Yoast SEO&#8217;</li>
<li>Activate Yoast SEO from your Plugins page.</li>
<li>Go to &#8220;after activation&#8221; below.</li>
</ol>
<h3>Manually</h3>
<ol>
<li>Upload the <code>wordpress-seo</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the Yoast SEO plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Go to &#8220;after activation&#8221; below.</li>
</ol>
<h3>After activation</h3>
<ol>
<li>You should see (a notice to start) the Yoast SEO configuration wizard.</li>
<li>Go through the configuration wizard and set up the plugin for your site.</li>
<li>You&#8217;re done!</li>
</ol>

";s:9:"changelog";s:3575:"<h4>7.5.1</h4>
<p>Release Date: May 16th, 2018</p>
<p>Bugfixes:<br />
* Fixes a bug where the auto-generating of the slug did not work as expected due to persisting of the post name too agressively.</p>
<h4>7.5.0</h4>
<p>Release Date: May 15th, 2018</p>
<p>Enhancements:<br />
* Adds readability analysis for Russian.<br />
* Improves accessibility.</p>
<p>Bugfixes:<br />
* Fixes a bug where images with specific aspect ratios where removed from OpenGraph consideration. This was causing unexpected results with Facebook sharing. The aspect ratio check has been removed completely.<br />
* Fixes a bug where sentences ending in multiple sentence marks, exclamation marks or ellipses were treated as multiple sentences.<br />
* Fixes a bug where attempting to get Yoast SEO options in multi-site, would result in wrong values being returned.<br />
* Fixes a bug where the sitemap styling could not be loaded when the Site domain differs from the Admin domain.<br />
* Fixes a bug where the admin bar still used old copy: Dashboard has been renamed to General.</p>
<h4>7.4.2</h4>
<p>Release Date: May 3rd, 2018</p>
<p>Bugfixes:<br />
* Fixes automatic image size detection for OpenGraph images. When an image was used that was too large, we wouldn&#8217;t output the <code>og:image</code> tag. That is now fixed.<br />
* Fixes a bug where portrait images where not allowed for the OpenGraph image.</p>
<h4>7.4.1</h4>
<p>Release Date: May 2nd, 2018</p>
<p>Bugfixes:<br />
* Re-adds <code>wpseo_opengraph_image_size</code> filter. This will completely override any automatic size determination our code does. This filter now also applies to all ways an <code>og:image</code> can be determined: In the content, as a featured image or as set in our Facebook image setting.<br />
* Fixes an unintended backwards incompatible change which caused &#8220;Warning: Illegal string offset ‚Äòurl‚Äô in&#8221;.<br />
* Fixes an unintended change which caused SVGs to be included in consideration for the <code>og:image</code> tag. SVG images are not allowed by Facebook, so these should never be used in the <code>og:image</code> tag.</p>
<h4>7.4.0</h4>
<p>Release Date: May 1st, 2018</p>
<p>Enhancements:<br />
* Adds OpenGraph image dimension-meta tags for more images.<br />
* Excludes images from being used in OpenGraph meta tags, if the image is larger than 2MB.<br />
* Adds caching for images found in a post to reduce load.<br />
* Adds image alt tag to the OpenGraph output, using the meta tag <code>og:image:alt</code>.<br />
* Adds the <code>is_post_type_viewable</code> WordPress function to improve support for the <code>wpseo_accessible_post_types</code> filters.</p>
<p>Bugfixes:<br />
* Fixes a bug where a non-array value causes a fatal error when <code>cron_schedules</code> filter has been executed.<br />
* Fixes a bug where not all database tables were removed when a subsite was deleted in a multisite environment.<br />
* Fixes a bug where deleting multiple posts might cause performance issues. Props to <a href="https://github.com/abolfazl-moeini" rel="nofollow">Moeini</a>.</p>
<p>Other:<br />
* Introduces a message, warning about dropping of PHP 5.2 support in an upcoming version.<br />
* Alters the configuration service text in the Configuration Wizard when a user is already running Yoast SEO Premium. Previously the text contained a reference to getting a bundled copy of Premium, even if the user was already running Premium.</p>
<h4>Earlier versions</h4>
<p>For the changelog of earlier versions, please refer to https://yoa.st/yoast-seo-changelog</p>

(WP-Piwik)";s:4:"slug";s:8:"wp-piwik";s:7:"version";s:6:"1.0.19";s:6:"author";s:64:"<a href="http://www.braekling.de">Andr&eacute; Br&auml;kling</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/braekling";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.8.6";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:92;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:72;i:4;i:3;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:7;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:84;s:15:"support_threads";i:8;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:3;s:10:"downloaded";i:1440682;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-01-09 9:13am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2009-06-04";s:8:"homepage";s:45:"http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-piwik/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:4529:"<p>This plugin uses the Matomo API to show your Matomo statistics in your WordPress dashboard. It&#8217;s also able to add the Matomo tracking code to your blog and to do some modifications to the tracking code. Additionally, WP-Matomo supports WordPress networks and manages multiple sites and their tracking codes.</p>
<p>To use this plugin the Matomo web analytics application is required. If you do not already have a Matomo setup (e.g., provided by your web hosting service), you have two simple options: use either a <a href="http://matomo.org/" rel="nofollow">self-hosted Matomo</a> or a <a href="https://www.innocraft.cloud/?pk_campaign=WP-Piwik" rel="nofollow">cloud-hosted Matomo by InnoCraft</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Requirements:</strong> PHP 7.0 (or higher), WordPress 4.0 (or higher), Matomo 3.0 (or higher)</p>
<p><strong>Languages:</strong> English, Albanian, Chinese, Dutch, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Italian, Polish, Portuguese (Brazil). Partially supported: Azerbaijani, Belarusian, Hindi, Lithuanian, Luxembourgish, Norwegian, Persian, Romanian, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish, Ukrainian</p>
<h4>What is Matomo?</h4>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/OslfF_EH81g?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span><br />
<a href="https://matomo.org/what-is-matomo/" rel="nofollow">Learn more.</a></p>
<h4>First steps</h4>
<ul>
<li>Learn how to install your own Matomo instance: <a href="https://matomo.org/docs/requirements/" rel="nofollow">Requirements</a>, <a href="https://matomo.org/docs/installation-optimization/" rel="nofollow">Installation</a>.</li>
<li>If you need support about Matomo, please have a look at the <a href="https://forum.matomo.org/" rel="nofollow">Matomo forums</a>.</li>
<li>Finally, you can start <a href="https://matomo.org/blog/2015/05/wordpress-integration-wp-piwik-1-0/" rel="nofollow">setting up WP-Matomo</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Shortcodes</h4>
<p>You can use following shortcodes if activated:</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik module="overview" title="" period="day" date="yesterday"]
</code></pre>
<p>Shows overview table like WP-Matomo&#8217;s overview dashboard. See Matomo API documentation on VisitsSummary.get to get more information on period and day. Multiple data arrays will be cumulated. If you fill the title attribute, its content will be shown in the table&#8217;s title.</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik module="opt-out" language="en" width="100%" height="200px"]
</code></pre>
<p>Shows the Matomo opt-out Iframe. You can change the Iframe&#8217;s language by the language attribute (e.g. de for German language) and its width and height using the corresponding attributes.</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik module="post" range="last30" key="sum_daily_nb_uniq_visitors"]
</code></pre>
<p>Shows the chosen keys value related to the current post. You can define a range (format: lastN, previousN or YYYY-MM-DD,YYYY-MM-DD) and the desired value&#8217;s key (e.g., sum_daily_nb_uniq_visitors, nb_visits or nb_hits &#8211; for details see Matomo&#8217;s API method Actions.getPageUrl using a range).</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik]
</code></pre>
<p>is equal to <em>[wp-piwik module=&#8221;overview&#8221; title=&#8221;&#8221; period=&#8221;day&#8221; date=&#8221;yesterday&#8221;]</em>.</p>
<h4>Credits</h4>
<ul>
<li>Graphs powered by <a href="http://www.jqplot.com/" rel="nofollow">jqPlot</a> (GPL 2.0 and MIT) and and <a href="http://omnipotent.net/jquery.sparkline/" rel="nofollow">jQuery Sparklines</a> (New BSD License).</li>
<li>All translators at the <a href="https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/wp-piwik/" rel="nofollow">Transifex translation community</a>.</li>
<li>Donations: Marco L., Rolf W., Tobias U., Lars K., Donna F., Kevin D., Ramos S., Thomas M., John C., Andreas G., Ben M., Myra R. I., Carlos U. R.-S., Oleg I., M. <li>All users who send me mails containing criticism, commendation, feature requests and bug reports &#8211; you help me to make WP-Matomo much better!</li>
</ul>
<p>Thank you all!</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:2466:"<h4>General Notes</h4>
<ul>
<li>First, you have to set up a running Matomo instance. You can get Matomo <a href="http://matomo.org/" rel="nofollow">here</a> and its documentation <a href="http://matomo.org/docs/" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</li>
<li>If you want to update your Matomo instance, you should set your WordPress blog to maintenance while the update process is running.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Install WP-Matomo on a simple WordPress blog</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload the full <code>wp-piwik</code> directory into your <code>wp-content/plugins</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
<li>Open the new &#8216;Settings/WP-Matomo (WP-Piwik) Settings&#8217; menu and follow the instructions to configure your Matomo connection. Save settings.</li>
<li>If you have view access to multiple site stats and did not enable &#8220;auto config&#8221;, choose your blog and save settings again.</li>
<li>Look at &#8216;Dashboard/WP-Matomo (WP-Piwik)&#8217; to see your site stats.</li>
</ol>
<h4>Install WP-Matomo on a WordPress blog network (WPMU/WP multisite)</h4>
<p>There are two differents methods to use WP-Matomo in a multisite environment:</p>
<ul>
<li>As a Site Specific Plugin it behaves like a plugin installed on a simple WordPress blog. Each user can enable, configure and use WP-Matomo on his own. Users can even use their own Matomo instances (and accordingly they have to). </li>
<li>Using WP-Matomo as a Network Plugin equates to a central approach. A single Matomo instance is used and the site admin configures the plugin completely. Users are just allowed to see their own statistics, site admins can see each blog&#8217;s stats.</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Site Specific Plugin</em></p>
<p>Just add WP-Matomo to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable the Plugins page for individual site administrators. Each user has to enable and configure WP-Matomo on his own if he want to use the plugin.</p>
<p><em>Network Plugin</em></p>
<p>The Network Plugin support is still experimental. Please test it on your own (e.g. using a local copy of your WP multisite) before you use it in an user context.</p>
<p>Add WP-Matomo to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable it as <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Create_A_Network#WordPress_Plugins" rel="nofollow">Network Plugin</a>. Users can access their own statistics, site admins can access each blog&#8217;s statistics and the plugin&#8217;s configuration.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:6377:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<h4>General Notes</h4>
<ul>
<li>First, you have to set up a running Matomo instance. You can get Matomo <a href="http://matomo.org/" rel="nofollow">here</a> and its documentation <a href="http://matomo.org/docs/" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</li>
<li>If you want to update your Matomo instance, you should set your WordPress blog to maintenance while the update process is running.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Install WP-Matomo on a simple WordPress blog</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload the full <code>wp-piwik</code> directory into your <code>wp-content/plugins</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
<li>Open the new &#8216;Settings/WP-Matomo (WP-Piwik) Settings&#8217; menu and follow the instructions to configure your Matomo connection. Save settings.</li>
<li>If you have view access to multiple site stats and did not enable &#8220;auto config&#8221;, choose your blog and save settings again.</li>
<li>Look at &#8216;Dashboard/WP-Matomo (WP-Piwik)&#8217; to see your site stats.</li>
</ol>
<h4>Install WP-Matomo on a WordPress blog network (WPMU/WP multisite)</h4>
<p>There are two differents methods to use WP-Matomo in a multisite environment:</p>
<ul>
<li>As a Site Specific Plugin it behaves like a plugin installed on a simple WordPress blog. Each user can enable, configure and use WP-Matomo on his own. Users can even use their own Matomo instances (and accordingly they have to). </li>
<li>Using WP-Matomo as a Network Plugin equates to a central approach. A single Matomo instance is used and the site admin configures the plugin completely. Users are just allowed to see their own statistics, site admins can see each blog&#8217;s stats.</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Site Specific Plugin</em></p>
<p>Just add WP-Matomo to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable the Plugins page for individual site administrators. Each user has to enable and configure WP-Matomo on his own if he want to use the plugin.</p>
<p><em>Network Plugin</em></p>
<p>The Network Plugin support is still experimental. Please test it on your own (e.g. using a local copy of your WP multisite) before you use it in an user context.</p>
<p>Add WP-Matomo to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable it as <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Create_A_Network#WordPress_Plugins" rel="nofollow">Network Plugin</a>. Users can access their own statistics, site admins can access each blog&#8217;s statistics and the plugin&#8217;s configuration.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I find the Matomo URL and the Matomo auth token?</h4>
<p>
<p>To use this plugin you will need your own Matomo instance. If you do not already have a Matomo setup, you have two simple options: use either a <a href="http://matomo.org/" rel="nofollow">self-hosted Matomo</a> or <a href="https://www.innocraft.cloud/?pk_campaign=WP-Piwik" rel="nofollow">cloud-hosted Matomo by InnoCraft</a>.</p>
<p>As soon as Matomo works, you&#8217;ll be able to configure WP-Matomo: The Matomo URL is the same URL you use to access your Matomo, e.g. for the demo site: http://demo.matomo.org. The auth token is some kind of a secret password, which allows WP-Matomo to get the necessary data from Matomo. To get your auth token, log in to Matomo, click at the preferences gear icon (top right) and click at &#8220;API&#8221; (left sidebar menu, near the bottom).</p>
<p>You can get a more detailed description here: https://matomo.org/blog/2015/05/wordpress-integration-wp-piwik-1-0/</p>
</p>
<h4>I get this message: &#8220;WP-Matomo (WP-Piwik) was not able to connect to Matomo (Piwik) using our configuration&#8221;. How to proceed?</h4>
<p>
<p>First, please make sure your configuration is valid, e.g., if you are using the right Matomo URL (see description above). Then, go to the &#8220;Support&#8221; tab and run the test script. This test script will try to get some information from Matomo and shows the full response. Usually, the response output gives a clear hint what&#8217;s wrong:</p>
<p>The response output contains&#8230;<br />
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and <strong>HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden</strong>: WP-Matomo is not allowed to connect to Matomo. Please check your Matomo server&#8217;s configuration. Maybe you are using a password protection via .htaccess or you are blocking requests from localhost/127.0.0.1. If you aren‚Äôt sure about this, please contact your web hoster for support.<br />
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and <strong>HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found</strong>: The Matomo URL is wrong. Try to copy &amp; paste the URL you use to access Matomo itself via browser.<br />
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and no further HTTP response code: The Matomo server does not respond. Very often, this is caused by firewall or mod_security settings. Check your server logfiles to get further information. If you aren‚Äôt sure about this, please contact your web hoster for support.</p>
</p>
<h4>PHP Compatibility Checker reports PHP7 compatbility issues with WP-Matomo.</h4>
<p>
<p>The Compatibility Checker shows two false positives. WP-Matomo is 100% PHP7 compatible, you can ignore the report.</p>
</p>
<h4>Overview shortcode shows no unique visitors using a yearly range.</h4>
<p>
<p>See <a href="http://matomo.org/faq/how-to/#faq_113" rel="nofollow">Matomo FAQ</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>WP-Matomo only shows the first 100 sites of my multisite network. How can I get all other sites?</h4>
<p>
<p>The Matomo API is limited to 100 sites by default. Add the following line to the section [General] of Matomo&#8217;s config/config.ini.php file:</p>
<pre><code>API_datatable_default_limit = 1000
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>Tracking does not work on HostGator!</h4>
<p>
<p>Try to enable the &#8220;avoid mod_security&#8221; option (WP-Matomo settings, Tracking tab) or create a mod_security whitelist.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I contribute to WP-Matomo as a translator?</h4>
<p>
<p>You like to contribute to WP-Matomo translations? Please use the <a href="https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/wp-piwik/" rel="nofollow">Transifex translation community</a>.</p>
<p>Of course, I will add missing languages if requested, and I will also upload the existing language files of older WP-Matomo releases.</p>
<p>If you can&#8217;t (or don not want to) use transifex, you can also translate languages/wp-piwik.pot delivered with WP-Matomo.</p>
<p>Thank you very much! üôÇ</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:25396:"<h4>1.0.19</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security fix: Escape request var</li>
<li>Language updates</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.18</h4>
<ul>
<li>WPML.org support: Use different site IDs for different languages</li>
<li>Ecommerce widgets</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Header issue solved which caused incompatibilities with other plugins like Yoast SEO</li>
<li>Update of InnoCraft cloud links (InnoCraft is the team behind Matomo)</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid a broken page if Matomo is misconfigured and WordPress debugging enabled</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.16</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added InnoCraft Cloud support (the new service created by the people behind Matomo). Piwik.pro is still usable via HTTP mode, the configuration will be updated automatically.</li>
<li>Added search functionality to site browser</li>
<li>Added preload DNS option, see https://matomo.org/blog/2017/04/important-performance-optimizations-load-piwik-javascript-tracker-faster/</li>
<li>Added option to set link and download classes (expert settings)</li>
<li>Added option to choose which post types should be considered for annotations</li>
<li>Bugfix: Opening Matomo stats of a specific network site does not lead to the sitebrowser anymore</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid unnecessary notices</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid a warning in proxy script</li>
<li>Bugfix: NoScript code is working again</li>
<li>Replaced deprecated wp_get_sites</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Allow to modify the tracked user ID using the filter &#8220;wp-piwik_tracking_user_id&#8221;</li>
<li>Bugfix: Output of &#8220;post&#8221; shortcode was incorrectly placed, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/post-shortcode-values-are-incorrectly-placed/</li>
<li>Bugfix: Usage of WP_PROXY_BYPASS_HOSTS, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/bug-considering-wp_proxy_bypass_hosts-in-proxy-setups/</li>
<li>Bugfix: Proxy script did not work with cURL, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Matomo/issues/48</li>
<li>Bugfix: RSS feed tracking did not use proxy URL</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Action &#8220;wp-piwik_site_created&#8221; was extended by a site ID parameter, so it will deliver the Matomo site ID of the created site</li>
<li>Bugfix: Fixed an issue with Matomo site creation</li>
<li>Bugfix: Allow changes of a manually defined tracking code on networks, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Matomo/issues/46</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Language updates</li>
<li>Readme typo fixes (thx to ujdhesa)</li>
<li>Perform your own code after site creation by using the action &#8220;wp-piwik_site_created&#8221;</li>
<li>Improved caching ID to avoid interferences, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Matomo/issues/42</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.12</h4>
<ul>
<li>Removed notices and warnings</li>
<li>Allow to modify the tracking code using the filter &#8220;wp-piwik_tracking_code&#8221;</li>
<li>Network: Don&#8217;t show plugin overview settings link on individual sites</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.11</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security improvements</li>
<li>Removed some division by zero warnings</li>
<li>Option to disable SSL host verification (additional to peer verification)</li>
<li>Overview widget: Do not show unique visitors row if value is not available</li>
<li>Bugfix: Post shortcode is fixed and will work again</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security fix</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>Language updates</li>
<li>Bugfix: Deprecated get_currentuserinfo() replace. Thx to the infinity, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Matomo/pull/21</li>
<li>Bugfix: Overview widget will show proper values even if a period &gt; 1 day is selected, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/weird-numbers-im-wp-piwik</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature: Show &#8220;per post stats&#8221; and the &#8220;custom variable meta box&#8221; also on page and custom post edit</li>
<li>Bugfix: Fixed user tracking (moved the user tracking changes from general modifications to runtime modifications)</li>
<li>Bugfix: Fixed namespace error. Thx to thelfensdrfer, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Matomo/pull/18</li>
<li>Bugfix: Warning on blog name change, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/wp-piwik-triggers-warning-when-changing-blog-name</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature: User ID Tracking. Thx to Danw33, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Matomo/pull/16</li>
<li>Feature: Site ID parameter added to opt-out shortcode. Thx to christianhennen, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Matomo/pull/17</li>
<li>Feature: Allow a local config file to affect the proxy script, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/proxy-config-require-wp-loadphp-path</li>
<li>Bugfix: No script tag is not auto-inserted if the tracking code is manually defined.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Language updates</li>
<li>Encoding &amp; gettext fixes</li>
<li>Better error messages. Thx to mcguffin, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Matomo/pull/14</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Several language updates.</li>
<li>Important security fix: XSS vulnerability</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Several language updates.</li>
<li>Feature: Offer setDownloadExtensions option (see expert settings).</li>
<li>Feature: Consider configured HTTP connection method in proxy script.</li>
<li>Widget: Visitor country added.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Annotations on scheduled posts will work.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Donation button will work again.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Several language updates.</li>
<li>Switch to JSON renderer (Matomo 3 compatibility preparation)</li>
<li>Workaround: PHP API will work with Matomo 2.14+, see https://github.com/matomo-org/piwik/issues/8311 for further information.</li>
<li>Feature: Heartbeat timer support</li>
<li>Feature: Expanded token &amp; URL/path input fields</li>
<li>Bugfix: Site duplication fix.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid notice on empty overview response.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Return request error responses.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Opt-out URL fixed.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Capabilities: &#8220;Do not track&#8221;-filter and &#8220;show stats&#8221;-limit will work on multisites as expected again.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Several language updates.</li>
<li>Feature: Disable update notifications (expert settings).</li>
<li>Feature: Choose between cURL and fopen if both are available (expert settings).</li>
<li>Feature: Choose between POST and GET (expert settings).</li>
<li>Widget: System details added.</li>
<li>Widget: SEO widget re-enabled.</li>
<li>Update: Replaced deprecated Matomo API calls.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Settings link (toolbar, network mode) fixed.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Encode blog titles in PHP mode.</li>
<li>Bugfix: Pie charts won&#8217;t show to long legends if more than 10 items are available.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Several language updates, amongst others Portuges (Brazil) finished. See https://www.transifex.com/organization/piwik/dashboard/wp-piwik for further information.</li>
<li>Bugfix: If WP-Matomo is not configured properly or the connection to Matomo could not be established, the toolbar graph won&#8217;t cause a JavaScript error anymore.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature: Expand &#8220;other&#8221; values on click</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid notices on invalid file path (PHP API)</li>
<li>Bugfix: Cookie lifetime input boxes are in some cases shown or hidden by mistake</li>
<li>Network (multisite): Updated plugin to use wp_get_sites if possible</li>
<li>Test script: Settings dump added</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.10.1.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Fixed memory &amp; timeout issue on multisites</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.10.0.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>Add clear cache function.</li>
<li>Add clear settings (reset) function.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.10.0.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Sitebrowser link (settings page, support) fixed</li>
<li>Bugfix: Use new settings directly after saving (reloading is not necessary anymore)</li>
<li>Optimized caching behaviour</li>
<li>Language update (German, French)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.10.0.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Opt-out shortcode output fix</li>
<li>Bugfix: Opt-out shortcode will also work in &#8220;pro&#8221; and &#8220;php&#8221; mode</li>
<li>Bugfix: Test script link (settings page, support) fixed</li>
<li>Bugfix: Removed test script errors and notices</li>
<li>Bugfix: Keep sure the revision ID is stored and avoid re-installing the plugin again and again</li>
<li>Bugfix: http/pro &#8211; after configuration the settings page had to be reloaded once to start working</li>
<li>Typo fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.10.0.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Option storage bug if WP-Matomo is used as single site plugin on blog networks</li>
<li>Bugfix: WP-Matomo will work without Matomo superuser access, again</li>
<li>Bugfix: Choosing the site without auto config works again</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.10.0.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: In some cases the update message did not disappear -&gt; fixed</li>
<li>Important change: If you want to upgrade from 0.8.x to 0.10.x, please install 0.9.9.18 first: https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.0.9.9.18.zip</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.10.0.4</h4>

<li>Feature: If Matomo returns an error instead of a tracking code, this error will be visible</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.10.0.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Public beta of WP-Matomo 1.0</li>
<li>Full refactored code</li>
<li>Feature: Limit referral cookie lifetime</li>
<li>Feature: Enable content tracking</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Define additional file extensions for tracking downloads</li>
<li>Improvement: Added a POT file to support translators (Note: 1.0 will change a lot, so please don&#8217;t spend too much time in translating the current version, e.g., by creating an all new translation. With 1.0 I will also offer a translation platform to support your work.)</li>
<li>Improvement: If necessary, you can force Matomo to use HTTP or HTTPS now (e.g., to avoid redirections from http to https)</li>
<li>Avoided a naming collision with Woo Theme</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improvement: Updated the Matomo proxy script and added cURL support if url_fopen is not available</li>
<li>Bugfix: Setup bug, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/piwik-urlpath-not-saved</li>
<li>Bugfix: CDN URL notice, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/tracking-cdn-blank-gives-php-notice-which-breaks-the-trackback-js-code</li>
<li>Bugfix: Fixed zlib compression notice, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/v09914-is-bad</li>
<li>Bugfix: Proxy script label links to proxy script checkbox</li>
<li>Fixed a typo in German language file</li>
</ul>

<li>Bugfix: Removed PHP warning if annotations are enabled and annotations will work again, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/warning-message-everywhere-in-the-backend-call_user_func_array-expects</li>
<li>Feature: &#8220;Track visitors across all subdomains&#8221; script changes are done by Matomo now, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/track-across-subdomains-wp-on-subdomain?replies=2</li>

</ul>

being replaced by <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mailpoet/">MailPoet 3</a>.</p>
<p>Version 2 will remain available right here on the repository. <a href="https://www.mailpoet.com/faq-mailpoet-version-2/" rel="nofollow">Read more the complete FAQ.</a></p>
<h4>Check out this 2 minute video.</h4>
<p><div class="embed-vimeo" style="text-align: center;"><iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/130151897" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe></div>
</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<p>Please visit <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mailpoet/">MailPoet version 3 features</a> instead.</p>
<h4>Premium version</h4>
<p>MailPoet Premium offers these nifty extra features:</p>
<ul>
<li>Send to more than 2000 subscribers</li>
<li>A beautiful statistics dashboard to compare your newsletters and subscribers</li>
<li>Detailed stats for each subscriber and newsletter</li>
<li>Automated bounce handling that keeps your subscribers&#8217; list clean</li>
<li>Test your SPAM score before you send a newsletter to your subscribers</li>
<li>Improve deliverability with DKIM signature</li>
<li>Simple install process</li>
<li>Priority support</li>
</ul>
<h4>Support</h4>
<p>This version is no longer officially supported. Paying customer will continue to be supported until further notice.</p>

";s:12:"installation";s:970:"<p>There are 3 ways to install this plugin:</p>
<h4>1. The super easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Search for <code>mailpoet</code></li>
<li>Click to install</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>2. The easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>Download the plugin (.zip file) on the right column of this page</li>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Select the tab &#8220;Upload&#8221;</li>
<li>Upload the .zip file you just downloaded</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>3. The old and reliable way (FTP)</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload <code>wysija-newsletters</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:1308:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>There are 3 ways to install this plugin:</p>
<h4>1. The super easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Search for <code>mailpoet</code></li>
<li>Click to install</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>2. The easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>Download the plugin (.zip file) on the right column of this page</li>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Select the tab &#8220;Upload&#8221;</li>
<li>Upload the .zip file you just downloaded</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>3. The old and reliable way (FTP)</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload <code>wysija-newsletters</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>Got questions?</h4>
<p>
<p>Our <a href="https://www.mailpoet.com/support" rel="nofollow">support site</a> has plenty of articles and a ticketing system.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.mailpoet.com/faq-mailpoet-version-2/" rel="nofollow">Read more the complete FAQ on version 2.</a></p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:58332:"<h4>2.8.2 &#8211; 2018-03-14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved: protection against spam attacks. Thanks, Eslam Mohamed Reda!</li>
<li>Fixed: support for PHP 5.2 has been restored.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.8.1 &#8211; 2017-11-28</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added poll and discounts</li>
<li>Fixed editor sidebar missing if plugins enqueue the mediaelement script on WP 4.9</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.8 &#8211; 2017-11-20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added support for ReCaptcha to protect subscription forms from automated abuse</li>
<li>Fixed editor sidebar missing if a theme uses wp_enqueue_media() function on WP 4.9</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.15.1 &#8211; 2017-11-02</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved IP throttling to work independently of subscribers table (for robustness)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.14 &#8211; 2017-10-23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Removed SWFUpload support</li>
<li>Fixed path for TinyMCE styles</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.13 &#8211; 2017-09-29</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added throttling of repeated subscriptions from an IP address</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.12.1 &#8211; 2017-09-19</h4>
<ul>
<li>Update messages in regards to official launch of MailPoet version 3</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.11.3 &#8211; 2017-07-21</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed Premium version download link</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.11.1 &#8211; 2017-07-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved welcome and update pages</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.10 &#8211; 2017-04-20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Introduced minor changes to the premium page</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.9 &#8211; 2017-04-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed security issue reported by Craig Smith. Thanks!</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.8 &#8211; 2017-03-03</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed sending issues when MailPoet&#8217;s sending service is selected</li>
<li>Fixed sending post notifications when tag filters are used</li>
<li>Fixed the display of incorrect newsletter title in browser preview</li>
<li>Fixed PHP notices associated with sending on multisite hosts</li>
<li>Fixed broken DKIM signing</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.7 &#8211; 2017-01-31</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed activation issues on PHP 5.2</li>
<li>Removed PHPMailer library in compliance with the new WordPress security policy. Please report any sending issues!</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.6 &#8211; 2017-01-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed post categories not being displayed in sent newsletters</li>
<li>Fixed PHPMailer vulnerability</li>
<li>Fixed PEAR POP3&#8217;s usage of static methods</li>
<li>Fixed direct manipulation of the $wp_filter global</li>
<li>Fixed BBPress unsubscribe compatibility</li>
<li>Added ElasticEmail unsubscribe tag</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.5 &#8211; 2016-08-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed subscription form widget</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.4 &#8211; 2016-08-09</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed error appearing during newsletter creation</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.3 &#8211; 2016-08-08</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed issue with emoji when saving newsletters</li>
<li>Prevent encoding of &#8220;tel:&#8221; URLs</li>
<li>Fixed SQL injection vulnerability (Thanks to Force Interactive)</li>
<li>Fixed XSS vulnerability (Thanks to Sipke Mellema from Securify B.V.)</li>
<li>Fixed PHP warnings on Bounce management</li>
<li>Escape commma and quote marks during export</li>
<li>Fixed some editor issues</li>
<li>Fixed double signed DKIM emails</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.2 &#8211; 2016-06-01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed broken CSS for Premium page</li>
<li>Fixed Custom Fields not saving on front-end</li>
<li>Fixed image ratio for specific locations</li>
<li>Fixed issue with missing rule (onlyNumberSp) in Italian &amp; German translations</li>
<li>Fixed broken email validation in Dutch language with long extensions</li>
<li>Fixed undefined property notice on Bounce pages</li>
<li>Added SparkPost API support</li>
<li>Fixed security issues. Thanks again to Falk Huber (T-Systems) for reporting them</li>
<li>Added new menu icon (New MailPoet Branding)</li>
<li>Fixed sending preview of an email with an empty subject</li>
<li>Added Ukrainian JS validation language</li>
<li>Replaced deprecated get_currentuserinfo() with wp_get_current_user()</li>
<li>Fixed PHP notices that may have appeared during the sending process</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.1 &#8211; 2016-03-15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed security issues. Thanks to Falk Huber for letting us now.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7 &#8211; 2016-01-29</h4>
<ul>
<li>Enabled PHP7 compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed security issues. Thanks to Immunity and Netsparker (https://www.netsparker.com) for alerting us.</li>
<li>Fixed an issue with newsletters not saving during the creation process</li>
<li>Disabled SSL verification on hosts with invalid SSL certificates and PHP 5.6</li>
<li>Updated SendGrid mailer</li>
<li>Improved URL validation logic</li>
<li>Addressed PHP notices that appeared in cron output</li>
<li>Fixed other minor issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.19 &#8211; 2015-10-13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a URL validation issue when WP&#8217;s home &amp; site URLs are different. Kudos to Divaldo for pointing it out.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.18 &#8211; 2015-09-21</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed URL validation issue</li>
<li>Improved newsletter/subscriber search</li>
<li>Fixed minor issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.17 &#8211; 2015-09-04</h4>
<ul>
<li>Enhanced redirection check in email URLs.</li>
<li>Fixed old-style PHP constructors.</li>
<li>Fixed newsletter preview bug.</li>
<li>Fixed import issues on old PHP versions.</li>
<li>Fixed minor issues.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.16 &#8211; 2015-06-23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added HHVM support</li>
<li>Added MariaDB support</li>
<li>Fixed import issue where existing subscriber&#8217;s data was not updated</li>
<li>Fixed minor issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.15 &#8211; 2015-02-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed hidden signup confirmation when the theme &#8220;Twenty Fifteen&#8221; is activated</li>
<li>Fixed import issue on Windows servers, all valid subscribers CSV files can be imported now</li>
<li>Fixed the filter &#8220;Subscribers in no list&#8221; in the Subscribers&#8217; listing in the backend</li>
<li>Fixed bug in the frontend subscriptions page with the shortcode [wysija_page] not being replaced</li>
<li>Fixed rendering issue when sending WordPress Post notifications including multiple levels of nested HTML lists(ul &amp; ol)</li>

<li>Added &#8220;WBounce&#8221; to our list of compatible plugins in Settings &gt; Add-ons</li>
<li>Added non-translated strings for the subscribe and unsubscribe admin notifications</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.6 &#8211; 2014-03-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>This is the juiciest of all releases. Ready?</li>
<li>a new statistics dashboard in Premium. The beauty of the big picture</li>
<li>add more fields in your subscription forms, like phone number, address, or whatever you like</li>
<li>display an archive of your past newsletters in a page with a shortcode. Find it in the settings</li>
<li>display your posts&#8217; author names and categories in the newsletter editor</li>
<li>insert several posts at once in the editor, instead of one at a time. Time saver</li>
<li>a dozen new display options when you drop your posts in the newsletter, for the control freaks</li>
<li>find a list of add-ons in the settings. Plug your MailPoet with your other favorite plugins, like Gravity Forms</li>
<li>select your own WordPress pages for your confirmation and unsubscribe pages</li>
<li>use your MailPoet shortcodes in your confirmation emails, like [user:firstname | default:reader]</li>
<li>MailPoet now abides to German privacy laws. Guten tag Alex!</li>
<li>the browser version of your newsletter now include the Google Analytics tracking code (Premium)</li>
<li>right to left language improvements</li>
<li>our user interface is now styled for 3.8</li>
<li>needless to say, hundreds of mini improvements</li>
<li>we hand over to you 6 months of hard work. Enjoy!</li>
</ul>

Thumbnails Advanced";s:4:"slug";s:30:"regenerate-thumbnails-advanced";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.6.3";s:6:"author";s:50:"<a href="http://ciprianturcu.com">turcuciprian</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/turcuciprian";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.6";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:86;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:10;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:2;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:12;s:15:"support_threads";i:4;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:124704;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-05-01 9:23am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-07-10";s:8:"homepage";s:23:"http://ciprianturcu.com";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:1494:"<p>A plugin that makes regenerating thumbnails even easier than before and more flexible.<br />
If you install a new theme, it might have different image sizes it wants to use. those image sizes are cropped and resized into thumbnails only when you upload new images. So what happens with your old images?<br />
the ones you already uploaded? They need to be regenerated, this is what this plugin does. It takes each image and generates the thumbnails for each and every one of them.You have the ability to regenerate thumbnails for a aspecific image<br />
by cicking a added button on the media page. You will not be redirected to another page, everything happens on that page with REST api and ajax.</p>
<p>Features:</p>
<ul>
<li>Removes ( cleans up ) the thumbnails of the existing images that are no longer of any use (since version 1.5.2 )</li>
<li>You can select a period in time for the images to be regenerated from</li>
<li>The period is last day, last week, last month or all</li>
<li>Clean simple interface where you have a progress bar showing you the percentage of images regenerated</li>
<li>You get to see the total number of images affected by your period, as well as the images affected so far when processing</li>
<li>You can regenerate individual image withouth navigating away from the page, everything happening on the media page with 1 click of the image you want to modify</li>
<li>plugin is available for translation in any language with the rta text domain.</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:288:"<p>This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.</p>
<p>e.g.</p>
<ol>
<li>Upload regenerate-thumbnails-advanced directory to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:272:"
<h4>Can I regenerate just a few images</h4>
<p>
<p>You have the option to select from: all, past day, past week, past month</p>
</p>
<h4>What happens if I close the page and the script is loading?</h4>
<p>
<p>The script stops, it does not run in the background</p>
</p>

2:"https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MU4RJNNF74QKY";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:83:"https://ps.w.org/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1858524";s:2:"2x";s:83:"https://ps.w.org/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1858524";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}}s:16:"disable-comments";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:16:"Disable Comments";s:4:"slug";s:16:"disable-comments";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.7.1";s:6:"author";s:53:"<a href="http://www.rayofsolaris.net/">Samir Shah</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/solarissmoke";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.1";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.6";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:98;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:199;i:4;i:3;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:3;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:207;s:15:"support_threads";i:3;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:5085161;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-11-18 3:25am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2011-05-27";s:8:"homepage";s:47:"https://wordpress.org/plugins/disable-comments/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:3034:"<p>This plugin allows administrators to globally disable comments on any post type (posts, pages, attachments, etc.) so that these settings cannot be overridden for individual posts. It also removes all comment-related fields from edit and quick-edit screens. On multisite installations, it can be used to disable comments on the entire network.</p>
<p>Additionally, comment-related items can be removed from the Dashboard, Widgets, the Admin Menu and the Admin Bar.</p>
<p><strong>Important note</strong>: Use this plugin if you don&#8217;t want comments at all on your site (or on certain post types). Don&#8217;t use it if you want to selectively disable comments on individual posts &#8211; WordPress lets you do that anyway. If you don&#8217;t know how to disable comments on individual posts, there are instructions in <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/disable-comments/faq/">the FAQ</a>.</p>
<p>If you come across any bugs or have suggestions, please use the plugin support forum. I can&#8217;t fix it if I don&#8217;t know it&#8217;s broken! Please check the <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/disable-comments/faq/">FAQ</a> for common issues.</p>
<p>Want to contribute? Here&#8217;s the <a href="https://github.com/solarissmoke/disable-comments" rel="nofollow">GitHub development repository</a>.</p>
<p>A <a href="https://github.com/solarissmoke/disable-comments-mu" rel="nofollow">must-use version</a> of the plugin is also available.</p>
<h3>Details</h3>
<p>The plugin provides the option to <strong>completely disable the commenting feature in WordPress</strong>. When this option is selected, the following changes are made:</p>
<ul>
<li>All &#8220;Comments&#8221; links are hidden from the Admin Menu and Admin Bar;</li>
<li>All comment-related sections (&#8220;Recent Comments&#8221;, &#8220;Discussion&#8221; etc.) are hidden from the WordPress Dashboard;</li>
<li>All comment-related widgets are disabled (so your theme cannot use them);</li>
<li>The &#8220;Discussion&#8221; settings page is hidden;</li>
<li>All comment RSS/Atom feeds are disabled (and requests for these will be redirected to the parent post);</li>
<li>The X-Pingback HTTP header is removed from all pages;</li>
<li>Outgoing pingbacks are disabled.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Please delete any existing comments on your site before applying this setting, otherwise (depending on your theme) those comments may still be displayed to visitors. You can use the Delete Comments tool to delete any existing comments on your site.</strong></p>
<h3>Advanced Configuration</h3>
<p>Some of the plugin&#8217;s behaviour can be modified by site administrators and plugin/theme developers through code:</p>
<ul>
<li>Define <code>DISABLE_COMMENTS_REMOVE_COMMENTS_TEMPLATE</code> and set it to <code>false</code> to prevent the plugin from replacing the theme&#8217;s comment template with an empty one.</li>
</ul>
<p>These definitions can be made either in your main <code>wp-config.php</code> or in your theme&#8217;s <code>functions.php</code> file.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:398:"<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>The plugin settings can be accessed via the &#8216;Settings&#8217; menu in the administration area (either your site administration for single-site installs, or your network administration for network installs).</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:2519:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>The plugin settings can be accessed via the &#8216;Settings&#8217; menu in the administration area (either your site administration for single-site installs, or your network administration for network installs).</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>Nothing happens after I disable comments on all posts &#8211; comment forms still appear when I view my posts.</h4>
<p>
<p>This is because your theme is not checking the comment status of posts in the correct way.</p>
<p>You may like to point your theme&#8217;s author to <a href="http://www.rayofsolaris.net/blog/2012/how-to-check-if-comments-are-allowed-in-wordpress/" rel="nofollow">this explanation</a> of what they are doing wrong, and how to fix it.</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I remove the text that says &#8220;comments are closed&#8221; at the bottom of articles where comments are disabled?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin tries its very best to hide this (and any other comment-related) messages.</p>
<p>If you still see the message, then it means your theme is overriding this behaviour, and you will have to edit its files manually to remove it. Two common approaches are to either delete or comment out the relevant lines in <code>wp-content/your-theme/comments.php</code>, or to add a declaration to <code>wp-content/your-theme/style.css</code> that hides the message from your visitors. In either case, make you you know what you are doing!</p>
</p>
<h4>I only want to disable comments on certain posts, not globally. What do I do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Don&#8217;t install this plugin!</p>
<p>Go to the edit page for the post you want to disable comments on. Scroll down to the &#8220;Discussion&#8221; box, where you will find the comment options for that post. If you don&#8217;t see a &#8220;Discussion&#8221; box, then click on &#8220;Screen Options&#8221; at the top of your screen, and make sure the &#8220;Discussion&#8221; checkbox is checked.</p>
<p>You can also bulk-edit the comment status of multiple posts from the <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Posts_Screen" rel="nofollow">posts screen</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>I want to delete comments from my database. What do I do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Go to the settings page for the disable comments plugin and utlize the Delete Comments tool to delete all comments or according to the specified post types from your database.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:5180:"<h4>1.7.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Small enhancements to hiding comment-related functionality in the admin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Dropped logic to try and hide the comments link from the Meta widget. Administrators should manually add styling to hide this link, or replace the Meta widget with an alternative.</li>
<li>Removed the <code>disable_comments_allow_persistent_mode</code> filter. Define <code>DISABLE_COMMENTS_ALLOW_PERSISTENT_MODE</code> instead.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added a tool for deleting comments in bulk.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix Javascript errors when the Meta widget is enabled.</li>
<li>Hide comments link from the Welcome panel.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Hide existing comments if there are any.</li>
<li>Filter the comments link in the Meta widget if it is enabled.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Remove the comments feed link from the head in WP 4.4 and higher.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Delay loading of translation text domain until all plugins are loaded. This allows plugins to modify translations.</li>
</ul>

<li>Hide the troublesome &#8220;persistent mode&#8221; option for all sites where it is not in use. This option will be removed in a future release.</li>
