Multisite friendly.";s:13:"download_link";s:59:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.zip";s:11:"screenshots";a:0:{}s:4:"tags";a:3:{s:8:"comments";s:8:"comments";s:7:"disable";s:7:"disable";s:6:"global";s:6:"global";}s:8:"versions";a:15:{s:3:"1.1";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.1.zip";s:5:"1.1.1";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.1.1.zip";s:3:"1.2";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.2.zip";s:3:"1.3";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.3.zip";s:5:"1.3.1";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.3.1.zip";s:5:"1.3.2";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.3.2.zip";s:3:"1.4";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.4.zip";s:5:"1.4.1";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.4.1.zip";s:5:"1.4.2";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.4.2.zip";s:3:"1.5";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.5.zip";s:5:"1.5.1";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.5.1.zip";s:5:"1.5.2";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.5.2.zip";s:3:"1.6";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.6.zip";s:3:"1.7";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.7.zip";s:5:"1.7.1";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.7.1.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:35:"http://www.rayofsolaris.net/donate/";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/disable-comments/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=971176";s:2:"2x";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/disable-comments/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=971176";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}}s:16:"breadcrumb-navxt";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:16:"Breadcrumb NavXT";s:4:"slug";s:16:"breadcrumb-navxt";s:7:"version";s:5:"6.0.4";s:6:"author";s:42:"<a href="http://mtekk.us/">John Havlik</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/mtekk";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.7";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.6";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.3";s:6:"rating";i:94;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:99;i:4;i:8;i:3;i:4;i:2;i:2;i:1;i:4;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:117;s:15:"support_threads";i:6;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:3;s:10:"downloaded";i:5751166;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-03-23 2:53am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2007-12-01";s:8:"homepage";s:38:"http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2306:"<p>Breadcrumb NavXT, the successor to the popular WordPress plugin Breadcrumb Navigation XT, was written from the ground up to be better than its ancestor. This plugin generates locational breadcrumb trails for your WordPress powered blog or website. These breadcrumb trails are highly customizable to suit the needs of just about any website running WordPress. The Administrative interface makes setting options easy, while a direct class access is available for theme developers and more adventurous users.</p>
<h4>PHP Requirements</h4>
<p>Breadcrumb NavXT 5.2 and newer require PHP5.3<br />
Breadcrumb NavXT 5.1.1 and older require PHP5.2</p>
<h4>Features (non-exhaustive)</h4>
<ul>
<li>RDFa format Schema.org BreadcrumbList compatible breadcrumb generation.</li>
<li>Extensive breadcrumb customization control via a settings page with appropriate default values for most use cases.</li>
<li>Network admin settings page for managing breadcrumb settings for all subsites with <a href="http://mtekk.us/archives/guides/controlling-breadcrumb-navxt-settings-from-the-network-settings-page/" title="Go to the article on configuring the network settings priority." rel="nofollow">configurable global priority</a>.</li>
<li>Built in WordPress Widget.</li>
<li>Extensible via OOP and provided <a href="http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/breadcrumb-navxt-doc/2/#action_reference" title="Go to the Breadcrumb NavXT Documentation's action reference." rel="nofollow">actions</a> and <a href="http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/breadcrumb-navxt-doc/2/#filter_reference" title="Go to the Breadcrumb NavXT Documentation's filter reference." rel="nofollow">filters</a>.</li>
<li>WPML compatible (enhanced compatibility with WPML extensions plugin).</li>
<li>Polylang compatible (enhanced compatibility with Polylang extensions plugin).</li>
<li>bbPress compatible (enhanced compatibility with bbPress extensions plugin).</li>
<li>BuddyPress compatible (enhanced compatibility with BuddyPress extensions plugin).</li>
</ul>
<h4>Translations</h4>
<p>Breadcrumb NavXT now supports WordPress.org language packs. Want to translate Breadcrumb NavXT? Visit <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/breadcrumb-navxt/" rel="nofollow">Breadcrumb NavXT&#8217;s WordPress.org translation project</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:928:"<p>Breadcrumb NavXT can be installed from within WordPress‚Äô administration panel. After installing and activating the plugin, to get breadcrumb trails to display either use the included widget, or call the breadcrumb trail in your theme (or child theme). See the <a href="http://mtekk.us/archives/guides/calling-the-breadcrumb-trail" title="Read more on calling the breadcrumb trail" rel="nofollow">Calling the Breadcrumb Trail</a> article for more information on calling the breadcrumb trail.</p>
<p>To customize the breadcrumb trail you may edit the default values for the options in the administrative interface. This is located in your administration panel under Settings &gt; Breadcrumb NavXT.</p>
<p>Please visit <a href="http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/breadcrumb-navxt-doc/" title="Go to Breadcrumb NavXT's Documentation." rel="nofollow">Breadcrumb NavXT&#8217;s Documentation</a> page for more information.</p>
";s:9:"changelog";s:17880:"<h4>6.0.4</h4>
<p>Release date: January, 26th 2018</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Added auto migration of post type hierarchy settings to <code>bcn_display*()</code> functions.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where a PHP notice would be generated on the page for posts when the blog breadcrumb display option is set to false.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where a PHP notice would be generated on archive pages where attachments were included in the <code>wp_query</code> results.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.3</h4>
<p>Release date: January, 1st 2018</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where an improper breadcrumb would be generated in the trail for pages under some circumstances.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the post and page roots were not updating to track user changes in Settings &gt; Reading.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.2</h4>
<p>Release date: December, 30th 2017</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Added warning alerting that <code>bcn_breadcrumb::type</code> must be an array.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Changed Breadcrumb Separator and Paged Template from an input field to a textbox to reduce confusion caused by HTML entities.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the parents of a page may not show up in the breadcrumb trail.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the <code>$reverse</code> parameter for <code>bcn_display</code> and <code>bcn_display_list</code> did not work properly.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the <code>bcn_display_list</code> function did not include the <code>li</code> elements.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.1</h4>
<p>Release date: December, 28th 2017</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Removed unused Blog Template and Blog Template (Unlinked) from settings page.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where changes to the hierarchy type for any post type would not save.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the blog display setting was ignored.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.0</h4>
<p>Release date: December, 26th 2017</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::display_list()</code> deprecated in favor of using the <code>$template</code> parameter in <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::display()</code>.</li>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_attachment()</code> deprecated in favor of calling <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_post()</code>.</li>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_front_page()</code> deprecated in favor of calling <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_home()</code>.</li>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_li_attributes</code> filter was deprecated in favor of <code>bcn_display_attributes</code>.</li>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_archive_by_date()</code> deprecated in favor of calling bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_day()<code>,</code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_month()<code>, and/or</code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_year()`.</li>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::find_type()</code> deprecated and removed from bcn_breadcrumb_trail.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Breadcrumb for 404 error pages changed to be a child of the front page.</li>
<li>New feature: Added support for various HTML tags in the widget&#8217;s pretext field.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_default_hierarchy_display</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_default_hierarchy_type</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>$posttype_name</code> as the third parameter to <code>bcn_show_tax_private</code>.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed UI/UX issue in the settings screen where enabling/disabling settings groups for the Home, Blog, and Mainsite breadcrumb settings did not work.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed UI/UX issue in the settings screen where not including the paged breadcrumb still allowed the paged breadcrumb template to be edited.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Removed use of <code>create_function</code> in registering the widget as it was deprecated in PHP 7.2.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.7.1</h4>
<p>Release date: June 30th, 2017</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed erroneous use of <code>$linked</code> that caused a PHP warning in <code>bcn_display_json_ld()</code>.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where removing a breadcrumb from the trail could cause one or more breadcrumb separators to inappropriately disappear.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.7.0</h4>
<p>Release date: April 21st, 2017</p>
<ul>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_display_json_ld(</code>) function for producing Schema.org BreadcrumbList compliant JSON-LD markup.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the uninstaller caused PHP Errors when ran from WP CLI.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::find_type()</code> caused a PHP Warnings in certain circumstances.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed typo in the administrative interface.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.6.0</h4>
<p>Release date: December 23rd, 2016</p>
<ul>
<li>New feature: Added fourth parameter, <code>$force</code>, to <code>bcn_display()</code>, and <code>bcn_display_list()</code> allowing the internal caching mechanism to be bypassed.</li>
<li>New feature: Moved to multiple line text boxes rather than regular single line text inputs for the breadcrumb templates in the settings page to enhance visibility.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where general searches had the blog breadcrumb in the breadcrumb trail.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the blog breadcrumb options were erroneously made available when a Posts Page was not set.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.5.2</h4>
<p>Release date: September 30th, 2016</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the ‚Äúblog breadcrumb‚Äù setting does not affect the inclusion of the blog breadcrumb in the breadcrumb trail.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.5.1</h4>
<p>Release date: August 13th, 2016</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue in <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::find_type()</code> that identified pages as posts, causing the erroneous inclusion of the post root in the breadcrumb trail for pages. </li>
</ul>
<h4>5.5.0</h4>
<p>Release date: August 12th, 2016</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Internal mechanics to handle post parents as the hierarchy for a post (of any post type) has changed to use &#8216;BCN_POST_PARENT&#8217; rather than &#8216;page&#8217; for the taxonomy_type.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Internal mechanics to handle dates as the hierarchy for a post (of any post type) has changed to use &#8216;BCN_DATE&#8217; rather than &#8216;date&#8217; for the taxonomy_type.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Taxonomy term hierarchy selection logic in <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::pick_post_term()</code> has changed to picking the deepest known child of the first hierarchy found in the list of terms returned by <code>get_the_terms()</code> rather than the first term with a child.</li>
<li>New feature: Added support for referer influenced taxonomy selection for a post&#8217;s (any post type) breadcrumb trail.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>translate</code> and <code>lang</code> as valid attributes for tags within breadcrumb templates.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>srcset</code> and <code>sizes</code> as valid attributes for <code>img</code> tags within breadcrumb templates.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>itemprop</code> as a valid attribute for the <code>meta</code> tags within breadcrumb templates.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed various issues caused by other plugins/themes modifying the <code>$post</code> global.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where WPML Extensions would cause a CPT without a set root page to use the Post post type&#8217;s root page.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.0</h4>
<p>Release date: March 15th, 2016</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Migrated to new adminKit version, some functions previously in the admin classes are now handled upstream.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_post_terms</code> filter to <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::post_terms()</code> to control the terms included in a non-hierarchical term breadcrumb for a post.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_add_post_type_arg</code> filter to <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::maybe_add_post_type_arg()</code> to control when the post_type argument is added to URLs for archives.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_pick_post_term</code> filter to <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::post_hierarchy()</code> to allow overriding Breadcrumb NavXT‚Äôs default term selection behavior.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue with untranslatable title on the settings page.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Cleanup of several trivial differences between <code>bcn_admin</code> and <code>bcn_network_admin</code>.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed improper display of ‚ÄúYour settings are out of date. Migrate now.‚Äù message on fresh installs.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Clarified verbiage in regards to the paged breadcrumb.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Added translation wrappers for date format strings in <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_archive_by_date()</code>.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::is_builtin()</code> would cause PHP warnings when the passed in post type was not an actual post type.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue that would cause a PHP error if <code>WP_Widget</code> is unavailable.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.3.1</h4>
<p>Release date: December 14th, 2015</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed alignment issue of the main content of the settings page on WordPress 4.4.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed error caused by options upgrading not re-establishing new settings.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed PHP error caused by <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::get_type_string_query_var()</code> returning an array when the post_type query variable is an array.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.3.0</h4>
<p>Release date: November 12th, 2015</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Breadcrumb NavXT will no longer default to setting the root page for CPTs.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Breadcrumb NavXT will no longer inject a breadcrumb for a CPT archive page if a root page is set for that CPT.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Breadcrumb NavXT now defaults to <code>BCN_SETTINGS_USE_LOCAL</code> rather than <code>BCN_SETTINGS_USE_NETWORK</code> if all of the <code>BCN_SETTINGS_*</code> globals are not defined.</li>
<li>Behavior change: The included widget now supports RDFA style, Schema.org BreadcrumbList format rather than the deprecated Google Breadcrumbs format.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Default settings for breadcrumb templates now conform to RDFA style, Schema.org BreadcrumbList format rather than the deprecated Google Breadcrumbs format.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_widget_display_trail</code> action to enhance the included widget‚Äôs extensibility.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_widget_display_types</code> action to enhance the included widget‚Äôs extensibility.</li>
<li>New feature: The plugin uninstaller has been re-factored, includes support for uninstalling in PHP5.2.</li>
<li>New feature: Unit tests added for all non-deprecated features in bcn_breadcrumb.</li>
<li>New feature: Unit tests added for the uninstaller.</li>
<li>New feature: Date based hierarchies are now available for CPTs.</li>
<li>New feature: Date archives restricted by CPT are now supported.</li>
<li>New feature: Taxonomy archives restricted by CPT are now supported.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the multibyte supplicant functions were not always being included due to WordPress shipping with its own subset of theses functions.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where on an archive for a post type the archive breadcrumb would appear twice.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.2.2</h4>
<p>Release date: June 1st, 2015</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the current item would use a built in default template rather than the breadcrumb template in the settings.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Updated currently distributed translations set and list to match the current set of translations that achieve the 90% completeness threshold for inclusion.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where a PHP warning would be displayed when BCN_SETTINGS_USE_NETWORK is defined.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.2.1</h4>
<p>Release date: May 25th, 2015</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Added additional checks for empty URLs and templates within <code>bcn_breadcrumb</code> to prevent various bugs when empty URLs and/or templates are passed in.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Move away from building URLs for search breadcrumbs and instead using <code>get_search_link()</code> to fix support for pretty permalinks.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where media items (attachments) that have not been attached to a post yet would cause an incorrect breadcrumb trail to be generated.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where attachments of the front page would cause PHP Warnings.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where attachments of the front page would have duplicate breadcrumbs for the home page.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where attachments of pages would have an extraneous breadcrumb relating to the page for posts.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue with the text domain/domain path in the plugin header.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.2.0</h4>
<p>Release date: January 9th, 2015</p>
<ul>
<li>Deprecated: The Max Breadcrumb Length setting has been deprecated in favor of <a href="http://mtekk.us/archives/guides/trimming-breadcrumb-title-lengths-with-css/" title="Go to the article presenting how to shorten the breadcrumb title length using CSS" rel="nofollow">using CSS styling to perform the length limiting</a>.</li>
<li>Behavior change: The archive page for a post type is now generated for the top ancestor post rather than for the current page when &#8220;post parent&#8221; is used as the post&#8217;s hierarchy.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Now requires PHP5.3 or newer.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_type_archive_post_type</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Settings depending on another setting to be enabled are disabled when the dependency setting is disabled.</li>
<li>New feature: More descriptive messages on settings saving (notify user on success, failure, and no changes to save).</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed awkward wording in the settings page for post hierarchy settings.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed missed default templates for post formats when all taxonomy settings had the tax_ prefix added in 5.1.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed bulk of compatibility issues with bbPress.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.1.1</h4>
<p>Release date: July 29th, 2014</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where attachments and their parents have the same link when &#8216;link current item&#8217; is enabled.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Pass the same parameters into the widget title and (pre) text filters as the default WordPress widgets.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where PHP warnings would be thrown on author pages for authors that do not have any posts.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Reduced severity of <code>$post</code> global not being of type <code>WP_Post</code>, will silently exit on non-WP_DEBUG enabled sites.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.1.0</h4>
<p>Release date: June 9th, 2014</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_post()</code> now expects to be passed in a valid WP_Post object.</li>
<li>Behavior change: <code>breadcrumb_navxt::version</code> changed to a constant to allow uninstantiated access of the plugin version.</li>
<li>New feature: Support Google&#8217;s RDFa Breadcrumbs microformat by default.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_opts_update_prebk</code> filter.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Validate HTML5 options on tab traversal.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the settings importer parsed the version string incorrectly.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Added &#8216;typeof&#8217; to list of valid HTML tag attributes.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Prefixed all taxonomies with &#8216;tax_&#8217; to prevent name collisions.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Added ID to Post and Taxonomy Term Elements in <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_root()</code> as is done everywhere else.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue with <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_author()</code> returning the incorrect user under some circumstances.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where saving twice on a tab in the settings page would cause the next page load to open the general tab rather than the current tab.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Added bcn_breadcrumb_template filter back into <code>bcn_breadcrumb::set_template()</code>, was a regression in 5.0 from 4.4.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the included widget did not check against default settings, causing PHP Warnings to show up on the frontend under some circumstances.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where we didn&#8217;t handle <code>WP_POST::has_archive</code> correctly when it was a string, causing issues with CPTs generated by some plugins.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the default taxonomy selected for a CPT could be a non-public taxonomy.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Attachments get their own title within the settings page now.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Filter the title and pre text in the widget.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.1</h4>
<p>Release date: December 31st, 2013</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior Change: Notify multisite users when settings may be overridden by the network settings and vice versa.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Updated tab style to match WordPress 3.8 look and feel.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::display_list()</code> would produce multiple instances of the class attribute.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed several issues with the uninstaller.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.0</h4>
<p>Release date: November 20th, 2013</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior Change: Moved <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::trail</code> to <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::breadcrumbs</code></li>
<li>Behavior Change: When WordPress is in multisite/network mode, the settings set in the network settings page take priority over subsite settings.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail_object</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_li_attributes</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_breadcrumb_types</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Added Network Admin Settings page.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>xmlns:v</code> and <code>property</code> to the valid tag attributes.</li>
<li>Bug fix: The current_item breadcrumb for search results should result in a valid HTTPS link when appropriate.</li>
</ul>
";s:3:"faq";s:974:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>Breadcrumb NavXT can be installed from within WordPress‚Äô administration panel. After installing and activating the plugin, to get breadcrumb trails to display either use the included widget, or call the breadcrumb trail in your theme (or child theme). See the <a href="http://mtekk.us/archives/guides/calling-the-breadcrumb-trail" title="Read more on calling the breadcrumb trail" rel="nofollow">Calling the Breadcrumb Trail</a> article for more information on calling the breadcrumb trail.</p>
<p>To customize the breadcrumb trail you may edit the default values for the options in the administrative interface. This is located in your administration panel under Settings &gt; Breadcrumb NavXT.</p>
<p>Please visit <a href="http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/breadcrumb-navxt-doc/" title="Go to Breadcrumb NavXT's Documentation." rel="nofollow">Breadcrumb NavXT&#8217;s Documentation</a> page for more information.</p>
</p>

The Events Calendar plugin provides professional-level quality and features backed by a team you can trust.</p>
<p>Packed with loads of useful features, The Events Calendar by Modern Tribe is ready to go right out of the box. It‚Äôs extensible, easy to use, and completely customizable.</p>
<p>Just getting started? Read through the <a href="http://m.tri.be/2d" rel="nofollow">New User Primer</a> to get set up.</p>
<p>Looking for additional functionality including recurring events, ticket sales, publicly submitted events, automatic imports, and more?</p>
<p><strong>Check out <a href="http://m.tri.be/mj" rel="nofollow">Events Calendar PRO</a> and <a href="http://m.tri.be/2a" rel="nofollow">other add-ons</a></strong></p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>New Import Tool!</strong><br />
  We‚Äôve made bulk event imports easier to manage than ever. This add-on service for The Events Calendar allows you to import events from your favorite sources, including Meetup, Google Calendar, iCalendar, CSV, and ICS.<br />
  <a href="http://m.tri.be/197u" rel="nofollow">Check out Event Aggregator now</a>.</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Built solid &amp; supported</h4>
<p>The Events Calendar is crafted the WordPress way with hours of strategy, design, development, and testing going into each release. We stand behind our work and offer light support weekly for the community via the WordPress.org support forums.</p>
<p>If you need a deeper level of support or a faster response to your specific question, our Events Calendar PRO add-on includes access to our premium support forums with a 24-48 hour response time during the workweek.</p>
<p>Enjoy using The Events Calendar, know how to customize it, and want to make money helping people? We‚Äôre growing our community team and would love to hear from you. If you‚Äôre interested, <a href="http://m.tri.be/mk" rel="nofollow">check this out!</a></p>
<h4>Plug-n-play &amp; highly customizable</h4>
<p>The Events Calendar is built to work out of the box. Just turn it on, configure the settings to match your needs and you&#8217;ll be making events in less than 5 minutes.</p>
<p>By developers, for developers&#8230; it&#8217;s ready to be the foundation for your wildest hack sessions. Complete with a skeleton stylesheet to theme fast and efficiently, loads of tools including partial template overrides, a host of template tags, hooks and filters, <a href="http://m.tri.be/eu" rel="nofollow">careful documentation</a>, as well as a <a href="http://m.tri.be/ext" rel="nofollow">library of free extensions</a>. The Events Calendar is built FOR people who build websites.</p>
<p>Whether your vision is big or small, you‚Äôre in good company. Hundreds of thousands of churches, eateries, small businesses, musicians, venues, and non-profits are publishing and promoting their events with The Events Calendar.</p>
<p>The Events Calendar has been scaled to work on networks with over 25 million unique visitors per month and hundreds of thousands of events. Fortune 100 companies, major universities, government institutions, and some seriously epic startups showcase their events with our platform.</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<p>Whether you‚Äôre operating a hyperlocal hub listing thousands of events, a university with many thousands of users, or you‚Äôre a sole business owner listing your classes, The Events Calendar has your back.</p>
<ul>
<li>Rapidly create events</li>
<li>Saved venues &amp; organizers</li>
<li>Calendar month view with tooltips</li>
<li>Event List view</li>
<li>Day view</li>
<li>Event search</li>
<li>Google maps</li>
<li>Widget: Upcoming events list</li>
<li>Events Taxonomies (Categories &amp; Tags)</li>
<li>Google Calendar and iCal exporting</li>
<li>WP REST API endpoints</li>
<li>Completely ajaxified for super smooth browsing</li>
<li>Completely responsive from mobile to tablet to desktop</li>
<li>Tested on the major theme frameworks such as Avada, Genesis, Woo Themes, Thesis and many more.</li>
<li>Increase your SEO with Microformats</li>
<li>Internationalized &amp; translated</li>
<li>Multiple stylesheets to improve integration</li>
<li>Extensive template tags for customization</li>
<li>Hooks &amp; filters galore</li>
<li>Caching support</li>
<li>Debug mode for developers</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/1a0r" rel="nofollow">Library of extensions</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>Submitting Patches</h4>
<p>If you‚Äôve identified a bug and have a fix, we‚Äôd welcome it at our <a href="https://github.com/moderntribe/the-events-calendar" rel="nofollow">GitHub page for The Events Calendar</a>. Simply submit a pull request so we can review as part of our <a href="http://m.tri.be/release-schedule" rel="nofollow">release cycle</a> and merge into the codebase if appropriate from there. If a pull request is rejected, we&#8217;ll do our best to tell you why. Users whose pull requests are accepted will receive credit in the plugin&#8217;s changelog. For more information, check out the readme at our GitHub page. Happy coding!</p>
<h3>Documentation</h3>
<p>All of our online documentation can be found on <a href="http://m.tri.be/eu" rel="nofollow">our documentation site</a>.</p>

<ul>

</ul>
<p>If you have any questions about this plugin, you can post a thread in our <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/the-events-calendar" rel="nofollow">WordPress.org forum</a>. Please search existing threads before opening a new one.</p>
<p>The <a href="http://m.tri.be/2r" rel="nofollow">Modern Tribe premium support forums</a> are available for you to read. You won&#8217;t, however, be able to post a message in any forums beyond Pre-Sale Questions unless you have purchased a premium license.</p>

<h3>Help</h3>
<p>Welcome to The Events Calendar, a full-featured events management system for WordPress. Thank you so much for using the labor of our love. We are Modern Tribe and we are here to help you be awesome.</p>
<p>If you aren&#8217;t familiar with The Events Calendar, check out our <a href="http://m.tri.be/2p" rel="nofollow">new user primer</a>. It&#8217;ll introduce you to the basics of what the plugin has to offer and will have you creating events in no time. From there, the resources below &#8212; extensive template tag documentation, FAQs, video walkthroughs and more &#8212; will give you a leg up as you dig deeper.</p>
<p>Additional resources available include:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://theeventscalendar.com/release-schedule/" rel="nofollow">Release Schedule</a></li>
<li><a href="https://theeventscalendar.com/known-issues/" rel="nofollow">Known Issues</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/eu" rel="nofollow">Documentation</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2n" rel="nofollow">FAQ</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2t" rel="nofollow">Help Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2u" rel="nofollow">Tutorials</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2v" rel="nofollow">Release Notes</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2r" rel="nofollow">Forums</a></li>
</ul>
<p>We hit the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/the-events-calendar/" rel="nofollow">The Events Calendar forum here on WordPress.org</a> about once a week, assisting users with basic troubleshooting and identifying bugs that have been reported. (If you are looking for more active support, might we suggest buying a PRO license? Our team hits the <a href="http://m.tri.be/2r" rel="nofollow">Premium Forums</a> daily.)</p>
<p>Some things to consider before posting on the forum:</p>
<ul>
<li>Look through existing threads before posting a new one and check that there isn&#8217;t already a discussion going on for your issue.</li>
<li>Your issue will be solved more quickly if you run a few checks before making a support request. Deactivate your plugins one by one &#8211; if the issue is fixed by deactivating a plugin you know you&#8217;ve got a plugin conflict. To test your Theme, revert to the default Twenty Twelve Theme to see if you are still experiencing the problem. If not, your Theme is the issue. Please provide this information when making your support request.</li>
<li>Sometimes, just resetting your permalinks can fix the issue. Visit Events -&gt; Settings -&gt; Permalinks, save your permalinks with a different option and then save with your preferred choice again. This can solve events-related problems and can is worth a shot before creating a new thread.</li>
</ul>
<p>Still not happy? Shoot us an email to support@theeventscalendar.com or tweet to <a href="https://twitter.com/TheEventsCal" rel="nofollow">@TheEventsCal</a> and tell us why. We&#8217;ll do what we can to make it right.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:999:"<h4>Install &amp; Activate</h4>
<p>Installing the plugin is easy. Just follow these steps:</p>
<ol>
<li>From the dashboard of your site, navigate to Plugins &#8211;&gt; Add New.</li>
<li>Select the Upload option and hit &#8220;Choose File.&#8221;</li>
<li>When the popup appears select the the-events-calendar-x.x.zip file from your desktop. (The &#8216;x.x&#8217; will change depending on the current version number).</li>
<li>Follow the on-screen instructions and wait as the upload completes.</li>
<li>When it&#8217;s finished, activate the plugin via the prompt. A message will show confirming activation was successful. A link to access the calendar directly on the frontend will be presented here as well.</li>
</ol>
<p>That&#8217;s it! Just configure your settings as you see fit, and you&#8217;re on your way to creating events in style. Need help getting things started? Check out our <a href="http://m.tri.be/2l" rel="nofollow">new user primer</a> for help with settings and features.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:6607:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<h4>Install &amp; Activate</h4>
<p>Installing the plugin is easy. Just follow these steps:</p>
<ol>
<li>From the dashboard of your site, navigate to Plugins &#8211;&gt; Add New.</li>
<li>Select the Upload option and hit &#8220;Choose File.&#8221;</li>
<li>When the popup appears select the the-events-calendar-x.x.zip file from your desktop. (The &#8216;x.x&#8217; will change depending on the current version number).</li>
<li>Follow the on-screen instructions and wait as the upload completes.</li>
<li>When it&#8217;s finished, activate the plugin via the prompt. A message will show confirming activation was successful. A link to access the calendar directly on the frontend will be presented here as well.</li>
</ol>
<p>That&#8217;s it! Just configure your settings as you see fit, and you&#8217;re on your way to creating events in style. Need help getting things started? Check out our <a href="http://m.tri.be/2l" rel="nofollow">new user primer</a> for help with settings and features.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are there any troubleshooting steps you&#8217;d suggest I try that might resolve my issue before I post a new thread?</h4>
<p>
<p>First, make sure that you&#8217;re running the latest version of The Events Calendar (4.6 as of this release). If you&#8217;re running Events Calendar PRO it needs to match the version number of The Events Calendar. And if you&#8217;ve got any other add-ons, make sure those are current / running the latest code as well.</p>
<p>The most common issues we see are either plugin or theme conflicts. You can test if a plugin or theme is conflicting by manually deactivating other plugins until just The Events Calendar is running on your site. If the issue persists from there, revert to the default Twenty Fourteen theme. If the issue is resolved after deactivating a specific plugin or your theme, you&#8217;ll know that is the source of the conflict.</p>
<p>Note that we aren&#8217;t going to say &#8220;tough luck&#8221; if you identify a plugin/theme conflict. While we can&#8217;t guarantee 100% integration with any plugin or theme out there, we will do our best (and reach out the plugin/theme author as needed) to figure out a solution that benefits everyone.</p>
</p>
<h4>I&#8217;m still stuck. Where do I go to file a bug or ask a question?</h4>
<p>
<p>Users of the free The Events Calendar should post their questions in the plugin&#8217;s <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/the-events-calendar/" rel="nofollow">WordPress.org forum</a>, which we hit about once a week (usually on Wednesdays). Please make sure to read <a href="http://m.tri.be/19oc" rel="nofollow">our sticky post</a> providing an overview of the support we provide free users BEFORE posting. If you find you&#8217;re not getting support in as timely a fashion as you wish, you might want to consider purchasing a PRO license.</p>
<p>If you&#8217;re already a PRO user, you&#8217;re entitled access to our more actively-monitored <a href="http://m.tri.be/2r" rel="nofollow">Events Calendar PRO forum</a> on our website. We can provide a deeper level of support here and hit these forums on a daily basis during the work week. Generally, except in times of increased support loads, we reply to all comments within 24-48 hours during the business week.</p>
</p>
<h4>Events Calendar PRO looks awesome! I&#8217;m sold! How can I get my hands on it?</h4>
<p>
<p>Events Calendar PRO can be purchased directly on <a href="http://m.tri.be/18wi" rel="nofollow">our website</a>. There are five (5) license types available, and all licenses include access to premium support, new feature releases, and regular maintenance updates.</p>
</p>
<h4>I&#8217;m interested in PRO or another add-on, but there are a few questions I&#8217;ve got before making the purchase. Can you help me get those addressed?</h4>
<p>
<p>Absolutely. If you&#8217;re not finding your questions answered on the product pages, hit up our <a href="http://m.tri.be/2w" rel="nofollow">pre-sales forum</a> on our site. You can save yourself some time by reviewing the threads first to verify if your question has already been asked. If it hasn&#8217;t, post a new thread as a guest. We&#8217;ll get you a reply as quickly as we can, so you can make an informed decision regarding purchase.</p>
</p>
<h4>What add-ons are available for The Events Calendar, and where can I read more about them?</h4>
<p>
<p>The following add-ons are available for The Events Calendar:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wi" rel="nofollow">Events Calendar PRO</a>, for adding premium calendar features like recurring events, advanced views, cool widgets, shortcodes, additional fields, and more!</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/197u" rel="nofollow">Event Aggregator</a>, a service that effortlessly fills your calendar with events from Meetup, Google Calendar, iCalendar, CSV, and ICS.</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wj" rel="nofollow">Event Tickets</a> (free), which allows you to collect RSVPs to events. It can run alongside The Events Calendar or as a standalone plugin that adds RSVP functionality to WordPress posts and pages.</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wk" rel="nofollow">Event Tickets Plus</a>, which allows you to sell tickets for your events using your favorite e-commerce platform.</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2g" rel="nofollow">Community Events</a>, for allowing frontend event submission from your readers.</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wl" rel="nofollow">Community Tickets</a>, which allows event organizers to sell tickets to the events they submit via Community Events.</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/fa" rel="nofollow">Filter Bar</a>, for adding advanced frontend filtering capabilities to your events calendar.</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2e" rel="nofollow">Eventbrite Tickets</a>, for selling tickets to your event directly through Eventbrite.</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>I have a feature idea. What&#8217;s the best way to tell you about it?</h4>
<p>
<p>We&#8217;ve got a <a href="https://tribe.uservoice.com/forums/195723-feature-ideas" rel="nofollow">UserVoice page</a> where we&#8217;re actively watching for feature ideas from the community. Vote up existing feature requests or add your own, and help us shape the future of the products business in a way that best meets the community&#8217;s needs.</p>
</p>
<h4>I&#8217;ve still got questions. Where can I find answers?</h4>
<p>
<p>Check out our extensive <a href="http://m.tri.be/18wm" rel="nofollow">knowledgebase</a> for articles on using, tweaking, and troubleshooting our plugins.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:95411:"<h4>[4.6.16] 2018-05-16</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Replaced the Aggregator queue processing system to run independently of WP Cron (not for CSV) [105650]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevents notices for Events Community when handling State and Province fields [106415]</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.6.15] 2018-05-09</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added wp-cli command to import events from a source with Event Aggregator. See <code>wp event-aggregator import-from --help</code> to know more [104426]</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added wp-cli command to run scheduled imports with Event Aggregator. See <code>wp event-aggregator run-import --help</code> to know more [104426]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure that organizers can be deleted when an event has multiple organizers [103715]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed a bug where the <code>[tribe_events]</code> Month View pagination would fail when no Tribe Bar was visible and plain permalinks were being used [95720]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent <code>url_to_postid</code> from running when on the main events page to avoid query conflicts [94328]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent 404s and malformed URLs that would sometimes arise when navigating to a past-events view from the &#8220;All&#8221;-events view on a single recurring event [43925]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Make the <code>[tribe_events]</code> shortcode&#8217;s output scroll to top when using the List View to match the non-shortcode List View  [81509]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure that default venue and address values are used throughout various venue-creation forms [63915]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Honor the return types for <code>tribe_has_next_event</code> and <code>tribe_has_previous_event</code> when the global query is null</li>
<li>Language &#8211; 28 new strings added, 290 updated, 29 fuzzied, and 7 obsoleted</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.6.14.1] 2018-04-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed fatal error that would sometimes arise when The Events Calendar was set to display on the front page</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.6.14] 2018-04-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Updated the &#8220;front page&#8221; logic to store the value in the DB instead of &#8220;mocking&#8221; the view via JS [100832]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed the generation of PHP warnings on retrieval of posts if the &#8220;Include events in main blog loop&#8221; option is checked (thanks to Colin Carmichael for reporting this problem) [97667]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Made the <code>tribe-ea-record</code> custom post type (used to store Event Aggregator record information) private [99106]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Expanded the size of the time zone input in the admin to allow for better visibility for long names [100363]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; If the main events page is set to be the site&#8217;s front page, ensure it shows as &#8220;selected&#8221; in the Customizer&#8217;s front page option [100832]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed an issue where failed Event Aggregator scheduled imports would re-attempt the import too soon [102489]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure the Tribe Bar displays all the available ranges of dates and times [100646]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Hid the filters in the Tribe Bar if a unique view is enabled [75114]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed some imported-event handling so that events with no time and that aren&#8217;t all-day events do not display on the front-end [93979]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Changed the HTTP status codes of empty event, venue, organizer, category, and tag archives from 404 to 200 and return empty arrays to stick with WP REST API standard [102283]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Better &#8220;guessing&#8221; on column mapping during the import of CSV file (thanks to April in our Help Desk for flagging this problem!) [96162]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Add new <code>tribe_events_linked_post_type_meta_key</code> filter, required to be set for each custom linked post type, to output custom linked post types in their drag-and-drop order (thanks @natureslens for highlighting the issue) [100733]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added the <code>tribe_aggregator_find_matching_organizer</code> and <code>tribe_aggregator_find_matching_venue</code> filters in Events Aggregator to allow the definition of custom Venue and Organizer match criteria [97292]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Display the retry time for a failed Event Aggregator scheduled import in the Scheduled tab [102489]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add new filter, <code>tribe_events_import_event_duplicate_matches</code>, to determine if an event is part of the duplicates matches [77956]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Ensure &#8220;secondary&#8221; maps, e.g. in the sidebar, have the same full-width behavior as &#8220;main&#8221; maps [74052]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Restore some missing header navigation elements [99742]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add notice if an import is missing required columns [67886]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Save time zone and time zone abbreviation fields (if provided) even if date was not changed when saving event through API [102705]</li>
</ul>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Added new REST API endpoint that allows looking up organizers by slug instead of ID at the path <code>organizers/by-slug/{slug}/</code>, it has the same functionality as the endpoint <code>organizers/{ID}</code> [96088]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added new REST API endpoint that allows looking up venues by slug instead of ID at the path <code>venues/by-slug/{slug}/</code>, it has the same functionality as the endpoint <code>venues/{ID}</code> [96088]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added <code>slug</code> to the REST API responses for organizer and venue data [96088]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added <code>slug</code> to the REST API parameters allowed to use when inserting or updating an organizer or event [96088]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added action: <code>tribe_events_venue_save</code> [96069]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added action: <code>tribe_events_organizer_save</code> [96069]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added filter: <code>tribe_events_rest_venue_prepare_postarr</code> [96069]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added filter: <code>tribe_events_rest_organizer_prepare_postarr</code> [96069]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Old <code>tribe_rest_venue_data</code> filter was passing the venue and the event two the second parameter because of the duplication. Now it has the second parameter as $venue, third parameter as $event if event ID was provided [96090]</li>
<li>Language &#8211; 5 new strings added, 30 updated, 0 fuzzied, and 0 obsoleted</li>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Added new <code>tribe_events_rest_use_inclusive_start_end_dates</code> filter so that users can make the REST API return events from a more literal date range [90005]</li>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove net import scheduled notes for on domand imports [79079]</li>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Tweaked some language in Event Aggregator&#8217;s metabox on individual edit-event screens to reduce confusion around the impact of the Update Authority on CSV imports [77957]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Fix PHP 7.1 compatibility with Event Aggregator (props @BJP NEALE) [90002]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added new filter: <code>tribe_events_force_filtered_ical_link</code>. This makes the &#8220;Export Events&#8221; URL more easily modifiable (thanks to @tdudley07 for highlighting this issue) [43908]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Made the &#8220;End of Day Cutoff&#8221; option better accommodate 24-hour and other time formats (thanks @festivalgeneral for bringing this issue to our attention!) [78621]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Made the options presented by the timezone selector filterable (via the newly added <code>tribe_events_timezone_choice</code> hook &#8211; our thanks to National University&#8217;s Marketing Department for this idea) [92909]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved integration with Twenty Seventeen &#8211; main events page now uses full height header when set to front page (thanks @uncovery for pointing this out) [89767]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Ensured REST API taxonomy endpoints are only registered in WordPress versions 4.7 and higher (thanks @dnaber-de for reporting this) [93227]</li>

<h4>[4.6.3] 2017-11-02</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent JS error when adding a Pro widget in the WP Customizer screen [72127]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where the value of an event&#8217;s &#8220;Show Google Maps Link&#8221; option would not properly affect the displaying of the link on List View (props: @etechnologie) [75547]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Added some more specification to our jquery-ui-datepicker CSS to limit conflicts with other plugins and themes [90577]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Improve shortcode pagination/view change url so it is reusable (props: @der.chef and others) [70021]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure the <code>tribe_json_ld_{type}_object</code> filter is available to make modifications of event, venue and organizer JSON LD data possible (thanks to Mathew for flagging this problem) [89801]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Improved JSON LD output for events by outputting the correct UTC offset where required (our thanks to Nina and many others for flagging this issue) [78233]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Fixed some display issues for the event schedule details (props @mia-caro)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved the clarity of and amount of context for some linked post labels to make translation of those labels a little easier and more nuanced (props @hnacc and others) [88589]</li>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjusted linked posts selector HTML to improve compatibility with Batcache [92049]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved datepicker handling so an end date on or later than the start date can always be selected [89825]</li>

<h4>[4.5] 2017-05-01</h4>
<ul>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Create a global ID to increase consistency on all of the imported items with Event Aggregator [75218]</li>

<li>Fix &#8211; Categories and Tags are no longer cleared when importing with Event Aggregator (thank you @Nicolas for the report) [74264]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Increase consistency on Column Mapping for CSV imports [76476]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added filters for REST API: <code>tribe_events_rest_url_prefix</code>, <code>tribe_rest_url</code>, <code>tribe_events_rest_use_builtin</code>, <code>tribe_rest_events_archive_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_event_max_per_page</code>, <code>tribe_rest_event_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_venue_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_organizer_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_event_categories_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_event_tags_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_event_taxonomy_term_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_event_featured_image</code>, <code>tribe_events_rest_api_enabled</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added filters for REST API Documentation: <code>tribe_rest_swagger_cost_details_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_date_details_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_image_details_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_image_size_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_term_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_event_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_organizer_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_venue_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_documentation</code></li>

<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added Google Maps API key field in the Settings tab to avoid map timeouts and errors on larger sites (Thanks to Yan for reporting this!)</li>

<li>Feature &#8211; Added an oEmbed template for events</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Improve performance of a query used to determine if there are free/uncosted events (Thank you @fabianmarz for the pull request!)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for attaching custom post types to events</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved filtering of the <code>tribe_event_featured_image()</code> function (Cheers to @fabianmarz!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add an encoding class for the CSV importer to prevent non utf8 characters from preventing imports (Thanks to screenrage for the report!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved our JSON-LD output to ensure consistency (Props to @garrettjohnson and Lars!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Language files in the <code>wp-content/languages/plugins</code> path will be loaded before attempting to load internal language files (Thank you to user aafhhl for bringing this to our attention!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Switch to HTTPS for the &#8220;Powered by The Events Calendar&#8221; link (Thank you Cynthia for reporting this!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Switch to using HTTPS by default for interactions with Google Maps API</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved filterability of calendar excerpts by introducing the new <code>tribe_events_get_the_excerpt</code> filter hook</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved filtering of organizer details when importing by CSV (Props to @Geir for bringing this up!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjustments for single event view in Twenty Fifteen theme</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved performance of query used to test for events without any cost</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added missing semicolon to a laquo (Props to mwender on GitHub for the fix!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improve the &#8220;stickiness&#8221; of CSV import column mappings (Thank you @jamesgol!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Consistency of JSON-LD markup improved (Cheers to @garrettjohnson for the help!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Avoid notice-level errors when working with WP CLI on a site where The Events Calendar is also active (Thanks to @sun)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Corrected the spelling of timezone in the CSV Importer&#8217;s event field</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated venue and organizer templates to use the new architecture for attaching custom post types to events</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Move plugin CSS to PostCSS</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Category default view is now set to <code>default</code> in place of hardcoding the current default view in the category base rewrite rule [31907]</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; <code>Tribe__Events__PUE__Checker</code>, <code>Tribe__Events__PUE__Plugin_Info</code>, and <code>Tribe__Events__PUE__Utility</code> classes are deprecated and are replaced by <code>Tribe__PUE__Checker</code>, <code>Tribe__PUE__Plugin_Info</code>, and <code>Tribe__PUE__Utility</code> classes</li>
<li>Fixed &#8211; Changed the use of <code>have_posts()</code> in the maybe iCal links for the main views that could cause an infinite loop</li>
<li>Accessibility &#8211; Focus styles added for search fields</li>
<li>Accessibility &#8211; Add ARIA labels for Month/Day/List sub nav</li>

<h4>[4.1.3] 2016-04-28</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Month View single days are now ordered as follows: sticky events, ongoing multi-day events, all day events, then start time. In other words, all events should be ordered as you&#8217;d expect when viewing events in Month View.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Updated the compatibility of CSV importer with WordPress 4.5 due to a change in the <code>post_status</code> filter. This will help prevent some of the errors you may have seen when importing events using a CSV file.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added new event names for AJAX success to the List, Month, and Day views to help The Events Calendar&#8217;s compatibility with our other premium plugins.</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.1.2] 2016-04-11</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removed an unneeded hook that attempted to add a query argument to event tag links</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved an issue where events marked as &#8220;sticky&#8221; would not display as such in Month View</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Dashes, hyphens, or whatever you like to call them in the events archive slug no longer breaks the URL</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; The notice that pops up when a conflicting &#8220;events&#8221; page exists can now be dismissed</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.1.1.1] 2016-04-07</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security &#8211; Tightened up security with post type link filtering (props to Nadal Soler for reporting this issue!)</li>
<li>Security &#8211; Tightened up security around tribe bar submissions (props to Paul Mynarsky for reporting this issue!)</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.1.1] 2016-03-30</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved bug where array notices were output on single event pages when venues were not set (props to zaxiscreative for reporting this issue!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where the Month View in mobile sizes retained the long day-of-week names when the abbreviations should have been used (props to Lucy for the bug report!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where a &#8220;0&#8221; was added to the default Venue name when creating a new event</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed notice that caused Ajax requests to fail (props to cgrymala on WP.org for reporting this!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Removed quotes from around TZID-specified timezones in iCal feeds which causes problems with some parsers (props to factory44 for reporting the issue that lead to this fix)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved various capitalization issues with German translations (props to oheinrich in our forums for pointing out this issue!)</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.1.0.1] 2016-03-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved multiple issues with the German <code>de_DE</code> language file that caused a number of site-breaking issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.1] 2016-03-15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added a tribe_get_venue_website_url() function for fetching Venue website URLs (props to fervorcreative in our forums for this request!)</li>
<li>Performance &#8211; Lazy-load venue and organizer selector data</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Allow iCal filenames to be filtered via a new filter: tribe_events_ical_feed_filename</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added a hook to allow single day queries in month view to be filtered: tribe_events_month_daily_events_query_args</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved the logic around rebuilding known date ranges</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Always show the &#8220;Merge Duplicates&#8221; button for venues and organizers in the Events General Settings page</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Allow the &#8220;same slug&#8221; notice to be dismissed and fix some text in that message</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Ignore alpha/beta/rc suffixes on version numbers when checking template versions</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add a filter for month view daily events query: tribe_events_month_daily_events_query_args</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added a more flexible cost range parsing function</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Obfuscate license keys Events &gt; Help &gt; System Information</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed a fatal that sometimes occurred when refreshing the import CSV page</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where some characters were not escaped appropriately for month and year formats</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Added missing tribe-loading@2x.gif</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed a warning produced by passing a DateTime() object into start_date or end_date args of tribe_get_events (props to iamhexcoder for the pull request!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where events in month view were not always sorted in chronological order</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed the System Info URL in Events &gt; Help</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where the default country would be &#8220;Array&#8221; if no default country is set</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where ajaxurl was sometimes undefined</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.7] 2016-03-02</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolve display issues on templates with Jetpack and a few themes</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Mobile breakpoints on month view working with custom breakpoints</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Reordering Venue and Organizer metadata no longer breaks titles</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevented notices from happening when using <code>the_title</code> filter</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; iCal links now will respect categories on the first page</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent third-party bugs with SEO plugins when inserting events programmatically</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Organizer information is showing up again correctly</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Modified the add-on license validation method to better explain what is happening</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Description on mobile views now have the correct class attribute on HTML</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Added missing semicolon on the list navigation for &#8220;&amp;laquo&#8221;</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.6] 2016-02-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjust injection of event data into the_content from priority 10 to 9 for better 3rd-party plugin compatibility</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change mobile month view selector to load event details below the calendar for better theme compatibility</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Better handling of edge cases on the post_excerpt for List View</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removal of generic CSS classes like <code>.updated</code> and <code>.published</code></li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent Notices from appearing when using <code>tribe_get_organizer()</code></li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Make HTML Single Event Pages valid</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Numeric named categories URLs are now fully working</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Event Title now Accepts HTML on Tooltips</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Licenses Tab now will work with <code>DISALLOW_FILE_MODS</code> (Props to Sun for spotting and fixing this)</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.5] 2016-01-15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security &#8211; Security fix with Venues and Organizers (props to grantdayjames for reporting this!)</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.4] 2015-12-23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Including the latest embedded Event Tickets release for backward compatibility</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.3] 2015-12-22</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjust single-event.php template to allow the &#8220;Time&#8221; title and content to be filterable (Props to Sitecrafting for highlighting this issue!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue with an overly escaped Event Category edit URL that prevented editing categories (Thanks to Ian for the first report of this issue!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where clicking on columns on the Events listed in the Admin Dashboard were ALWAYS sorted by Event start/end date before sorting by the column selected (Cheers to Corrado for bringing this to our attention!)</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.2] 2015-12-16</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adding better support for non-numeric cost values on events (Props to Mirja for highlighting this!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Avoid notice level errors when advanced events list widget settings are saved (Thank you Johan for reporting the issue!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improve messaging in the same-slug warning message (Thanks to Simon for bringing this to our attention!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Hook to Event Tickets to inject event dates into ticket emails</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adding better support for default venues (Props to Karly for noting this!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improve handling of internationalized slugs (Cheers to Oliver for the help!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure the past events list displays the correct events when accessed via ajax (Thank you Jesse for highlighting this!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Support ordering by venue/organizer within event queries (Thank you Doug for bringing this to our attention!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where events with the same date/time would sometimes be excluded from single-event navigation (Cheers to JeremyEnglert for the tip!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where events set with the explicit cost of 0 were not showing as &#8220;Free&#8221; (Thank you terrizsolo for reporting this!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where the datepicker in Twenty Sixteen was really ugly</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where using Quick Edit on events caused the table columns in the event list to become jumbled on save (Props to A K for the report!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved bug where category links sometimes included event category 1 (Thank you Anthony for the original report of this problem!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed a settings page URL (Props to Kristy for the heads up!)</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.1] 2015-12-10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add a warning message for major updates</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; For SEO reasons, use an h1 for the title rather than an h2 (props to wpexplorer for this fix)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Target the calendar view grid in JS using a simpler selector</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved WP 4.4 related fatal on the Nav Menu page that prevented the admin footer from rendering/enqueuing JS</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved bug where visiting /events/upcoming could sometimes result in an infinite redirect loop</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Removed <code>wp_trim_excerpt</code> and use only it&#8217;s powers, fixing the excerpt problem</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where the mobile calendar view did not display the date for the date being viewed</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where the admin toolbar&#8217;s Events &gt; Import &gt; CSV did not link to the CSV importer page</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where the events list in the admin dashboard were not ordered in an intuitive manner</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved bug where sorting by event category or tag resulted in an error</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where full event content text was displayed where excerpts should have been displayed</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where events imported via CSV were excluded from single event navigation</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where /events/list would sometimes 404 on a new install</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved bug where multiday all-day events displayed the end date as one day later than it should be when the End of Day Cut-off was set to something other than 12am</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Timezone handling fixed within generated iCal feeds</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0] 2015-12-02</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security &#8211; A TON of escaping was added to our codebase thanks to the efforts of the always-helpful Andy Fragen (@afragen)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Moved the Ticket framework code into its own plugin (event-tickets)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; The event cost now supports more international formats with the addition of the tribe_events_cost_separators filter (Thank you remokrol for bringing this to our attention!)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for the twentysixteen theme</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Created a new Add-Ons tab in Settings so that TEC add-ons can have a consolidated settings tab</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Improve the date formats UI by providing example output for each selected format</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Restructured TEC&#8217;s core settings code for reusability with other standalone plugins like Event Tickets</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Deprecate old JS event names in favor of a new JS event naming standard. Example: deprecated tribe_ev_runAjax in favor of run-ajax.tribe</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Consolidated import pages for TEC and add-ons</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; When suggesting a UTF-8 compatibility CSV formatting tool, point to one that still exists</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added the ability to filter attendees CSV items via tribe_events_tickets_attendees_csv_items (Props to @bostondv on GitHub for this patch!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated all excerpt output to use tribe_events_get_the_excerpt() to ensure a consistent display of excerpt content (Cheers to Joseph to pointing this out!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add support for wp_get_document_title in response to the WordPress 4.4 deprecation of wp_title</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Check post creation permissions before letting users create venues and organizers from the event meta box</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Only display data separators between fields that have data when rendering organizers (Thank you Bud for highlighting this issue!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; When a user cannot create organizers, prevent the auto-selection of organizers when editing an event</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove microformat CSS classes from templates and replace with namespaced content-relevant CSS classes</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Changed the &#8220;updated&#8221; CSS class to &#8220;tribe-updated&#8221; so that it is properly namespaced (Thank you vijayrajesh!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; The Plugin Update Checker will now auto-save valid plugin keys (Thanks to Denon for originally bringing this up!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Cleaned up the output of JSON-LD data. Filterable via the new tribe_google_data_markup_json filter</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Drop the use of the generic CSS class &#8220;placeholder&#8221; in favor of &#8220;tribe-event-placeholder&#8221; (Thanks to Marc on the forums!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjusted the CSS padding on Admin Menu items for Events</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Various codesniffer fixes</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; tribe_get_venue_link() no longer echoes if you ask it to return an <a> element</a></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Error messages for empty Venue names</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improve our responsiveness for the widget mini calendar, allowing smaller sidebars.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; No longer retrieve empty costs when fetching all costs for all events</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change the priority of bootstrapping the-events-calendar to ensure it occurs before any of the TEC addons in the event some addons are upgraded to v4.0 later than TEC</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjust the logic used for adding a noindex/follow tag to event views</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; No longer hiding default address fields when default venues are selected when Pro is active</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where the iCal feed did not provide an appropriately formatted timezone in some cases (Cheers to Matt for the report!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Added support for translating some previously untranslatable strings (Props to tititou36, media325, and Stef!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevented duplicate CSS IDs on the mini calendars (Cheers to Corrado for the help!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing tribe_get_single_ical_link() and tribe_get_ical_link() to use the same URL when it shouldn&#8217;t (Props to Ben Byrne @drywall on Twitter for the heads up!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where the &#8220;Add another organizer&#8221; text wasn&#8217;t using the correct singular label (Thank you MIKE for the report!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Various CSS fixes for twenty(ten-fifteen)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Improved our handling of <code>get_current_screen()</code> across the plugin, avoiding notices and warnings (Thank you Mike for the help!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where accessing object properties on a non object errored out when saving event meta (props to @dalethedeveloper on GitHub for this fix!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where organizer ID meta attached sometimes included a blank record. That blank record is no longer returned in tribe_get_organizer_ids()</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed error message returned when tabbing away from a blank event name meta box so that it properly indicates that an event name is required (Our thanks to @tapan29bd for this fix!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where Timezone event start/end date property name strings were malformed which guaranteed a a call to get_post_meta for Timezone date strings</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed CSS issue where the month view calendar could sometimes extend beyond the edge of the page when Skeleton Styles were enabled</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed a problem where iCal data was generated with incorrect dates in the case of some all days events (thanks to Matt for highlighting this)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved a problem causing the previous month view to appear when it should not</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue in mobile month view where date was missing from heading</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue that caused /events/ to 404 if it was visited on a new install before hitting &#8220;Save&#8221; on the Events &gt; Settings &gt; Display page</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; The Tribe__Events__Main::defaultValueReplaceEnabled() method is being deprecated in favor of tribe_get_option(&#8216;defaultValueReplace&#8217;). Schedules for removal in v4.5</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; The tribe_event_link() has been deprecated in favor of tribe_get_event_link(). Scheduled for removal in 5.0</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; The third parameter of tribe_get_organizer_link() (the $echo parameter) has been deprecated and is scheduled for removal in 5.0</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Abstract_Deactivation in favor of Tribe__Abstract_Deactivation</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Admin__Helpers in favor of Tribe__Admin__Helpers</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__App_Shop in favor of Tribe__App_Shop</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Autoloader in favor of Tribe__Autoloader</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Cache in favor of Tribe__Cache</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Cache_Listener in favor of Tribe__Cache_Listener</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Changelog_Reader in favor of Tribe__Changelog_Reader</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Credits in favor of Tribe__Credits</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Date_Utils in favor of Tribe__Date_Utils</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Field in favor of Tribe__Field</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Settings in favor of Tribe__Settings</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Settings_Tab in favor of Tribe__Settings_Tab</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Support in favor of Tribe__Support</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Template_Part_Cache in favor of Tribe__Template_Part_Cache</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Tickets__Attendees_Table in favor of Tribe__Tickets__Attendees_Table in the event-tickets plugin</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Tickets__Metabox in favor of Tribe__Tickets__Metabox in the event-tickets plugin</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Tickets__Ticket_Object in favor of Tribe__Tickets__Ticket_Object in the event-tickets plugin</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Tickets__Tickets in favor of Tribe__Tickets__Tickets in the event-tickets plugin</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Tickets__Tickets_Pro in favor of Tribe__Tickets__Tickets_Handler in the event-tickets plugin</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Validate in favor of Tribe__Validate</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__View_Helpers in favor of Tribe__View_Helpers</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::OPTIONNAME in favor of Tribe__Main::OPTIONNAME</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::OPTIONNAMENETWORK in favor of Tribe__Main::OPTIONNAMENETWORK</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::addHelpAdminMenuItem() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::add_help_admin_menu_item()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::addNetworkOptionsPage() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::add_network_options_page()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::array_insert_after_key() in favor of Tribe__Main::array_insert_after_key()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::array_insert_before_key() in favor of Tribe__Main::array_insert_before_key()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::debug() in favor of Tribe__Debug::debug()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::defaultValueReplaceEnabled() in favor of tribe_get_option( &#8216;defaultValueReplace&#8217; )</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::doHelpTab() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::do_help_tab()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::doNetworkSettingTab() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::do_network_settings_tab()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::doSettingTabs() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::do_setting_tabs()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::do_licenses_tab() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::do_licenses_tab()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::getNetworkOption() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::get_network_option()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::getNetworkOptions() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::get_network_options()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::getNotices() in favor of Tribe__Notices::get()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::getOption() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::get_option()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::getOptions() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::get_options()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::have_addons() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::have_addons()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::isNotice() in favor of Tribe__Notices::is_notice()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::pluginDir in favor of Tribe__Events__Main::plugin_dir</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::pluginName in favor of Tribe__Events__Main::plugin_name</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::pluginPath in favor of Tribe__Events__Main::plugin_path</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::pluginUrl in favor of Tribe__Events__Main::plugin_url</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::removeNotice() in favor of Tribe__Notices::remove_notice()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::renderDebug() in favor of Tribe__Debug::render()</li>

<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::setNetworkOptions() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::set_network_options()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::setNotice() in favor of Tribe__Notices::set_notice()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::truncate() in favor of tribe_events_get_the_excerpt()</li>

<li>Deprecated &#8211; tribe_event_end_of_day() in favor of tribe_end_of_day()</li>

<h4>3.x and previous</h4>
<p>For release notes from the 3.x and older lifecycles, see our <a href="https://theeventscalendar.com/category/products/release-notes/" rel="nofollow">full historical release notes</a>.</p>
