Velocity Minify";s:4:"slug";s:20:"fast-velocity-minify";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.2.8";s:6:"author";s:50:"<a href="http://fastvelocity.com">Raul Peixoto</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/alignak";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.6";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:96;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:86;i:4;i:2;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:3;i:1;i:1;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:93;s:15:"support_threads";i:27;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:26;s:10:"downloaded";i:391649;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-02-21 1:13pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2016-06-21";s:8:"homepage";s:23:"http://fastvelocity.com";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2866:"<p>This plugin reduces HTTP requests by merging CSS &amp; Javascript files into groups of files, while attempting to use the least amount of files as possible. It minifies CSS and JS files with PHP Minify (no extra requirements).</p>
<p>Minification is done in real time and done on the frontend only during the first uncached request. Once the first request is processed, any other pages that require the same set of CSS and JavaScript will be served that same static cache file.</p>
<p>This plugin includes options for developers and advanced users, however the default settings should work just fine for most sites.</p>
<h4>Aditional Optimization</h4>
<p>I can offer you aditional <code>custom made</code> optimization on top of this plugin. If you would like to hire me, please visit my profile links for further information.</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<ul>
<li>Merge JS and CSS files into groups to reduce the number of HTTP requests</li>
<li>Google Fonts merging and optimization</li>
<li>Handles scripts loaded both in the header &amp; footer separately</li>
<li>Keeps the order of the scripts even if you exclude some files from minification</li>
<li>Supports localized scripts (https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/wp_localize_script)</li>
<li>Minifies CSS and JS with PHP Minify only, no third party software or libraries needed.</li>
<li>Option to use YUI Compressor rather than PHP Minify (you you have &#8220;exec&#8221; and &#8220;java&#8221; available on your system).</li>
<li>Option to defer JavaScript and CSS files.</li>
<li>Stores the cache files in the uploads directory.</li>
<li>View the status and logs on the WordPress admin page.</li>
<li>Option to Minify HTML for further improvements.</li>
<li>Ability to turn off minification</li>
<li>Ability to turn off CSS or JS optimization seperatly (by disabling either css or js processing)</li>
<li>Ability to manually ignore scripts or css</li>
<li>Support for conditional scripts and styles</li>
<li>Support for multisite installations</li>
<li>Support for gzip_static on Nginx</li>
<li>Support for the CDN Enabler plugin</li>
<li>Auto purging of cache files on W3 Total Cache, WP Supercache, WP Rocket, Wp Fastest Cache, Cachify, Comet Cache, Zen Cache, LiteSpeed Cache, Nginx Cache (by Till Kr√ºss ), SG Optimizer, Godaddy Managed WordPress Hosting and WP Engine (read the FAQs)</li>
<li>Support for preconnect and preload headers</li>
<li>and some more&#8230;</li>
</ul>
<h4>Notes</h4>
<ul>
<li>The JavaScript minification is by <a href="https://github.com/matthiasmullie/minify" rel="nofollow">PHP Minify</a></li>
<li>The alternative JavaScript minification is by <a href="http://yui.github.io/yuicompressor/" rel="nofollow">YUI Compressor</a></li>
<li>Compatible with Nginx, HHVM and PHP 7. </li>
<li>Minimum requirements are PHP 5.5 and WP 4.4, from version 1.4.0 onwards</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:318:"<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory or upload the zip within WordPress</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the <code>Plugins</code> menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Configure the options under: <code>Settings &gt; Fast Velocity Minify</code> and that&#8217;s it.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:14583:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory or upload the zip within WordPress</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the <code>Plugins</code> menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Configure the options under: <code>Settings &gt; Fast Velocity Minify</code> and that&#8217;s it.</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>How can I exclude certain assets by wildcard?</h4>
<p>
<p>Each line on the ignore list will try to match a substring against all CSS or JS files, for example: <code>//yoursite.com/wp-content/plugins/some-plugin/js/</code> will ignore all files inside that directory. You can also shorten the url like <code>/some-plugin/js/</code> and then it will match any css or js url that has <code>/some-plugin/js/</code> on the path. Obviously, doing <code>/js/</code> would match any files inside any &#8220;/js/&#8221; directory and in any location, so to avoid unexpected situations please always use the longest, most specific path you can use.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why is the ignore list not working?</h4>
<p>
<p>The ignore list may be working, just try to use partial paths (see wildcard help above) and use relative urls only without any query vars.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why are there several or lot&#8217;s of JS and CSS files listed on the status page, or why the cache directory takes so much space?</h4>
<p>
<p>Well, some sites and themes have a combined CSS size above 1+ MB, so when you have 200 files, that&#8217;s 200+ MB.<br />
Different pages may need different JS and CSS files per page, post, category, tag, homepage or even custom post types, but if the requirements never change and you always load the exact same files on every page, you won&#8217;t see as many files. Likewise, if you have some dynamic url for CSS or JS that always changes in each pageview (the query var for example), you must add it to the ignore list (else it will generate a new cache file every pageview).</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I update plugins and themes?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, but it&#8217;s recommended that you purge the cache (from the plugin status page) in order for the merging and minification cache files to be regenerated and for you to be sure the updates went smoothly. The plugin will also try to automatically purge some popular cache plugins, however we still recommend that you purge all caches on your cache plugin / server (whatever you use) &#8220;after&#8221; purging Fast Velocity Minify cache.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with other caching plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>You must disable any features on your theme or cache plugins, that perform minification of css, html and js.<br />
The plugin will try to automatically purge several popular cache plugins, however we still recommend you to purge all caches (on whatever you use) if you also  manually purge the cache on the plugin settings for some reason.<br />
The automatic purge is active for the following plugins and hosting: W3 Total Cache, WP Supercache, WP Rocket, Wp Fastest Cache, Cachify, Comet Cache, Zen Cache, LiteSpeed Cache, SG Optimizer, Godaddy Managed WordPress Hosting and WP Engine</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it resource intensive, or will it use too much CPU on my shared hosting plan?</h4>
<p>
<p>No it&#8217;s not. On the first run, each single file is minified into an intermediate cache. When a new group of files is found, it reuses those files and merges them into a new static cache file. All pages that request the same group of CSS or JS files will also make use of that file.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with multisites?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, it generates a new cache file for every different set of JS and CSS requirements it finds.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with Adsense and other ad networks?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin is compatible with any add network but also depends on how you&#8217;re loading the ads into the site. We only merge and minify css and javascript files enqueued in the header and footer that match your own domain name&#8230; which would exclude any external ads. If you&#8217;re using a plugin that uses JS to insert the ads on the page, there could be issues. Please report on the support forum if you found such case.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>After installing, why did my site feels slow to load?</h4>
<p>
<p>The cache regeration happen&#8217;s once per url or if the included CSS + JS files change. If you need the same set of CSS and JS files in every page, the cache file will only be generated once and reused for all other pages, however if you have a CSS or JS that is generated dynamically and uses a time based query string, (url changes on every pageview), you must add it to the ignore list by wildcard.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How do I use the precompressed files with gzip_static on Nginx?</h4>
<p>
<p>When we merge and minify the css and js files, we also create a <code>.gz</code> file to be used with <code>gzip_static</code> on Nginx. You need to enable this feature on your Nginx configuration file if you want to make use of it.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Where is the YUI Compressor option gone to?</h4>
<p>
<p>This functionality depends on wheter you have exec and java available on your system and PHP can detect it or not. It will be visible on the basic Settings page under the JavaScript Options section and it&#8217;s available for JS files only.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>After installing, why are some images and sliders not working?</h4>
<p>
<p>a) You cannot do double minification as it will break things, so make sure you have disabled any features on your theme or other plugins, that perform minification of css, html and js files.</p>
<p>b) Are you trying to use the defer JS or CSS options, without understanding exactly how it works? Be advised that most themes do not work properly with those options on.</p>
<p>c) The plugin relies on PHP Minify to minify javascript and css files, however it&#8217;s not a perfect library and there are plugins that are already minified and do not output a min.js or min.css name and end up being minified again. Try to disable minification on JS and CSS files and purge the cache.</p>
<p>d) Sometimes a plugin conflicts with another when merged. Try to disable CSS processing first and see if it works. Try to disable JS processing second and see if it works. Try to disable HTML minification last and see if it works. If one of those work, you know there&#8217;s a conflict.</p>
<p>e) If you have a conflict, try to add each CSS and each JS to the ignore list, one by one until you find the one that causes the conflict. If you have no idea which files to add, check the log file on the status page for a list of files.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why are some of the CSS and JS files not being merged ?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin only processes (same domain) JS and CSS files enqueued using the official method outlined here: https://developer.wordpress.org/themes/basics/including-css-javascript/</p>
<p>Some developers enqueue all files properly but may still &#8220;print&#8221; conditional tags directly in the header, while they should be following the example as explained on the codex: https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/wp_script_add_data/</p>
<p>Because &#8220;printing CSS and JS tags on the header and footer is evil&#8221; (seriously), we cannot capture those files and merge them together.</p>
<p>There are also specific ways to enqueue files meant to be loaded for IE users only, mobile users, desktop users, printers, etc, else those may be merged together and break things. There is a blacklist and default ignore list on the PRO tab because of this.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I load CSS async, get the critical path or why is there a flash of unstyle content when I enable this?</h4>
<p>
<p>This is an advanced option for highly skilled developers. Do not try to fiddle with these settings if you are not one, as it will almost certainly break your site layout and functionality.</p>
<p>Loading CSS async only works properly and consistently, when you have one single CSS file being generated and your critical path is generic enough to be common on all pages.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How to undo all changes done by the plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin itself doesn&#8217;t do any &#8220;changes&#8221; to your site and all original files are untouched. It intercepts the enqueued CSS and JS files, processes and hides them, while enqueuing the newly optimized cached version of those files. As with any plugin, simply disable or uninstall the plugin, purge all caches you may have in use (plugins, server, cloudflare, etc) and the site will go back to what it was before installing it. The plugin doesn&#8217;t delete anything from the database or modify any of your files.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why is it that even though I have disabled or deleted the plugin, the design is still broken?</h4>
<p>
<p>Some &#8220;cheap&#8221; or so called &#8220;optimized&#8221; hosting providers, implement a misconfigured and agressive cache on their servers, and then are also &#8220;smart&#8221; enough to ignore your multiple cache purge requests if those are too frequent.</p>
<p>Some providers use a &#8220;deploy system&#8221;, where you upload / replace / delete the files via sftp, but those are not reflected on the live site immediatly. This means that in some cases, you can delete your whole wordpress instalation via sftp, and the site still works perfectly fine even after purging the cache.</p>
<p>You may have deleted the physical files from the disk, but that&#8217;s either just some random storage they gave you and that they sync to the main server every few hours, or it may be the actual live server but with a file cache layer on top of it (so the old code keeps running even though you have deleted the files).</p>
<p>The only solution is to contact your hosting company and ask them why you have deleted the plugin and purged your cache, but the live site doesn&#8217;t reflect the changes.</p>
<p>Providers well known to have this issue are hostgator and iPage (please report others if you find them).</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why is my Visual Composer, or Page Editor not working ?</h4>
<p>
<p>Some plugins and themes need to edit the layout and styles on the frontend. When they need to do that, they enqueue several extra js and css files that are caught by this plugin and get merged together, when in fact those need to load seperatly. If you encounter such issue of your page editor not working on the frontend, kindly enable the &#8220;Fix Page Editors&#8221; and purge your caches.</p>
<p>This option hides all optimization from logged in users, so it&#8217;s as iff the plugin has been disabled. Not logged in users and search engines, still see the optimized version.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How should I use the &#8220;Preload Images&#8221; and what is it for?</h4>
<p>
<p>Certain themes and plugins, either load large images or sliders on the homepage. Most of them will also load &#8220;above the fold&#8221; causing the &#8220;Prioritize visible content&#8221; or the &#8220;Eliminate render-blocking JavaScript and CSS in above-the-fold content&#8221; message on pagespeed insights.</p>
<p>While this may not work when the images are large, you can use the &#8220;Preload Images&#8221; for the first relevant images that load above the fold, such as the logo or the first image of a slider. Please note however, this is for images that show up in all pages, not just the homepage.</p>
<p>Don&#8217;t put too many images here as those are downloaded in high priority and it will slow down the rest of the page load.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>What are the recommended cloudflare settings for this plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>On the &#8220;Speed&#8221; tab, deselect the Auto Minify for JavaScript, CSS and HTML as well as the Rocket Loader option as there is no benefit of using them with our plugin (we already minify things).</p>
<p>Those options can also break the design due to double minification or the fact that the Rocket Loader is still experimental (you can read about that on the &#8220;Help&#8221; link under each selected option on cloudflare).</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>I have a complaint or I need support right now. Why haven&#8217;t you replied to my topic on the support forum yet?</h4>
<p>
<p>Before getting angry because you have no answer within a few hours (even with paid plugins, sometimes it takes weeks&#8230;), please be informed about how wordpress.org and the plugins directory work.</p>
<p>The plugins directory is an open source, free service where developers and programmers contribute (on their free time) with plugins that can be downloaded and installed by anyone &#8220;at their own risk&#8221; and are all released under the GPL license.</p>
<p>While all plugins have to be approved and reviewed by the wordpress team before being published ( for dangerous code, spam, etc ) this doesn&#8217;t change the license or add any warranty. All plugins are provided as they are, free of charge and should be used at your own risk (so you should make backups before installing any plugin or performing updates) and it&#8217;s your sole responsability if you break your site after installing a plugin from the plugins directory.</p>
<p>Support is provided by plugin authors on their free time and without warranty of a reply, so you can experience different levels of support level from plugin to plugin. As the author of this plugin I strive to provide support on a daily basis and I can take a look and help you with some issues related with my plugin, but please note that this is done out of my goodwill and in no way I have any legal or moral obligation for doing this. I&#8217;m also available for hiring if you need custom made speed optimizations (check my profile links).</p>
<p>For a full version of the license, please read: https://wordpress.org/about/gpl/</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I get support or report bugs?</h4>
<p>
<p>You can get support on the official wordpress plugin page at: https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/fast-velocity-minify<br />
You can also see my profile and check my links if you wish to hire me for custom speed optimization on wordpress or extra features.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I donate to the plugin author?</h4>
<p>
<p>If you would like to donate any amount to the plugin author (thank you in advance), you can do it via Paypal at https://goo.gl/vpLrSV</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>

";s:11:"screenshots";s:533:"<ol><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/fast-velocity-minify/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=1650011"><img files.</p></li><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/fast-velocity-minify/assets/screenshot-2.png?rev=1655584"><img src="https://ps.w.org/fast-velocity-minify/assets/screenshot-2.png?rev=1655584" alt="The CSS, JavaScript and HTML.";s:13:"download_link";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.8.zip";s:11:"screenshots";a:2:{i:1;a:2:{s:3:"src";s:73:"https://ps.w.org/fast-velocity-minify/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=1650011";s:7:"caption";s:48:"You can view the logs and purge the cache files.";}i:2;a:2:{s:3:"src";s:73:"https://ps.w.org/fast-velocity-minify/assets/screenshot-2.png?rev=1655584";s:7:"caption";s:18:"The settings page.";}}s:4:"tags";a:5:{s:8:"gtmetrix";s:8:"gtmetrix";s:9:"pagespeed";s:9:"pagespeed";s:10:"php-minify";s:10:"PHP Minify";s:7:"pingdom";s:7:"pingdom";s:14:"yui-compressor";s:14:"YUI Compressor";}s:8:"versions";a:10:{s:5:"2.2.0";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.0.zip";s:5:"2.2.1";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.1.zip";s:5:"2.2.2";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.2.zip";s:5:"2.2.3";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.3.zip";s:5:"2.2.4";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.4.zip";s:5:"2.2.5";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.5.zip";s:5:"2.2.6";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.6.zip";s:5:"2.2.7";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.7.zip";s:5:"2.2.8";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.8.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:1:{s:2:"1x";s:73:"https://ps.w.org/fast-velocity-minify/assets/icon-128x128.jpg?rev=1440946";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}}s:12:"a3-lazy-load";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:12:"a3 Lazy Load";s:4:"slug";s:12:"a3-lazy-load";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.8.7";s:6:"author";s:47:"<a href="https://a3rev.com/">a3rev Software</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/a3rev";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.6";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:88;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:62;i:4;i:2;i:3;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:1;i:7;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:76;s:15:"support_threads";i:21;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:5;s:10:"downloaded";i:303650;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-03-26 5:50am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2014-12-20";s:8:"homepage";s:0:"";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:8034:"<p>a3 Lazy Load is a Mobile Oriented, very simple to use plugin that will speed up sites page load speed. The more content heavy your site the better the plugin will perform and the more you will see the improvements in performance. See <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/stresstest1000img.htm" rel="nofollow">this demo</a> of a page with 1,000 images (yes 1,000 images) to load.</p>
<p>a3 Lazy Load is inspired by and powered by the ressio <a href="https://github.com/ressio/lazy-load-xt" rel="nofollow">Lazy-Load-xt JavaScript</a>.</p>
<p>a3 Lazy Load is the most fully featured, incredibly easy to set up lazy load plugin for WordPress. Use the plugins admin settings to easily define what elements are lazy loaded and when they become visible in the users browser. As the user scrolls down the page the next lot of elements you have applied lazy Load to are only loaded as they become visible in the view port.</p>
<h4>IMAGE LAZY LOAD</h4>
<p>Images are the number one element that slows page load and increases bandwidth use. From the a3 Lazy Load admin panel turn load images by a3 Lazy Load ON | OFF. For more flexibility when ON you can choose to ON | OFF lazy load for images in</p>
<ul>
<li>Post, Pages and Custom Post Types (All Content areas)</li>
<li>Widgets (Sidebar, header and footer)</li>
<li>Apply to post thumbnails</li>
<li>Apply to gravatars</li>
</ul>
<h4>MORE THAN JUST IMAGES</h4>
<h4>VIDEO LAZY LOAD</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load supports all WordPress video Embeds including Youtube, Vimeo and HTML5 video &#8211; for a full list see the <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Embeds" rel="nofollow">WordPress Codex Embeds</a> list. The WordPress embed method of copying and pasting the video url into posts and pages content area is fully supported.</p>
<p><strong>Note</strong> &#8211; Works with Videos added by Text and HTML Widgets but not the new WordPress Video widget. That widget does not pull iframe at first load, it use JavaScript to replace html to iframe and hence a3 lazy Load can&#8217;t see it to apply.</p>
<p>From the a3 lazy Load admin panel turn Video Support ON | OFF. When ON you can choose to ON | OFF lazy load for videos in</p>
<ul>
<li>Video embeded by URL in Post and Pages (All Content areas)</li>
<li>Video in Widget types, Text Widget and HTML Wigets.</li>
<li>Youtube <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/youtube-iframe.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>Video <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/video-html5.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>Fully Compatible with the popular <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/youtube-embed/">Youtube Embed Plugin</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>iFRAME LAZY LOAD</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load has built in support for content that is added by iframe from any source in content and widgets. Examples</p>
<ul>
<li>WordPress embedded media</li>
<li>Facebook Like boxes with profiles, Like buttons, Recommend</li>
<li>Google+ Profile</li>
<li>Google Maps</li>
</ul>
<h4>POST EMBED</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fully compatible with WordPress embed post on any site feature introduced in version WP version 4.4</li>
<li>Makes embed post load much faster</li>
</ul>
<h4>WORDPRESS AMP</h4>
<ul>
<li>Built in auto support for WordPress AMP plugin</li>
<li>Built in support for Better AMP plugin</li>
<li>There are no setting options for exclude /amp &#8211; Lazy Load is just never applied to the /amp endpoint</li>
<li>When the url is loaded in browser without /amp Lazy Load is applied </li>
</ul>
<h4>ADVANCED CUSTOM FIELDS</h4>
<p>Fully compatible with the very popular Advanced Custom Fields plugin, Free and Premium versions.</p>
<h4>LAZY LOAD EFFECTS</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load gives you the option to lazy load images with a FADE IN or SPINNER effect</p>
<ul>
<li>FADEIN <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/fadein.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>SPINNER <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/spinner.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>Option to create a custom Lazy Load pre-load background colour</li>
</ul>
<h4>WOOCOMMERCE</h4>
<p>a3 lazy Load is built and tested to be fully compatible with the very widely used WooCommerce plugin</p>
<h4>PERFORMANCE TWEAKS</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load gives you the option to load its script from your sites HEAD or from the FOOT.</p>
<ul>
<li>Note that your theme must have the wp_footer() function if you select FOOTER load.</li>
<li>Note the plugin CSS is always loaded from the HEAD.</li>
</ul>
<h4>EXCLUDE IMAGES &amp; VIDEO</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load allows you to easily exclude any image or video by class name from having the Lazy Load effect applied. <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/a3-lazy-load/#faq-header">See FAQ&#8217;s</a></p>
<h4>JAVASCIPT DISABLED FALLBACK</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load has built in Noscript fallback if user has JavaScript turned off in their browser. Developers who use underscore.js in their applications can use the Noscript parameter to exclude their plugins content from Lazy Load.</p>
<h4>THEME &amp; PLUGIN COMPATIBILITY</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load works with any WordPress theme that follows the WordPress Theme Codex. However, many Theme &amp; Plugin developers will use a custom written function to add objects, example the theme has a home page with layout created by a custom function they have written. a3 Lazy Load cannot know what these functions are and so cannot apply to the objects loaded by that custom function.</p>
<p>If your images or objects not being Lazy Loaded in a certain section of your site, but are Lazy Loaded everywhere else you will know this is the cause. Please if this happens raise a support ticket with the developer, explaining that they just need to add a simple tag to their custom functions so that a3 Lazy Load apply to their custom function and be fully compatible. <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/a3-lazy-load/#faq-header">Here is a list</a> of a3 lazy Load filter tags to include in your ticket to make it easy for the developer.</p>
<p>Don&#8217;t forget when a developer does add full compatibility with a3 Lazy Load please let us know via a support ticket on this forum and we will add them to the list below.</p>
<p>These are just some of the more popular plugins that are either tested 100% compatible with a3 Lazy Load or tags has been added for 100% compatibility.</p>
<ul>
<li>Plugin &#8211; Advanced Custom Fields</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WooCommerce</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WP Offload</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WP Super Cache and W3 Total Cache plugins</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; Youtube Embed</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WordPress AMP</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WPTouch. Note &#8211; Set to not apply on Mobiles if WPTouch is installed</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; MobilePress &#8211; Set to not apply on Mobiles if MobilePress is installed</li>
<li>Plugins &#8211; Will not conflict with any plugin that has lazy load built in</li>
<li>CDN&#8217;s &#8211; Cloudfront, Cloudflare and all other known CDN architecture.</li>
</ul>
<h4>MORE FEATURES</h4>
<ul>
<li>Full support of jQueryMobile framework</li>
<li>WordPress Multi site ready.</li>
<li>Backend support for RTL display.</li>
<li>Translation ready</li>
</ul>
<h4>JOIN THE a3 LAZY LOAD COMMUNITY</h4>
<p>When you download a3 lazy Load, you join our community. Regardless of if you are a WordPress newbie or experienced developer if you are interested in contributing to a3 Lazy Load development head over to the <a href="https://github.com/a3rev/a3-lazy-load" rel="nofollow">a3 Lazy Load GitHub Repository</a> to find out how you can contribute.<br />
Want to add a new language to a3 Lazy Load? Great! You can contribute via <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/a3-lazy-load" rel="nofollow">translate.wordpress.org</a></p>
<h3>USAGE</h3>
<ol>
<li>Install and activate the plugin</li>
<li>Open WordPress Settings menu</li>
<li>Click on a3 Lazy Load menu</li>
<li>Turn ON Lazy Load and all preferred settings</li>
<li>Save Changes and enjoy the improved performance Lazy Load will give your site</li>
</ol>
";s:12:"installation";s:186:"<h4>Minimum Requirements</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 4.6 or greater</li>
<li>PHP version 5.6.0 or greater</li>
<li>MySQL version 5.6 or greater OR MariaDB version 10.0 or greater</li>
</ul>
";s:3:"faq";s:2173:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<h4>Minimum Requirements</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 4.6 or greater</li>
<li>PHP version 5.6.0 or greater</li>
<li>MySQL version 5.6 or greater OR MariaDB version 10.0 or greater</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>How do I exclude individual objects from Lazy Load?</h4>
<p>
<p>Use this built in class name to exclude lazy load on individual images, videos and iframes.<br />
    a3-notlazy</p>
</p>
<h4>Why are some images, videos, objects not Lazy Loaded?</h4>
<p>
<p>a3 Lazy Load can only be applied to objects that are added using core WordPress functions. If your theme or a plugin developer adds objects such as images or videos via a custom written function, a3 lazy Load cannot know what that custom function is and hence cannot Lazy Load the object.</p>
<p>So if you see object not being lazy loaded please check first if those objects are loaded by the theme or a plugin. If they are, you can be confident that they are loaded by a custom function.</p>
<p>If this is the case, please help yourself and other a3 lazy Load users by raising a support ticket with the developer and ask them to add an a3 Lazy Load filter tag to their function to allow a3 Lazy Load to find it and apply to the object.</p>
<p>Below is a list of available a3 Lazy Load filters to use and pass onto the developer.</p>
</p>
<h4>Filter tags to apply lazy load</h4>
<p>
<p>Apply lazy load for images in content.<br />
    a3_lazy_load_images<br />
Example:<br />
    apply_filters( &#8216;a3_lazy_load_images&#8217;, $your_content, null );</p>
<p>Apply lazy load for videos and iframe from content.<br />
    a3_lazy_load_videos<br />
Example:<br />
    apply_filters( &#8216;a3_lazy_load_videos&#8217;, $your_content, null );</p>
<p>Apply lazy load for all images, videos and iframe from content<br />
    a3_lazy_load_html<br />
Example:<br />
    apply_filters( &#8216;a3_lazy_load_html&#8217;, $your_content, null );</p>
</p>
<h4>Filter Tags to Exclude by Theme Class name</h4>
<p>
<p>Filter tags to add to class name of theme to exclude lazy load on images or videos.<br />
    a3_lazy_load_skip_images_classes<br />
    a3_lazy_load_skip_videos_classes</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:18299:"<h4>1.8.7 &#8211; 2018/03/24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Maintenance Update. 2 code tweaks to enhance the lazy loading of images, video and iframe added by third party shortcodes in the content</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Increase lazy load filter priority value so that lazy load is applied to images loaded by the shortcode function do_shortcode </li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Increase lazy load filter priority value so that lazy load is applied to video and iframe loaded by the shortcode function do_shortcode</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.6 &#8211; 2018/03/24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Maintenance Update. 1 bug fix from this morning 1.8.5 major maintenance release. A small piece of new code in v 1.8.5 was written on PHP v7 and is not compatible with PHP version 5.6 If you are running v PHP 5.6 please run this update to fix it</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; PHP Fatal Error Call instance a3_lazy_load instead of us $this is not an object caused by incompatibility with PHP version 5.6</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.5 &#8211; 2018/03/23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Maintenance Update. Refactor of Lazy Load on Widgets, Full Compatibility with the Advanced Custom Fields plugin, optimization tweaks and 3 bug fixes.</li>
<li>Refactor &#8211; Apply lazy load to all widgets instead of Text Widget and HTML widget from WordPress</li>
<li>Refactor &#8211; Remove the code that hook to tag &#8216;wp_get_attachment_image_attributes&#8217; which was required to add support for lazy load for [gallery] shortcode. Redundant after WP version 4.6.0 and now removed.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add filter to acf_the_content tag for apply lazy load on the Content from ACF plugin. Kudos to @ondoheer for creating full compatibility with ACF Free and Premium version. </li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Disable load new google fonts via API. Google fonts not used and saves 4 calls to database on each page load. Thanks to Robert Harm for reporting the issue</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Optimized loading gif compression for even faster load. Thanks @jasom for the suggestion</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove duplicate parameters from plugin scripts. Thanks to @galbaras for reporting the issue</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add new FAQs tab to plugins page with Add Lazy Load Tags to custom Function description and exclude Lazy Load Class name for easy reference.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update plugins description</li>
<li>Framework &#8211; Define filter tag for enable OR disable load new google fonts via API</li>
<li>Framework &#8211; Update plugin framework to new version 2.0.3</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Turn Image in Widget OFF option which had stopped working. Thanks to @japenz and @dimitar-koev for reporting and confirming the bug</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; If videos embed have preload=none do not call video load from a3 Lazy Load. Thanks to Celso Azevedo @celsoazevedo for an excellent bug report which enabled us to replicate the issue.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Remove src with placeholder image url for iframe</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.4 &#8211; 2018/02/13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Maintenance Update. Under the bonnet tweaks to keep your plugin running smoothly and is the foundation for new features to be developed this year </li>
<li>Framework &#8211; Update a3rev Plugin Framework to version 2.0.2</li>
<li>Framework &#8211; Add Framework version for all style and script files</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update for full compatibility with a3rev Dashboard plugin</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Test for compatibility with WordPress 4.9.4</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.7.1</h4>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress major version 4.5</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.0 &#8211; 2016/03/01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Full compatibility with AMP plugin. No settings for it just hardcoded that Lazy Load is not applied for any url appended with /amp endpoint. Lazy load is applied to the url without the endpoint</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Define new &#8216;Background Color&#8217; type on plugin framework with ON | OFF switch to disable background or enable it</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Define new function &#8211; hextorgb() &#8211; for convert hex color to rgb color on plugin framework</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Define new function &#8211; generate_background_color_css() &#8211; for export background style code on plugin framework that is used to make custom style</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Saved the time number into database for one time customize style and Save change on the Plugin Settings</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Replace version number by time number for dynamic style file are generated by Sass to solve the issue get cache file on CDN server</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Define new &#8216;strip_methods&#8217; argument for Uploader type, allow strip http/https or no</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Upgraded to the latest version of a3 plugin framework</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress version 4.4.2</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WooCommerce version 2.5.2</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Define new placeholder image data for iframe. Microsoft browsers smartscreen filter was blocking the .gif placeholder loading inside iframes and throwing an unsafe website message</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.0 &#8211; 2016/01/22</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add support for Lazy loading images, video or iframe inside content that is loaded by AJAX</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Full support for loading Product Thumbnails within the WooCommerce cart widget</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress version 4.4.1</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WooCommerce version 2.5</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.2 &#8211; 2015/12/24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change on enqueue styles and scripts for faster load</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Register new script &#8216;jquery-lazyloadxt-srcset&#8217; for enqueue when lazyload script is called , full support for WP 4.4 Responsive Images</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Filter for change the &#8216;srcset&#8217; attribute name to &#8216;data-srcset&#8217; name to prevent browsers loading the image while page is loading</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Create a new script for when image comes into view port that it changes &#8216;data-srcset&#8217; to &#8216;srcset&#8217; so image is loaded then by lazy load</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.1 &#8211; 2015/12/11</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change the placeholder image name from &#8216;placeholder.gif&#8217; to &#8216;lazy_placeholder.gif&#8217; to avoid conflict if thumb image has name like placehoder.gif</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change pattern parameter from &#8220;/data-src=[&#8216;\&#8221;]/is&#8221; to &#8220;/ data-src=[&#8216;\&#8221;]/is&#8221; to check &#8216;data-src&#8217; exists as attribute of video, image, iframe, Solve the issue when 3rd party script adds attribute with format of name &#8216;***-data-src&#8217; to html tag.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Use preg_match( &#8220;/src=.*lazy_placeholder.gif[&#8216;\&#8221;]/s&#8221;, $imgHTML ) On themes that have loop code was causing loading of the placeholder instead of the image</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.0 &#8211; 2015/12/10</h4>
<ul>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress major version 4.4</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Check if &#8216;HTTP_USER_AGENT&#8217; is defined before call it from strpos</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4.1 &#8211; 2015/08/22</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; include new CSSMin lib from https://github.com/tubalmartin/YUI-CSS-compressor-PHP-port into plugin framework instead of old CSSMin lib from http://code.google.com/p/cssmin/ , to avoid conflict with plugins or themes that have CSSMin lib</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; make __construct() function for &#8216;Compile_Less_Sass&#8217; class instead of using a method with the same name as the class for compatibility on WP 4.3 and is deprecated on PHP4</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; change class name from &#8216;lessc&#8217; to &#8216;a3_lessc&#8217; so that it does not conflict with plugins or themes that have another Lessc lib</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Plugin Framework DB query optimization. Refactored settings_get_option call for dynamic style elements, example typography, border, border_styles, border_corner, box_shadow</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress major version 4.3.0</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update the plugin framework for setup correct default settings on first installed</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update the plugin framework for reset to correct default settings when hit on &#8216;Reset Settings&#8217; button on each settings tab</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4.0 &#8211; 2015/06/17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Plugin framework Mobile First focus upgrade</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Massive improvement in admin UI and UX in PC, tablet and mobile browsers</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Introducing opening and closing Setting Boxes on admin panels.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added Plugin Framework Customization settings. Control how the admin panel settings show when editing.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added House Keeping &#8211; Clean up on Deletion function. ON | OFF switch is in the Plugin Framework Settings Box.  </li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added a 260px wide images to the right sidebar for support forum link, Documentation links.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WooCommerce Version 2.3.11</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removed Add-Ons Menu</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Moved plugin menu from WordPress Dashboard admin menu to a sub menu on the WordPress Settings menu</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added Settings link to the plugins listing on plugin.php menu for easy access to plugin</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Check &#8216;request_filesystem_credentials&#8217; function, if it does not exists then require the core php lib file from WP where it is defined</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.3.0 &#8211; 2015/06/05</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added Image Load Threshold with set threshold pixel dynamic setting. Default is 0px</li>
<li>Credit &#8211; Thanks to <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/setting-threshold?replies=3" rel="nofollow">Onisforos and Matt Pain</a> for suggesting and explaining the new Threshold feature</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Security Hardening. Removed all php file_put_contents functions in the plugin framework and replace with the WP_Filesystem API</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Security Hardening. Removed all php file_get_contents functions in the plugin framework and replace with the WP_Filesystem API</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.2.1 &#8211; 2015/05/26</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update url of dynamic stylesheet in uploads folder to the format <code>//domain.com/</code> so it&#8217;s always is correct when loaded as <code>http</code> or <code>https</code></li>
<li>Credit &#8211; Thanks to WordPress member hero12 for bringing the matter <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/css-is-not-loaded-properly-on-https?replies=1" rel="nofollow">to our attention</a>.</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.1.0 &#8211; 2015/01/23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for all WordPress video Embeds including Youtube, Vimeo and HTML5 video</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for content that is added by iframe from any source in post and page content and widgets</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added ON | OFF option for Noscript parameter for both images and video and iframes &#8211; fallback if user does not have JavaScript support turned on in browser.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Reworked the plugins admin panel for new feature options. Separate settings for Images and Video / iframes</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated all the admin panel text and add new help text.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated the plugins WordPress description with new features.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated the plugins WordPress screenshot</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated the plugins WordPress banner image.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Updated &#8216;a3_lazy_load_enable&#8217; function to edit their image or video attribute to enable a3 lazy load images or videos loaded by 3rd party application.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_image_enable&#8217; function to edit image attribute to enable a3 lazy load to apply images loaded by 3rd party applications.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_video_enable&#8217; function to edit image attribute so a3 lazy load script can apply to the videos, iframe.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Include &#8216;var a3_lazyload_params = {&#8220;apply_images&#8221;:&#8221;1&#8243;,&#8221;apply_videos&#8221;:&#8221;1&#8243;};&#8217; JavaScript variable into frontend that get the option that are set from admin panel. Plugin and Theme developers can use that variable inside own script to check when Lazy Load apply for Image and for Video instead of use &#8216;a3_lazy_load_video_enable&#8217; and &#8216;a3_lazy_load_video_enable&#8217; functions in PHP code</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Remove &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_classes&#8217; filter tag, we will replace another filter for separate filters for image and videos</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_images_classes&#8217; filter tag. Developers can add another class css name for images that they don&#8217;t want lazy load applied too.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_videos_classes&#8217; filter tag. Developers can add another class css name for video that they don&#8217;t want lazy load applied too.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added default exclude class &#8216;a3-notlazy&#8217; so developers can easily apply it to videos that they don&#8217;t want Lazy Load to apply to.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_videos&#8217; filter. Plugin and Theme developers can use this filter and parse the content with videos or iframe and the filter will return content with change on videos or iframe that a3 Lazy Load support</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.2 &#8211; 2015/01/20</h4>

<li>Dev &#8211; Add new parameter $noscript boolen type for &#8216;a3_lazy_load_html&#8217; and &#8216;a3_lazy_load_images&#8217; filters to exclude or include noscript from content return of 3rd party plugins.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added default exclude class &#8216;a3-notlazy&#8217; so developers can easily apply it to images that they don&#8217;t want Lazy Load to apply to.</li>

</ul>

solutions are stuck in the past, complex and unwieldy. The Publisher helps you save time, worry less and provides a cutting edge listening experience for your audience.</p>
<p>Official Site: <a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">publisher.podlove.org</a></p>
<h4>Video Tutorial: Getting started with Podlove Publisher</h4>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/Hmrm-jUe6u4?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span>
<h4>Compatible Feeds</h4>
<p>The Publisher makes it easy to create highly expressive, efficient and super compatible podcast feeds with fine grained control over client behavior (e.g. GUID control to replace faulty episodes and for clients to reload) supporting all important meta data.</p>
<h4>Multi-Format Publishing</h4>
<p>The Publisher also makes multi-format publishing &#8211; embracing all modern and legacy audio and video codecs &#8211; a snap. By adopting simple file name conventions, the plugin allows the podcaster to provide individual feeds for certain use cases or audiences without adding work for the podcaster during the publishing process.</p>
<h4>Optimized Web Player</h4>
<p>The Publisher also comes with integrated with the Podlove Web Player plugin (which you do not need to install separately) and fully support its advanced options including multiple audio (MP4 AAC, MP3, Vorbis, Opus) and video (MP4 H.264, WebM, Theora) format support for web browsers. This Web Player is fully HTML5 compatible (but provides Flash fallback for ancient environments) and is ready for all touch based clients too.</p>
<h4>Chapter Support</h4>
<p>The Publisher also makes it easy to publish chapter information in the player to make access to structured episodes even easier. Full support for linking directly to any part of your podcast on the web with instant playback included.</p>
<h4>Flexible Templates</h4>
<p>To round it all up, a flexible template system enables you to published Podcasts in a defined fashion and change the style at any time without having to touch your individual postings later on.</p>
<p>And this is just the beginning. We have a rich roadmap that will bring even more interesting features: integration with helpful services, much improved timeline metadata support (show notes) and much more.</p>
<h4>Further Reading</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Publisher</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Project</a></li>
<li><a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Community</a></li>
<li><a href="http://docs.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Documentation</a></li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues" rel="nofollow">Bug Tracker</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podlove.org/donations/" rel="nofollow">Donate</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Development of the plugin is an open process. The current version is available <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher" rel="nofollow">on GitHub</a> Feel free to contribute and to fix errors or send improvements via GitHub.</p>
<p>Requires PHP 5.4+</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:410:"<ol>

<li>If downloaded as a zip archive, extract the Plugin folder to your desktop.</li>
<li>With your FTP program, upload the Plugin folder to the wp-content/plugins folder in your WordPress directory online.</li>
<li>Go to Plugins screen and find the newly uploaded Plugin in the list.</li>

";s:3:"faq";s:2474:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Download the Podlove Publisher Plugin to your desktop.</li>
<li>If downloaded as a zip archive, extract the Plugin folder to your desktop.</li>
<li>With your FTP program, upload the Plugin folder to the wp-content/plugins folder in your WordPress directory online.</li>
<li>Go to Plugins screen and find the newly uploaded Plugin in the list.</li>
<li>Click Activate Plugin to activate it.</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>Is Podlove Podcast Publisher free?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! The core features of Podlove Podcast Publisher are and always will be free. <a href="https://publisher.podlove.org/support/" rel="nofollow">Paid Professional Support</a> is available but not necessary to run the plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are there Download Statistics?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! Podcast Downloads can be tracked and analyzed. You can easily see how many people downloaded you podcast episodes, which clients they used, if they prefer to subscribe to the feed or listen on your website using the web player‚Äîand much more.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I host my podcast files?</h4>
<p>
<p>Any storage where you have control over the file naming is compatible with Podlove Podcast Publisher. You can manage files using a simple FTP/sFTP or use services like Amazon S3.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I ask questions and get support?</h4>
<p>
<p>Free support where questions are answered by the community is available in the <a href="http://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Community Forum</a>. There is a German community in the <a href="https://sendegate.de/" rel="nofollow">Sendegate</a>. <a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/support" rel="nofollow">Professional Support</a> by the plugin developer is also available.</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I help the project?</h4>
<p>
<p>The continued success of Open Source project relies on the community. There are many ways you can help:</p>
<ul>
<li>If you enjoy the plugin, please <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/reviews/#new-post" rel="nofollow">leave a review</a>.</li>
<li>You can answer questions of other fellow podcasters in the <a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Community</a>.</li>
<li>You can buy <a href="https://publisher.podlove.org/support/" rel="nofollow">Support</a> to financially support the project.</li>
</ul>
<p>This product includes GeoLite2 data created by MaxMind, available from http://www.maxmind.com.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:12072:"<h4>2.7.6</h4>
<p>No changes.</p>
<h4>2.7.5</h4>
<p><strong>Preparation for GDPR/DSGVO</strong></p>
<p>If you are using Podlove Publisher Tracking/Analytics, an update to this version is highly recommended.</p>
<p>Tracking uses a <code>request_id</code> to be able to determine when two requests came from the same user and should be counted as one unique access. This request id used to be a hash of the original IP address and the user agent. This approach however is vulnerable to a brute force attack to get the IP address back from the hash. Here&#8217;s what we are doing about that:</p>
<p>First, we anonymize the IP before generating the hash. So instead of using <code>171.23.11.209</code>, we use <code>171.23.11.0</code>.</p>
<p>Second, you need to deal with the existing <code>request_id</code>s. There is a new &#8220;DSGVO&#8221; section under &#8220;Tools&#8221; with a button that will rehash all existing <code>request_id</code>s with a randomly generated salt. That way it will become unfeasible to determine the original IP address but your analytics will stay the same.</p>
<p>In case you have a lot of downloads (let&#8217;s say much more than 50.000), you may want to do this via command line because that will be <em>much</em> quicker than via the tools section. You need <a href="https://wp-cli.org/" rel="nofollow">wp-cli</a>, then simply call <code>wp eval 'podlove_rehash_tracking_request_ids();'</code>. On a multisite, pass the blog id as a parameter: <code>wp eval 'podlove_rehash_tracking_request_ids(42);'</code>.</p>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>fix Podlove Subscribe Button language parameter</li>
<li>fix <code>rel="self"</code> link in show feeds</li>
<li>fix Podlove Subscribe Button not delivering show feeds</li>
<li>templates: handle episode.show access when there is no show</li>
<li>templates: allow episode filtering by show, for example: <code>{% for episode in podcast.episodes({show: "example"}) %}</code></li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.4</h4>
<p>No changes, but the previous release is not delivered correctly by WordPress, so this is simply a re-release attempt to fix it.</p>
<h4>2.7.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: geo database updater</li>
<li>update Podlove Web Player 2: remove Flash Fallback</li>
<li>update Podlove Web Player 4</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: <code>itunes:image</code> tag in show feeds</li>
<li>fix: &#8220;Debug Tracking&#8221; choosing wrong media files to check availability</li>
<li>enhancement: &#8220;Debug Tracking&#8221; now suggests disabling SSL-peer-verification if URL cannot be resolved and https is used</li>
<li>system report: include active plugins</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: PHP warning when the_title filter is called with only one parameter</li>
<li>fix: handle colons in migration tool</li>
<li>fix: PWP4 warning when using shortcode</li>
<li>new service: letterboxd</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.0</h4>
<p><strong>New Module: Shows</strong></p>
<p>With shows you can offer feeds to subtopics of your podcast. Here&#8217;s how it works: You create a show and define show meta, similar to a podcast: title, slug, subtitle, summary, image and language. These fields override your podcast settings. All other settings are the same as your podcast.</p>
<p>For each episode, you decide which show it&#8217;s in. Each show has its own set of feeds that listeners can subscribe to. The main feed remains unchanged, containing all episodes from all shows.</p>
<p>The Podlove Subscribe Button can be configured to subscribe to a show by referencing the show slug. Use the shortcode <code>[podlove-subscribe-button show="show-slug"]</code> or the template tag <code>{ podcast.subscribeButton({show: 'show-slug'}) }}</code>.</p>
<p>We do not recommend using Shows and Seasons at the same time.</p>
<p><strong>Updated Metadata for Podcast/Episode/Seasons according to iOS11 Specification</strong></p>
<p>Apple announced an <a href="http://podcasts.apple.com/resources/spec/ApplePodcastsSpecUpdatesiOS11.pdf" rel="nofollow">updated specification for feed elements</a>. These changes enable the Apple Podcasts app to present podcasts in a better way. But since these feed extensions are readable by any podcast client, we expect others to take advantage of these new fields soon. Here is how we implemented the specification:</p>
<ul>
<li>The podcast has a new &#8220;type&#8221; field where you can select between &#8220;episodic&#8221; and &#8220;serial&#8221;, which may affect the order of episodes. The field <code>&lt;itunes:type&gt;episodic&lt;/itunes:type&gt;</code> appears in the feed.</li>
<li>Episodes have a new &#8220;title&#8221; field. It defaults to the episode post title but can be set separately now, allowing you to define different titles for the website and podcast clients. The field <code>&lt;itunes:title&gt;Interview with Somebody Infamous&lt;/itunes:title&gt;</code> will appear in the feed.</li>
<li>Episodes have a new &#8220;type&#8221; field where you can select between &#8220;full&#8221; (default), &#8220;trailer&#8221; and &#8220;bonus&#8221;. This won&#8217;t have any effect in the Publisher but may be used by podcast clients. The field <code>&lt;itunes:episodeType&gt;full&lt;/itunes:episodeType&gt;</code> appears in the feed.</li>
<li>Episodes have a new &#8220;number&#8221; field. If used, <code>&lt;itunes:episode&gt;42&lt;/itunes:episode&gt;</code> will appear in the feed.</li>
<li>Episodes in seasons will have an <code>&lt;itunes:season&gt;2&lt;/itunes:season&gt;</code> field in the feed automatically.</li>
</ul>
<p>We decided to complement these changes by introducing a podcast mnemonic/abbreviation field. Now we can autogenerate blog episode titles, based on the episode number and title, if you like. The mnemonic can be set in podcast settings. The setting to autogenerate blog episode titles is an expert setting in the &#8220;Website&#8221; section.</p>
<p>To help existing podcasts to conform to these new fields we made a &#8220;Title Migration&#8221; module which will greet you with a notice once you update the Publisher. It will try to extract episode numbers and titles from your existing titles, saving you time and effort updating each episode one by one.</p>
<p><strong>Template API Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><code>episode.title</code> now returns the new episode title field, if it is set, but has a fallback to the post title. If you want a specific version, use <code>episode.title.clean</code> or <code>episode.title.blog</code>.</li>
<li>the post title of an episode can still be accessed via <code>episode.post.post_title</code></li>
<li>new accessor: <code>episode.number</code></li>
<li>new accessor: <code>episode.type</code></li>
<li>new accessor: <code>podcast.mnemonic</code></li>
<li>new accessor: <code>podcast.type</code></li>
<li>new accessor: <code>season.mnemonic</code></li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Podlove Web Player 4</strong></p>
<p>The Shortcode <code>[podlove-web-player]</code> accepts several parameters, increasing its versatility.</p>
<p>With <code>post_id</code> you can embed episodes on any page, for example <code>[podlove-web-player post_id="1234"]</code>.</p>
<p>Every <a href="http://docs.podlove.org/podlove-web-player/config.html" rel="nofollow">config parameter available</a> can be overridden using shortcode attributes. The only difference from the linked documentation page is the notation. For nested configs like <code>show.title</code> use underscores (<code>_</code>) instead. For example, display a green player with custom title like this: <code>[podlove-web-player show_title="Special Title" theme_main="#00ff00"]</code></p>
<p>You can now also display a player with <em>live content</em> like this: <code>[podlove-web-player mode="live" audio_0_url="http://mp3.theradio.cc/" audio_0_mimeType="audio/mp3" title="Livestream" link="https://theradio.cc"]</code></p>
<p>You can choose to deliver Podlove Player via Podlove CDN (Content Delivery Network) or via your WordPress server. CDN is the default for new setups but if you are already using Podlove Publisher we continue delivering Podlove Player via your WordPress server unless you explicitly change it.</p>
<p>Podlove Web Player 4 is the new default player.</p>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>analytics: show download totals for last 24 hours and last 7 days in overview</li>
<li>Podigee Player: add support for transcripts
<ul>
<li>create a Podigee Transcript asset</li>
<li>set this asset in Expert Settings &gt; Web Player</li>
<li>See https://cdn.podigee.com/ppp/samples/transcript.txt for an example transcript</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Podlove Web Player 4: support contributors</li>
<li>player settings: when no episode or files are available, use a &#8220;Podlove&#8221; demo sound</li>
<li>reduce Podlove Template Cache duration from 1 day to 1 hour for the following change:</li>
<li>new template accessor: <code>{{ episode.total_downloads }}</code></li>
<li>New in &#8220;Global Feed Settings&#8221;: An option for how the episode title should be displayed. It defaults to &#8220;Blog Post Title&#8221;, so that after the iOS 11 title migration, the output does not actually change &#8212; following the principle of least surprise. However, the setting can be changed to &#8220;Episode Title&#8221;, which is the new clean title, or &#8220;Custom Template&#8221;, which is a title template with the same capabilities as the blog post title template.</li>
<li>when using the Podlove Subscribe Button CDN and the CDN is not reachable, fall back to the locally hosted script</li>
<li>fix Geo DB Updater: use our own Podlove CDN as download source</li>
<li>fix quotes in contributor fields</li>
<li>fix WordPress conditionals in episode archives</li>
<li>fix deleting related episodes (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/907" rel="nofollow">#907</a>)</li>
<li>fix network admin bar now does not include broken links if Publisher is not activated network-wide (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/933" rel="nofollow">#933</a>)</li>
<li>fix import getting stuck issue (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/910" rel="nofollow">#910</a>)</li>
<li>Bitlove module: remove all frontend functionality because it has been dysfunctional for a long time </li>
<li>fix Auphonic module showing wrong status message after file upload</li>
<li>fix Audacity chapter import when times contain commas</li>
<li>fix email notification issue where not emails were sent (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/938" rel="nofollow">#938</a>)</li>
<li>fix feed redirect issue for HTTP/1.0 clients</li>
<li>fix network module: only activate when the plugin is activated network-wide, not when the plugin in active within a multisite</li>
<li>fix calculation of contribution counts</li>
<li>Fix various issues in the download table display. Until now, new downloads were calculated hourly, which provides a good estimate but often not exact numbers. The calculation could also get stuck, leading to missing data display. From now on, the estimates are still calculated hourly but additionally <em>a full, precise aggregation is done once a day</em>, which should lead to more consistent numbers overall.</li>
<li>enhance email error reporting</li>
<li>enhance open graph module: detects WP SEO plugin and does not output any tags to avoid conflicts</li>
<li>social services: add SlideShare</li>
<li>show warning if upload directory is not fully qualified</li>
<li>remove download section from default template (because it is included in PWP4)</li>
<li>image cache: instead of returning invalid URLs with 0 width and 0 height when something goes wrong, return the source URL instead</li>
<li>episode list: add display option to display episode number as a column<br />
add Liberapay as donation service</li>
<li>display current season in episode form</li>
</ul>
<p>Changes for previous versions can be found in the <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/blob/master/changelog.txt" rel="nofollow"><code>changelog.txt</code></a>.</p>

Web Player";s:4:"slug";s:18:"podlove-web-player";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.1.0";s:6:"author";s:46:"<a href="http://podlove.org/">Podlove Team</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:45:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/gerritvanaaken";s:8:"requires";s:5:"3.4.0";s:6:"tested";s:6:"4.6.11";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:60;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:3;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:3;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:7;s:15:"support_threads";i:2;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:26579;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2016-10-20 2:22pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2012-07-03";s:8:"homepage";s:38:"http://podlove.org/podlove-web-player/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2371:"<p>This is part of the ‚ÄúPodlove‚Äù initiative for a better podcasting experience. See <a href="http://podlove.org" rel="nofollow">podlove.org</a> for more information.</p>
<p>There are basically four ways to use the Podlove Web Player:</p>
<h3>1) as a Standalone Player</h3>
<p>You won‚Äôt need any of the PHP or WordPress files in this package. Just stick to &#8220;standalone.html&#8221; and see how it‚Äôs done there. Maybe you want to build your very own CMS plugin. If so ‚Äì let us know!</p>
<h3>2) manual WordPress shortcodes</h3>
<p>Use a simple shortcode in your posts and pages, and the Podlove Web Player will appear, playing any media file you want to assign. Basic usage:</p>
<p>[podloveaudio src=&#8221;http://mysite.com/mymedia.mp3&#8243; duration=&#8221;03:33&#8243; title=&#8221;My track&#8221;]</p>
<h3>3) WordPress enclosures</h3>
<p>The WordPress plugin searches for media enclosures in your existing posts and renders a web player automatically. Works like a charme, even for Blubrry PowerPress users.</p>
<h3>4) as part of the Podlove Podcast Publisher</h3>
<p>This player is bundled with the <a href="http://podlove.org/podlove-podcast-publisher" rel="nofollow">‚ÄúPPP‚Äù project</a> and should be automatically rendered, so you don‚Äôt have to worry about anything.</p>
<h3>Credits</h3>
<p>The Podlove Web Player is built from the <a href="http://podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Team</a>.</p>
<p>It uses sources from <a href="http://mediaelementjs.com/" rel="nofollow">MediaElement.js</a>, <a href="http://jquery.com/" rel="nofollow">jQuery</a> and <a href="http://benalman.com/projects/jquery-hashchange-plugin/" rel="nofollow">jQuery hashchange event</a>.</p>
<p>The used icons are built in as fonts and provided by <a href="http://fortawesome.github.com/Font-Awesome/" rel="nofollow">Font Awesome</a>, <a href="http://zocial.smcllns.com/" rel="nofollow">Zocial</a>, <a href="http://somerandomdude.com/work/iconic/" rel="nofollow">Iconic</a>, <a href="http://aristeides.com/" rel="nofollow">Elusive</a>, <a href="http://designmodo.com/linecons-free/" rel="nofollow">Linecons</a>, <a href="http://www.entypo.com" rel="nofollow">Entypo</a>, <a href="http://www.justbenicestudio.com/studio/websymbols/" rel="nofollow">Web Symbols</a>, <a href="http://thedesignoffice.org/project/modern-pictograms/" rel="nofollow">Modern Pictograms</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:496:"<ol>
<li>Upload the <code>podlove-web-player</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the <code>Plugins</code> menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Use the <code>[podlovevideo]</code> or <code>[podloveaudio]</code> shortcode in your post or page with the options on the front page</li>
<li>Visit the options page</li>
<li>If you need help, go to the github repo https://github.com/podlove/podlove-web-player and use the issue tracker</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:6361:"
<h4>Where can i get help?</h4>
<p>
<p>Definitely not on wordpress.org<br />
If you need help, please go to our github repo<br />
You can find it at https://github.com/podlove/podlove-web-player</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I configure the player‚Äôs appearance?</h4>
<p>
<p>Just use the shortcode options that are described on this FAQ page!</p>
</p>
<h4>src</h4>
<p>
<p>This location of any audio or video file, local ore remote:</p>
<pre><code>[podloveaudio src="http://mysite.com/mymedia.mp3"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>type</h4>
<p>
<p>The media type of the resource:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo src="http://mysite.com/mymedia.m4v" type="video/mp4"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>mp4 / webm / ogg</h4>
<p>
<p>The location of a file with a specific video type:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo mp4="mymedia.mp4" webm="mymedia.webm" ogg="mymedia.ogv"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>mp4 / mp3 / ogg / opus</h4>
<p>
<p>[podloveaudio mp4=&#8221;mymedia.m4a&#8221; mp3=&#8221;mymedia.mp3&#8243; ogg=&#8221;mymedia.oga&#8221; opus=&#8221;mymedia.opus&#8221;]</p>
</p>
<h4>poster</h4>
<p>
<p>The location of the poster frame for the video (or cover image for the rich audio player):</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo poster="http://mysite.com/mymedia.png"]
[podloveaudio poster="http://mysite.com/mymedia.png"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>width / height</h4>
<p>
<p>The width and/or height of the video (or the audio player):</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo width="640" height="264"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>loop</h4>
<p>
<p>Loops the video or audio when it ends:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo src="http://mysite.com/mymedia.mp4" loop="true"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>preload</h4>
<p>
<p>Start loading the video as soon as possible, before the user clicks play. This might not work on all browsers.</p>
<pre><code>[podloveaudio preload="true"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>autoplay</h4>
<p>
<p>Start playing the video as soon as it&#8217;s ready. This might not work on all (mobile) devices.</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo autoplay="true"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>fullscreen</h4>
<p>
<p>Disables the fullscreen button for video:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo fullscreen="false"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>duration</h4>
<p>
<p>Enables display of duration without having to load the media file. Use seconds or timecode as a unit:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo duration="3522"]
[podloveaudio duration="00:58:42"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>alwaysShowHours</h4>
<p>
<p>Displays the time in 00:00:00 instead of 00:00. Default is &#8220;true&#8221;.</p>
<pre><code>[podloveaudio alwaysShowHours="false"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>alwaysShowControls</h4>
<p>
<p>Defines whether the player control bar is permanently visible. For videos, it might be suitable to fade the controls out when not hovering the video.</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo alwaysShowControls="false"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>volume</h4>
<p>
<p>Disables the volume slider:</p>
<pre><code>[podloveaudio volume="false"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>progress</h4>
<p>
<p>Disables the progress bar:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo progress="false"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>captions</h4>
<p>
<p>URL to a WebVTT captions file:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo captions="http://mysite.com/mymedia.vtt"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>chapters</h4>
<p>
<p>Takes chapter json string from the defined custom field (the standard WordPress ones) and builds an interactive chapter table. Can be referenced to an external json file, too. Chapters must be written in the following format:</p>
<p>[{<br />
  &#8220;start&#8221;: &#8220;00:00:00&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;title&#8221;: &#8220;foo&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;href&#8221;: &#8220;http://podlove.org&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;image&#8221;:&#8221;&#8221;<br />
},{<br />
  &#8220;start&#8221;: &#8220;00:01:00&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;title&#8221;: &#8220;lorem&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;href&#8221;: &#8220;https://github.com/podlove/&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;image&#8221;:&#8221;samples/coverimage-red.png&#8221;<br />
},{<br />
  &#8220;start&#8221;: &#8220;00:02:30&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;title&#8221;: &#8220;ipsum&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;href&#8221;: &#8220;https://github.com/shownotes/&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;image&#8221;:&#8221;samples/coverimage-green.png&#8221;<br />
},{<br />
  &#8220;start&#8221;: &#8220;00:03:00&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;title&#8221;: &#8220;end&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;href&#8221;: &#8220;&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;image&#8221;:&#8221;samples/coverimage-blue.png&#8221;<br />
}]</p>
<ul>
<li>&#8220;start&#8221; has to be defined as HH:MM:SS</li>
<li>&#8220;title&#8221; is the name of the chapter</li>
<li>&#8220;href&#8221; is an optional URL</li>
<li>
<p>&#8220;image&#8221; is an optional image URL or relative path</p>
<p>[podloveaudio chapters=&#8221;my_chapter_field&#8221;]<br />
[podloveaudio chapters=&#8221;http://mychapters.com/chapters.json&#8221;]</p>
</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>chaptersVisible / timecontrolsVisible / summaryVisible</h4>
<p>
<p>Defines the default visibility status of toggable player modules. Standard value is &#8220;false&#8221;.</p>
<pre><code>[podloveaudio chaptersVisible="true" timecontrolsVisible="false" summaryVisible="false"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>Rich Podlove Web Player player with meta information</h4>
<p>
<p>If you have an audio file and use one of the following attributes, the player will sport a richer visual experience: &#8220;title&#8221;, &#8220;subtitle&#8221;, &#8220;summary&#8221;, &#8220;poster&#8221;, &#8220;permalink&#8221;. Full example:</p>
<pre><code>[podloveaudio mp3="http://mysite.com/mymedia.mp3" ogg="http://mysite.com/mymedia.ogg" title="PWP ‚Äì First show" subtitle="We talk about this and that" summary="Here goes a summary of the episode which should be about 256 characters long" poster="http://mysite.com/mymedia.jpg" chapters="my_chapter_field" permalink="http://mysite.com/my-first-episode/"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>Podlove Web Player Shortcode in multiple lines</h4>
<p>
<p>Don&#8217;t do it, always write the shortcode in a single line.</p>
</p>
<h4>Deprecated usage</h4>
<p>
<p>Chapters now handed over as JSON, please take a look at the standalone.html. The previous solution will still work, however we recommend to use the new solution, as it offers some more features.<br />
Earlier versions of this plugin could handle alternative shortcodes, too: [audio] and [video]. As of version 1.1, these are deprecated as they conflict with other plugins.</p>
</p>
